name: Pension Topas
description: There is a nice common area, but only one power outlet. If you are not sleeping in your vehicle you might be asked to park your car outside. Not a lot of space, but it is possible to fit at least three small campers. Two toilets and shower are available, and there is a common area on a roof-covered terrace. WiFi, but only near the terrace. Excellent location a couple of minutes walk from the main plaza.

name: Hostal La Qhia
description: Great common area with wifi, power and hammocks. There is a kitchen and a fridge, the gas stove did not work when we stayed here. The bedrooms are upstairs have great views and are equipped with mosquito nets.

name: Laguna Yeguada
description: A beautiful lake, you can hike around it. There is a ranger at the gate from sunrise to sunset. There is a large rain shelter but you cannot pitch a tent in it due to the design.  They have bathrooms but no water available.

name: Hotel Marparaiso
description: The hotel has secure onsite parking. Breakfast and air conditioning is included in the price.

name: Riverbank wild camp
description: Good for a stopover. On the river bank, just before Chiriqui  Price: Free

name: Police station
description: The police in David. very sound.  Price: Free

name: Nelly's Beach Bar
description: $10/night, simple showers and toilets are available, parking lot next to the cabins, only 10m to the beach, wonderful beach with shade, good restaurant

name: Hotel Valle Verde
description: $20 per vehicle, faucet around back to fill water (next to shower) open field somewhat close to town. Peruvian Restaraunt is good.

name: Punta Chame
description: Gruesome biting flies! Otherwise, the space would be nice.  Price: Free

name: Balboa Yacht Club
description: Road at Balboa Yacht Club in Panama City. Not a great place, but ideally located to explore Panama City. Quiet, near the river.  Price: Free

name: Yacht Club Shelter Bay. West Colon
description: Overnight parking at the marina. Clean bathrooms and showers, pool, restaurant, no electricity, no wifi. Price: Varies, some stayed for free, others stayed the first night for free, then had to pay 20 USD.

name: Boquete Free Camp
description: Large gravel area off the road next to old bridge (weight limit 5t – although we went over it anyway). No facilities. Very quiet overnight. Free. Also spot down by river but not flat and only really suitable for smaller vehicles.

name: Las Lajas Beach Cabins
description: Camping right on beach between Cabanas. 10 USD per night. Power available from Cabanas, electricity and wifi included. Flush toilets and outdoor showers available. Non-potable water available. Very quiet. There is a bar and you can eat well here.  Power is only at 1-2 Places available or you have a Long wire

name: Hotel Country Inn & Suites by the Canal
description: If you don't feel like camping along the street of Balboa yachtclub this hotel is just beside and offers some luxury. Pool, gym, guest laundry, big parking lot. We booked via Expedia for USD 75.-- incl breakfast.

name: Playa Monagre, Pacific side
description: Vermüllter staying for the night. Is a meeting place for the youth. Loud music, lots of noise. No infrastructure.     Free.  Few kilometers to Chitre turn right and drive to the beach tar.

name: NP San Lorenzo
description:
*Moderator Note: Overnight camping/parking is NOT available at this location.
.....
Magnificent staying for the night directly at the Ford Very quiet. No infrastructure besides portable toilet box. No-one collected any fee although earlier posts suggest 10$ may apply. From the highway, turn left at the roundabout Colon, shortly after San Lorenzo is signposted.

name: DIJ Vehicle Inspection
description: This is where you have to go to get your vehicle inspected before you can ship it out of Panama. This is step one in the shipping process.

name: Part 1 - DIJ Vehicle Inspection for Exporting Vehicle
description:
Last updated: Sept 2023

There are two parts. This is the first part. See the other marker on iOverlander for the second part which happens the following day.

Open Monday to Friday. Closed on weekends.

Steps:

0. Check your TIP and ensure the VIN is identical to what you have on the TIP.
1. Arrive at the inspection site at around 6 a.m. but no later than 7 a.m.
(They only process 25 vehicles per day)
2. Find a parking spot outside the gated area.
3. When they open you will get in line. Have your documents ready. The person at the desk will write your vehicle information in a ledger and will compare the VIN from the TIP with the VIN from your documents.
3. The inspector will come and check your VIN (he will not inspect the engine number or the vehicle).

Copies Needed: 

2 x TIP
2 x title (and registration, if separate documents)
2 x Passport (photo page and page with your entry stamp)

Don't forget to bring the originals.

name: Water Taxi Parking
description: Right before the water taxi terminals (Bocas del Toro, 6$/25min) is a parking lot run by a local family. There are two areas, one is on their front yard which is fenced in and the other is a lot across the street which is not. Larger rigs have to stay across the street. They charge $3 a day to park and it is no extra charge to camp. They have two mean looking Dobermans that patrol the fenced yard at night. The first gate has a low overhead. Look for the second gate,  Southwest down the road 40 feet. Make sure they write down the overall quoted price when you get the ticket, or they may try to overcharge when leaving.

name: Santa Maria! (river bend)
description: Liked the wide open countryside, so decided to do a little google satellite boondock hunting... Found this clearing/fork in the road by the river through agricultural land. Saw a local on the drive in and confirmed that the road was public access (as it really seems like private farm roads). Great breeze and tons of birds during our stay.

name: Abernathy
description: Centro de pesca lancha y mar. Marine store that has some 12 volt accessories

name: Cangilones de Gualaca
description: Natural canyon and river you can swim in. There are some flat surfaces (grass and pavement) at the top of the canyon to park on. We stayed overnight and no one was out here. The next morning we jumped off the canyon into the water and swam for hours until others arrived. FREE!

name: IS International De Seguros
description: This is the place to extend your car insurance. Same company as the border.

name: Playa Las Lajas
description: Not many places to boondock in this small beach community but parked here at the end of the road next to the beach/garbage cans/broke down part of house. Quiet and safe. Beach is ok, somewhat dirty, but lots of islands around to explore by kayak, fresh seafood, snorkel and scuba trips.

name: Playa Albina Grande
description: Beach at the end of the paved road. Flat circular grass and sand area to park on, nice calm beach. No amenities out here. Private home to the left on the beach.

name: Playa Venao
description: Public access grass and sand lot right on the ocean. Quiet surfing beach with a few restaurants around. Could probably get wifi from one of them with the extender but we didn't try.

name: El Montesito Cabañas Y Ranchitos
description: great place to camp and rent cabinas, the owner is easy going and prices are cheap. 2 persons sleeping in the van and 2 others in a brand new cabina we paid 30$. with electricity and water

name: Happy Pet Vet
description: Dr Sam and Dr Patricia are an excellent husband and wife team, full service vets. English speaking. Inexpensive. They have dog food and other supplies. CLOSED SUNDAYS! 775 0501. Cells: 6948 1475, 6948 1476.

name: Alto De Piedra Central Touristico
description: Rents cabinas but allows camping in rigs. Area is landscaped with fruit trees, small pond and lawn. Cool and breezy due to altitude. Parking near the resturaunt/bar (that appear to be open infrequently). A few spaces suitable for tents but we didn't ask about tenting. Toilets, no functioning showers and water is available. Quiet at night. We paid $3 for camping.

name: Mirador Calle Hacia Rio Piedra Past SF Park Entrance
description: Free

name: Swimming Hole
description: Free swimming! On left side of road. Watch for blue sign and swimming is adjacent the next bridge curving right.

name: EcoVenao
description: Has campsites ($6 per person), dorm accommodations, double rooms w shared bath ($25 weekdays) and cabanas on stilts with outdoor bath shared w another cabana ($40 weekdays). 330 acre property is in a rainforest and across street from chill beach good for surfing.  Use of guest kitchen or can get inexpensive, excellent meals at their restaurant. We wanted to camp on the beach in our tent but its dumping rain. This place is an amazing alternative. A creek runs through the property and howler monkeys hang out nearby.

name: Santa Clara Beach Bar & Grill
description: Parking lot of a restaurant on the beach. Paid $5 for overnight. They lock the entrance gate at night and it opens at 9:00am. Quiet and mostly flat, some shade along the edges. Beach amenities like outdoor showers, palapas and bathrooms.

name: Turnout at Laguna Yeguada
description:
- free
- This is a a turnout at the road leading west from the park entrance (no fee required). Pretty quiet, almost no cars here during the day, none at night.
- The camping at the park is $5 entrance per person + $6 camping per person, while the entrance is valid only for the current day. Which is pretty stupid in out book, so we decided to camp elsewhere and visit the park in the morning, even though the camping itself was nice. In retrospect we shouldn't have paid for the park at all - there is nothing to see, except one smallish waterfall. No maps, no hiking trails.
- There was at least one more possible spot between here and the park entrance - starting at the entrance head west and after about 1 km on your right there is a steep dirt road leading down to the lake. The downside is that you are easily visible from the ranger's office/park entrance there, and the ranger specifically told us that this is a park area and we need to pay the entrance to be there. But you can try before talking to anybody, worst case you can move here afterwards.

name: Parking lot by the beach
description:
- officially 2 USD per car
- toilet would be 50 cents per person, we didn't bother
- beach not that clean

name: Behind Radisson Hotel
description:
- free camping behind the hotel (dead end street)
-access via road in front of hotel, not via the TGI Friday’s corner (this is a dead end before getting to the road you camp on)
- pretty fast wifi if you find the right place
- police came and said it was OK (we were two cars there)
- you are going to disappoint a couple of people that drive here to have sex in their car (but I am sure they will find another place)

name: Automotriz
description: Nice friendly and quick mechanic from Costa Rica. Charged us one fourth of what the Toyota dealership asked for.

name: Truck Stop
description: A good, cheap general mechanic for car maintenance. We got an oil change and our car checked. This entire street is full of auto car part stores and mechanics. Lots to choose from. We bought synthetic oil just 500 meters down the road at Repuestos Ideales.

name: Servicentro MON
description: This is a very large and down to earth mechanic shop that seems to offer all kinds of services. We got a small welding job done to make our camper handle lock more secure. They did the repair for free and we gave a tip. It seems like this highway corridor hosts most of the mechanical shops, part stores and dealerships.

name: Hostel Portobelo
description: This is a very basic hostel in a small port town. Don't expect much. A lot of the San Blas sailing trips start here. We stayed here because it's safer than being in Colon to wait for the ferry departure. Beds for $13/pP. Restaurant has good curry dishes although it's a little pricey. The terrace and wifi are the best things about this place. Showers are cold. The sign on the main road still says Marco Polo, but the hostel is now called Hostel Portobelo.

name: Uva
description: Our taxi driver recommended this place but a bit too late. $9 per Person. Seems like a better place than captain jack's. Right at the beach.

name: Panagas
description:
- big Panagas refill station
- refilled here our US propane tanks in 5 minutes
- close at 3.30pm, closed on sunday

name: Lookout near Chorro de la Mozas
description:
After we could not go to Chorro de la Mozas we just took the road up the hill (road would not show on our GPS, but you can see it here on the map in satellite mode - take a right if you go from El Valle towards the falls, just shortly before the Chorro de La Mozas parking lot, take next possible road left). Very steep road up to a lookout, there we found a big and flat gravel area just off the road. Some traffic but not too much.. many people that came to that place because of the view, but did not bother us. 

- free
- nice view
- nice breeze
- some traffic but only little during night

name: Surfers Paradise
description:
Really cool surfers lodge on the cliffs with a breathtaking view. We paid 20 USD pP for a private cabina. Camping in tents or in the car would also be possible! The place offers breakfast and lunch, multiple dinner places in the area. Board rental possible. Breathtaking view. 

The signs aren't that clear. Keep driving all the way to the end of the dirt road, past the open gate until you get to a closed gate.

name: Tropigas
description: Refill your 20-lb BBQ tanks here. We paid $18.50 for 2. Bring exact change or close to it if possible. They mostly deal with debit/cc and company cheques so change is limited. We arrived at 7:50am and they were open. Didn't wait too long. Did need to provide Passport # and cell #.

name: Refugio Del Rio
description: Very nice and clean hostel.  Secure parking for motorcycles as the owner is a rider as well. Overland vehicles may have to park on the street as there is not room inside of the property. Tent camping is permitted and they have space for 2 or 3 tents. They also have 10 or so tents for rent and are all set up ready to go. Dorm room is $12 per person and camping is $10 per person. Nice kitchen and common areas here as well.

name: Melo Pet and Garden Center
description: Easy place to get Certificado de Salud for dogs traveling to Columbia. Cost $25.00.

name: BTS Mechanic
description: English speaking owner, really nice clean place. Good for big/tall rigs. Got our filters and oil changed for $100.

name: Albrook Inn
description: Nice place to stay while getting things done in the city. The Inn is located in a quite and upscale part of the city near the airport. Safe parking is available in front with no height restrictions, dogs are ok, and bonus there is a coin washer and dryer! Pool, bar, restaurant, AC. Our room was $77 plus $25 for our dog.

name: Exit Visa for Dogs
description: After you go to Melo, bring  health certificate to this office to obtain an exit visa. Located around the back side of Edison Plaza. Cost is $5.

name: Bocas Del Toro, Isla Colon
description: Free! On nice swimming beach just outside of town under shade trees.

name: Farallón
description: Take the left opposite the Mercado (orange building at the time) and about 30 metres down there is a parking lot. We parked there for the day ($3 when they initially wanted $4 and 25c each to walk onto beach) and then at the end of the day we asked where we had paid for parking and we're told it was safe and free to camp on the beach.  We asked a guy there (no idea who he really is) and he said it was fine to park up there too. We lowered the rope to the beach access and drove into the first part which doesn't require 4x4 and camped beside our car. We had no problem and woke to a beautiful dawn over the island. No idea how safe it really is but we had no issues. It was a Sunday night.  We paid nothing for this but in the morning paid 25c each for a shower which they have a switch to. Free camping otherwise.

name: Discovery Center
description: Open till 9pm(formerly 8pm!)! Great way to avoid rush hour! This is basically a large American style warehouse shop with everything from camping stuff to car stuff cool boxes, tyres, cookers, tools and you can buy propane bottles here too. $65 for a 20lb bottle full - the equivalent in Do It Centre was $95.

name: Ministerio De comercio E Industrialas De chiriqui
description: Genuinely not 100% sure what this office does - but we needed to visit it as part of our exportation if our Panamanian registered car. It's not the Aduana building, but was needed in this process. Will try to add more info when "our man" Edwardo gives us a greater explanation of it's uses. Might just help someone out!

name: Aduana Office David
description:
For all Aduana related stuff. Staff have a bit of patience here and they have been quite helpful and informative. 
Can arrange bonded storage of your vehicle while you head overseas.
$1 per day in the first month, $2 per day following month, maximum stay 6 month

NOTE reported 12/2017 that during storage arranged by David Aduana nearly everything was stolen - from a safe to jumper leads

name: Panama Service Centre
description: DONT GO HERE! Have had serval issues to do with the service done here not being down very well.           Took our tundra in for a service, modern shop friendly staff

name: Policia National for DIJ
description: The police station in Colon where you can get your DIJ. Park on the street. They are open every day.

name: La Rana Dorada
description: Craft beer on draught, in a very English pub setting. 2 for 1 beer 12-6 Mon-Sat

name: Parking in front of soccer field
description: We parked here during the day. Police officers says it's safe at night, but since we were alone and the lamppost were not functionning, we went beside the Country Inn for the night (it's a no issue street and there is a watchman 24/24 for their parking and the man said he would watch for us if we parked under the street light). We used the bathroom, water tap and showers at the soccer field (we didn't ask, thought) when we went to watch the soccer games at night. There is also a small snack there. Taxi from here to Pan. Viejo : 15usd or to Casco Viejo : 8usd (6pers.). Note that the Amador Causeway is not as fun and as beautiful as the park/bridge on water that goes around Casco Viejo. And we found electricity at the bottom of one of the lampost (but don't know if it works)!

name: Sunken Barge
description: A little plot of land on the right side of the road. There is a tree and a sunken barge. Right on the river. Free. Great for one night.

name: Dumas Villas
description: 10 rooms in a villa. Kitchen, wifi and secure parking. Rooms are varied with or without air con and different sizes. We had a larger room with king bed and air con for $30 night. $5 per day to park two motorcycles. $5 to use washer/dryer for entire stay. Bit out of central area but can bus and metro into town. 3 minute walk to metro mall.

name: Trailhead Sendero los Quetzales
description:
NOTE: As of November 2021 the road up here requires a good 4x4. 

This is the last point you can drive up to do the Sendero los Quetzales. The last 2 km are steep, bumpy and wet in rainy season (did it with a VW T3 Syncro), but there are possibilities to turn around if it doesn't work out. Maybe big rigs have a problem, there are some trees in the way and there's not much space in the parking. Camping was 6 usd/car (they told us that the normal price would be 6usd per person!), we walked 4.5 km and turned around, nice hike, steep way back, at least worth to go until Mirador las Rocas (2.5km).

name: On the banks of Rio Chiriquí
description: The thermal springs of Caldera would have been our destination, but the last 500 meters were impassable (too high rocky steps for our car). The dirt road to other hot springs was not passable neither because of mud. We spent a very quet night at the banks of the Rio Chiriqui. Nice place to camp. 3G connection.

name: Osteingang
description: The last two hundred meters of the gravel road to the entrance of the the park are very bad and steep. We were allowed to stay on the small parking lot to the left of the entrance for the night. At 7am it got loud because many campesinos passed by on their way to work.

name: Hotel El Parador
description: Located in El Cangrejo district this hotel is ideal to spend the time between shipping and flight to Colombia. Centrally located just two blocks from the Via Espana Rey and a large supermarket. Rooftop pool, clean rooms with balcony, TV, fridge, free WIFI, decent breakfast, free safety deposit box at the front desk ($ 120 key deposit). Taxis to the Miraflores Locks cost of US $ 12 from here, $ 23 to the airport. For the ride with the Metro buses you have to buy a rechargeable card, which can then be charged in a prepaid procedure for US $ 2. A ticket for the entire city costs 0.25 US $ / person. It is sufficient to buy one prepaid card for two people.

name: Hotel Obaldia
description: Hotel with secure parking for an overnight stay if you can't reach the Costa Rica border at the same day. Paid 35 usd for a doble room with a/c. Very clean, friendly and helpful. Phone 730-7330

name: Laguna San Carlos
description:
Very nice and quiet place!
2 dollars to stay over the night in your car. With a tent it´s more expensive (depends on the size of the tent).
Tap water available.
No electricity in the camping site but you can ask in the administration to charge your things but they will charge you.
They charge 0,25cts for the use of restrooms.

name: Jansen Family Coffee Plantation
description: It took us a bit longer than we'd hoped crossing into Panama, so we were looking for an alternate spot. We saw a sign in Vulcan for the Farm, and tours. Worth an ask. Very friendly owner. He did say it's their home, so please "be cool", NP. They let us set up next to the coffee shop for the night. A cup of coffee in the AM, and we will replenish our coffee supply, but no formal camping fee. Watchman also let us use the bano. Beautiful spot!

name: Procars Panama, Wall for RoRo & Carshop
description:
We emailed Rui (rleitao@procarspanama.com) ahead of time and they welcomed us in like family.  They are a legit mechanic shop and ARB, Lightforce, and Rigid Lighting dealer.  We had our CV boots replaced, rear pinion seal/oil replaced, and new front brake pads installed.  All of our chassis points were lubed and they were happy with me inspecting the truck and doing some work while it was on the lift.  Good work and great people. Open m to f 8 to 6, and Saturday until 2

Fast Wifi & Showers

Number of the Boss Rui (has WhatsApp too): +50769636450 or the Office cell phone is +50762043369

Busy, maybe call ahead. Rui speaks English/Portuguese/Spanish

Instagram: @procars_panama

Email: rleitao@procarspanama.com
            ventas@procarspanama.com

Cell Phone: +507-6963-6450
                    +507-6204-3369

name: Jilguero Cabins
description: Cabins on a gorgeous mountainside roughly 20km north of Gualcala on route 10 that runs between the Sixaola CR/Panama border crossing and David. Great option to rest in this otherwise very remote stretch of road. Dorm beds and cabins, $12 and up. Pretty sure Elsa, the inn keeper will accommodate tents as well (unsure of price). Road up from highway is steep and a little rough but doable for off-road capable bikes. Parking ok for motorbikes and maybe 1 or 2 cars. No restaurant, but she will make you dinner for a few extra dollars.

name: Villa Libera
description: Driving around, close to dark, and striking out left and right we happened upon this spot. We asked about campong, but being the off season they offered a room at a very discounted price. We took it. Super nice couple from Italy, and pizza oven they brought with them. They may add camping spots in the future. Close to town, and beach. We paid $40 per night.

name: Mamallena Hostel
description: Cheap, comfortable, lots of common space. Kitchen, fast wifi, secure parking for a couple of bikes (must be able to navigate a slightly steep step-up). Dorm bed $13, private room $33. Rooms are small but have AC, fan, electricity. Laundry service for $5 a load. Cons: definitely a backpacker hostel. Must be able to put up with obnoxious music in the background. If you opt for the dorm, there are small lockers for your valuables you can use with your own lock; NOT big enough for all your mc gear.

name: Windmill Hostel
description:
Nice hostel in a great location. It has a well equipped Kitchen and hot showers. There is a Games room, including a sitting area. Also a pool with loungers. Costs $10 per person to camp with breakfast. Also have comfortable private rooms for $33.   
As of January 2023 the games room does not exist and there is no restaurant but there are 6 separate kitchen areas and lockers to store your things. Wifi speeds are fast, and extend out to the camping area, at least to the first tree past the cabanas next to the volleyball net.

name: La Granja
description:
140 ha farm and very nice hostel, camping in grassy patch beside hostel.
Blazing wifi, clean facilities, cold showers. Nice large covered porch with comfy furniture. Nice walks to the lake (Gatun) and to see the farm animals. Butterfly garden/house. Very friendly people.
$ 10/person with own transport. 55 USD  for an double room. Way too much for what it is...
German shepherd and lab on site. Restaurant by the lake, a new one near the hostel is being built.
Zip line and kayaking available.
Cows, buffalos, horses, sheep, pigs, mules, goats and more.
We spent the weekend here before shipping to Cartagena. It is a short taxi ride to Colon. Access is from Cativa  through the town of San Judas Tadeo.

name: El Paraiso Escondido
description:
Best spot we found in the area!
Marcella owns several cabanas along the beach, and allows overlanders to camp. very nice woman (she loves talking!). electricity available with extension cord. awesome sunsets, beach is small but nice.
very quiet during the week, but busy on weekends.
showers, wc, electricity.  no internet but 4G signal available
Price for  4 people and 2 cars  15 USD/night

name: Volcano view
description:
(Pavement doesn't end now.  It is all paved.  Pull off to the right side if you are driving uphill) ****

                                                                   We drove up here until the pavement stopped. It is an access road to the coffee fields. There is a nice flat spot for one camper. Incredible views of the farms, volcano, Boquete and the ocean. A few small trucks came by and a few indigenous on their way to the coffee fields. We visited with them, very friendly. You can hike further. Quiet night.

name: Hospedaje & Restaurante Refugio Tropical Las Lajas
description: Besides having private air conditioning and an excellent restaurant, we can offer you a plot of 1100 mtrs2 where they can park easily no matter the size of your camper, but still do not have all the facilities to 100% of its requirements, if we can provide fresh water and electricity to 110 volt and 220 volt. 60 hrz; We want to clarify that in this place do not allow scandalous music or loud parties, you will be in a place of decency and good attention to where they can rest and refuel on some inputs.

name: Hotel 888
description: If you end up in Almirante and you have to spend the night here (and you cannot stay in your car or RV) this is an option. Big hotel, lots of room, 25$ for a double room with private bathroom and aircon, slow wifi, very noisy, do not take room 7 (because if you unplug the tv to use the electricity, the other guests cannot watch tv) safe parking for two or three motorbikes.

name: Pacific Dreams
description:
Hotel with possibility to stay in your RV (see below)

40 USD for a double room with two ling beds with private bathroom (there are smaller ones with shared bathroom too) including breakfast which changes daily (omelet, egg o toast, pancake...). It is in a quiet residential street 5 minute walk to El Dorado Mall and plenty of restaurants (most of them fast food). Taxi to the center is $5.

one of the hotel wings can be rented as a whole mini apartment or private rooms with shared bathroom. If the later you can park your motorhome in front of the hotel and make use of the bathroom and kitchen and have a wonderful breakfast for $5 per person per night, but you need to call the owner in advance to make sure the bathroom is available and there is space to park (they speak English) +5073903241

Laundry service is $5 for a massive load

name: The 3 Lost Waterfalls Trailhead
description:
Parking lot for the 3 Lost Waterfalls trail. Down a short rocky road that would be a problem for low clearance vehicles. Nice flat shady area to camp, be aware that it will be busy with tourist vehicles on weekends.

The trail itself costs $10 per person to walk.

name: El Castillo
description: Restaurant just on the edge of Portobelo, we camped in the parking lot for free, we ate at the restaurant, which has amazing fish, Pad Thai, Curry Thai and the Vietnamese spring rolls are to die for.  The nice owner also has a single room and a dorm room for rent. $10 for one person, $18 for two people. The sunsets alone should make you want to stay.

name: Panama house.
description: Reccomended to stay for motorcyclists travelling on stahlratte but would avoid if possible. friendly staff, good food.

name: Darien Gap, Panama to Darien Gap, Colombia
description: Panama to Colombia by Boat

name: Sixaola, Costa Rica to Guabito, Panama
description:
*More info in comments about Costa Rica to Panama! 

Panama-Costa Rica, Sixaola Border
No gas stations on the Costa Rica side. Note: this border isn't a 24hr job. It closes around 6pm, so get there early. There's not really any hotels, gas stations or ATM's until around Changinola. 

We cross the border in Sixaola on sunday on a new bridge. No problem with immigration and aduanas . The insurance was open : 42 usd for 3 months . No taxes if you come from Panama and go to Costa Rica.

Update March 2020: Insurance is now 49 USD for 3 months.

name: Hostel Bambu
description:
$30 for a private room with bath, ac, wifi, free coffee in morning, and secure parking. Nice cheap restaurant across the street. Hostel has pool and nice outdoor hangout area and bar, but is very chill. 
Also available - dorm rate of $11 per person to park in compound. Room for one small vehicle in compound

name: The Fish Market
description: $12 for the tuna burger which is super good. Great little spot, dinner only.

name: Para Liberar Veículo Neste Porto Procurar Sr. Aldo Garcia Mais Barato E Mais Rápido Encontrar Na Entrada Do Porto
description:
Entry from the workplace terminal of Mr, Aldo Garcia is easier and cheaper to release the car with him.

Entrada do terminal local de trabalho do Sr, Aldo Garcia fica mais fácil e mais barato liberar o carro com ele.

name: Las Chozas
description: USD 20 for a night at the parking of the restaurant. They also do hospedajes. Rooms. Very good fresh water from a source. Friendly reliable people. Ask the owner for internet connection and hot shower. Email: laschozas.km117@gmail.com. Tel: 6781-1051; 6675-6100

name: Municipal Sports ground Behind Terpel Gas station
description: Camping next to the restaurant for free. They made me a really hot meal for 4,5 USD including a beer. Tasted good.

name: Hotel Hibiscusgarden
description: Quiet place in a huge beautiful garden right on the beach, rooms for all budgets, camping possible.

name: Waterfalls San Pedro El Espino
description: A beautiful river with huge rocks to sunbathe. Secret tip, also wild camping.

name: Playa Morillo
description: We camped directly at the beach for free. The road to get there is just a small muddy road. High clearance is recommended. Beautiful long beach. By low tide you can walk to a small island. Very quite area, so bring everything you need. It is also a surf beach.

name: Rio San Pedro
description: Small place at the Río San Pedro. Very quiet, no facilities, FREE.

name: Panagas
description: You can fill up gas here. It is butan, not propane. It worked for us. 8.74 $ to fill a 20lbs bottle. A bit further south is tropigas, they also just have butan.

name: La Casa De Juan
description: Cheapest option in the valley. Cozy hostel, super friendly owner, accepts cars and tents, has rooms, bathroom, hot showers, WiFi, kitchen. It accepts people who want to volunteer. 5 private rooms, 2 shared rooms with 9 and 6 beds. Great place to park motorhome, several trees and beautiful nature. Place for tents. We recommend it.

name: Los Quetzales Ecolodge
description: Amazing Lodge with rooms, cabanas, restaurant, spa. The owner Carlos is a warm-hearted elder man. He let us camp on the ground with our 4x4 truck for just 20USD/day. All services included like water, electricity, WiFi, spa, laundry, guided tours into the jungle. This is definitely one of our favorites.

name: Campamento Evangelico La Buena Esperanza
description: This is a Christian Campground for children and young adolescents. But they take travellers as well. Dog Friendly. Camping is based on donations.  Shower and bathroom (with toilet seats and TP) very clean. Electricity available at the bath house.

name: IS International de Seguros
description:
15 dollar a month
you need the insurance first, bevore you can take your car out of a container

name: Seaboard Marine
description: The office is in the last building of this road. This is the first step if RORO with Seaboard / Seacargo. Give bill of lading 4 copies to be stamped and maybe a disclaimer. Then go to aduana / custom office.

name: Riande Aeropuerto
description: An excellent Hotel close to the airport. Not that cheap but worth every dollar. Check out different booking platforms to achieve best price options. I paid 100 USD/Night. First I thought going to the nearby Express Inn. But that Hostel is a nightmare. If you want to relaxe and get to the airport easily, this Hotel is a perfect choice.

name: Surf Hotel El Palmar
description: Hotel with simple rooms a/c and very small beds for 70$, was the cheapest we could find ( maybe because of the weekend) . Camping under palapas for 10$/person possible. Nothing to recommend on weekends but it is ok for one night

name: France Field Aduana- Administración de Aduana Offices
description:
An important step! Here you get your temporary import permit if you are entering Panama, or you can get your "Formulario de Salida" if you are exiting Panama.

After you leave the first set of buildings, go back to the main road and follow the signs on the to "Cuatro Altos" or "France Field".  If you can enter at France Field gates, the building is immediately on your right (as on this map). But you may have to enter at the northern set of gates and drive down.

Exit office is the last door on the right (closest to the highway you drove down).

To leave Panama, we needed these photocopies ready:
3x Passport Photo Page
3x Passport Panama (person & vehicle) Entrance Stamp
3x Panama import permit (TIP)
3x Panama Insurance (Polizia)
3x DIJ letter
3x Vehicle title
3x Bill of Lading (provided by your agency or shipping company, already with your quarantine stamps from the first step)

They will give you two sets of copies back with some additions and stamp your Passport (vehicle exit stamp).

To get your car out of the port and into Panama you need photocopies of:
3x passport
3x title/registration of car
3x insurance
3x letter (see below) or Bill of Lading provided by travel agency

These guys have the info for the letter, the post itself is in German but the letter at the bottom is in Spanish: http://wwww.randulinas.ch/161 (Google translate gives you a great translation with the steps too)

name: Hardware Store
description: Electrics, solar stuff- cheap and from China. Hardware, appliances. Cheap machetes! Gotta have one for coconuts!

name: El Sabroson
description: Cafeteria style. Delicious, and affordable (even with our Canadian dollar) nice atmosphere lots of families...

name: El Machico Hostel
description: Small parking area for vehicles 4.3m or shorter or motorcycles in gated area. Parking for larger vehicles in front of hostel on street in safe area. Can sleep in car and pay day use fee of 8 USD pp for pool, showers, pool table etc.  A bit noisy with people coming and going. Nice, clean, modern place. Friendly staff.

name: SC Line Office
description: This is step 1 ... Get 4 copies stamped

name: RORO & Flat Rack Final Location - Customs Desks, Payment, Forms, Final Inspections, also drop off keys for collection
description:
Final place to drop your RV for RORO or container. 

Park in the center median. 
Walk to the left of the vehicle gates, turn in paperwork from previous Aduana to first window.
Pay $79, receive permission to come to port. 
Drive your vehicle in, only driver allowed. The others can enter from the Garita (blue gate). 
Get inspected/photos/dog search 
Hand in keys 
Wait to sign one last document stating they received the vehicle without damage. 
Walk out with your luggage.

Lots of waiting, but pretty painless. There is a water fountain and a trash can.

name: Colon -Panama Canal Railway
description: Sit on the right side heading towards Panama.

name: Paradise Inn
description:
NO CAMPING
The name Paradise Inn is the program. It is a resort with a big pool landscape under palm trees. There is space for two or three not too big campers. We paid 20 US$.

name: Parking supermarket Rey
description: Parking lot free, 24h. Safety but noisy. Next to Mc donalds. Toilets in MC donalds or Rey. Internet free in Mc donalds.

name: Oceans Hostel
description: Stayed here with our Campervan, toilet and shower, kitchen, 10$ per night, clean, friendly owner, also private rooms available

name: Hotel Vista Lago & Camping
description: after a long long drive, stopped in here to inquire about rooms. Decent size hotel, pool, wifi, unsure about camping, restaurant on premises. For a double room (4 of us) they wanted 85$ which didn't include breakfast, nice size rooms and fast wifi but we didn't stay.

name: hotel Doalan
description:
stopped by here after a long drive- basic hotel but clean rooms with A/C as well as restaurant on site. Near to the beach and Mercado. Have room for 6 people too.

also wanted to add, the town is pretty sketchy.. even the dogs looked shady.

name: Mount Totumas Lodge
description: Jeffrey and Alma were very welcoming even though they were fully booked in lodge, cabin and homestead.  They took the time to tell us about everything. We parked at a great spot next to the homestead. Five minutes after arrival, we saw a quetzal fly by. Electricity at night if you need it. We paid $25, (an excellent value considering the uniqueness of this lodge) including use of all the trails and bathroom and kitchen ( we did not use the kitchen) in the homestead.  Only for 4x4 vehicles, pretty rough road coming in for 9 km. Check website www.mounttotumas.com.  Contact the lodge before going there for directions.

name: Grassy Parking
description: We didnt want to break the oil pan on our way to the main entrance (4x4 needed), so we camped here. No facilities but a beautiful view, and quiet.

name: Football (soccer) pitch
description:
Big flat area. Noboby to ask. We suppose it's ok.  ! Big wind, which was welcome. !
Terrain de foot (sans un brin d'herbe). Il n'y avait personne à qui demander... On s'est installé avec le camping car sur un banc de touche, au cas où des joueurs débarquent au petit matin !

name: Barwil Agencies / Wilhelmsen Main Office
description:
Main office of the company.
Bvd Panama Pacifico in International Business Park.
Tower A (but seems renamed with number), 4st floor, Officine 401
In the first red and white building, on the right.

name: On the side of the restaurant
description:
We can't overnight on the parking of the mall, so guards suggest us to ask to the owner of this restaurant. He was ok and friendly. Not quiet because just near the highway but with really more wind than in Panama City (definitely too hot). We stayed 2 nights.
There is a lot of fast food inside the mall, bathroom and free wifi...

name: Aduana - Custom export and Almacenaje
description: Step 3 to ship to Cartagena. A lot of windows. Choose one for Aduana, show papers from the step 2, they stamp, then go to an other window for Almacenaje, pay (70$ for our rv) and ask for receipt and BL copies. Then go to last step : park our vehicule. (look at an other shipping logo on the app's map, north east of this one...)

name: Cascada Los Ramones
description: Cool and quiet spot on the side of Boquete's river and in front of a beautiful waterfall. The spot is also on the side of the road, where a couple farmers pass by during the day. We stayed there a full week.

name: Internacional de Seguros
description: good place to renew vehicle insurance. 15$ for a month renewal for a van.

name: Evergreen Car Shipping
description: This is the place for the paperwork, if your car was shipped with Evergreen from Cartagena to Colon,

name: La Isleta
description:
Roberto hopes to reopen the restaurant this year…. It’s been closed for over 3 years; a beautiful property right next to the Panamerican Highway. There is a large space to park or tent next to the river that can be explored on kayaks. There are nice areas with tables and chairs under the trees.
Owner Roberto speaks English, studied in California. 

NOTE - the property is just down the road from a Texaco Criollo Guabala gas station on the Panamerican Hwy. see maps photo. 
WhatsApp Roberto in advance if you would like to have a meal he’s happy to cook dinner or breakfast for you! +50763658989

name: Hostel Panama Central Loft
description: Apartment which is used as a hostel. We shared a clean 4-bed-room with friends. The room had a big private bathroom. The included breakfast was a joke, one pancake per person. B/.43 per night, cash only.

name: Waterfall Hostel
description:
We have a wide variety of accommodation available, including ample parking for campervans and RV's.

An overnight stay is $10 per person, plus an extra $5 per night for electricity if required. Wifi, large kitchen, swimming pools and even a waterfall.

Please visit our website for more information.

name: Magnolia Inn
description: Beautifully renovated hostel & hotel on a quiet street in Casco Viejo. Paid $92 for a private room with ac. Hostel bed $20. Dorm room is huge, bright, roomy. Super clean. Well-equipped kitchen, hot water, fast wifi. Close to police inspection for shipping. Great neighborhood. Safe on-street parking on narrow streets so may not work for big rigs. Recommended!!

name: Durallantas
description:
BF Goodrich tires.

our 245/75 R16 was 161 USD without taxes. had them on stock

name: Almirante
description:
In front of the grating of the hospital we did not have permission to park in the parking lot. Quiet and safe place. No service. 

Devant le grillage de l'hopital nous n'avons pas eu l'autorisation de stationner sur le parking. Endroit tranquille et en securite. Pas de service.

name: Playa Bluff
description:
On the beach no service but super quiet, it is better to have a 4x4 and not to exceed 3.30 high 

Sur la plage pas de service mais super tranquille, il vaut mieux avoir un 4X4 et ne pas dépasser 3,30 de hauteur

name: Mamallenas Ecolodge
description: Beautiful, peaceful and cool place to stay in the mountains. Extremely eco friendly, including recycling, chickens, compost and orchards. Has a natural river pool to swim in, orchards and walks around the property. Hikes up nearby mountains. Accommodations for all sorts (dorm, cabins, rooms, places to hammock , camp and car camp, and volunteering positions). On the panam highway, turn right at la lajas (before the cochez store in Coronado). Drive for approx 40 minutes to La Laguna, then you will start to see signs for mamallenas. Turn left, drive for 5 minutes and turn left again following the signs.

name: Express Inn, Camping and Hotel
description: $15 for camping for 2 people with full hookups. Can accommodate full-size rigs. Grass at sites with cement driveways for each site. Pool/restaurant on site, many grocery stores, gas stations and banks close by.

name: Machete Kite Club
description: Machete kiteboarding lessons will allow you to camp on there beachfront property, provided you take a lesson while you camp. Lessons were $60 an hour with own gear (kite,board,harness) without $75. 4x4 required to access camping. Sand on narrow road. Perfect for tent camping or rooftop tent, small slide in campers would fit also. Bar on site with minimal food, showers and bathrooms on site.

name: Santa Fe
description:
In front of the church next to the football stadium no service but quiet and safe in the center of the village 

Devant l'eglise a cote du stade de foot pas de service mais tranquille et securite dans le centre du village

name: Punta Chame
description:
On a land for sale on the sea near the fishing village ideal with the north wind no super quiet service

Sur un terrain a vendre sur la mer à cote du village de pecheurs ideal avec le vent du nord pas de service super tranquille

name: Casa De Las Baterias
description: Good place to check and buy batteries. We were having problems with our house batteries and got them analysed here. Specifically Juan was very helpful and quick and gave us a discount on 2 new agm batteries. If you are traveling north there are also other branches which will give you the guarantuee if you have purchased something in Panama. Unfortunately no ofher branches South of here

name: Terpel gas station
description:
Just a gas station with a small convenience store. 24h. Safe place (safe area). Police passed by a couple times at night. Not as noisy as you can expect from a gas station (not worry  though). There is a restaurant next door. 


Password:  [passwords are not allowed unless explicitly permitted by the owner]

name: Bocas Ridge Hotel
description: This place is quite amazing. Due to ferry times we were stuck in Almirante for 24 hours and water a nice place to chill and safe parking for our motorbike. This place cost USD65 with breakfast, aircon, fast wifi, cable, ect. Owners are super friendly and rooms very nice. Spectacular view and nice pool. The breakfast is yummy and big with good coffee. They also gave us four free drinks and some free tapas

name: Seaboard Marine
description: Lolo shipping office obtained quote in 5 minutes from Bruno tel: 507-360-5909

name: parking ferry
description: dont allow to sleep in the ferry  anymore. arrive at 6 pm thinking to sleep at the port, but we ask the people of the ferry to entrance and sleep in the ferry and they say no problem. (the ferry leaves at 7am) we talk with "Pocho" of the Baltija ferry. he also give us 110 v. really nice people.

name: Duty Free
description: Bring your passport and enjoy duty free prices!

name: Turtle Cay Marina
description:
By requesting permission we spent the night next to the marina. By parking next to the restaurant you have the wifi, the shower and the toilet the day super quiet 

En demandant l'autorisation nous avons passe la nuit a cote de la marina. En se garant a cote du restaurant vous avez la wifi, la douche et les WC la journee super tranquille

name: AutoStar Mercedes Trucks
description: Service shop for Mercedes utility vehicles. This is where we camped in the front of the shop for 10 days until our part has been delivered from USA for our Sprinter 2500 van. The service personnel was extremely helpful and understanding, there was no problem with ordering our own part and they supplied only the labor. Super 99 grocery just few steps away.

name: Copa Cargo
description: Pet Services - Dog shipping from here with Copa Cargo

name: Coco Arte
description: Luis is creating art out of driftwiod from the sea

name: Terpel
description: Ultra modern truck stop with clean bathrooms, laundry and showers. Food also very good and affordable. Overnight stay allowed in the back of the building.

name: roadside parking next to police station
description: Roadside parking in a quiet side street right behind a police station. Small vehicles only, no facilities, but mall nearby. It's OK for a a night if everything else fails. Free, OK with police.

name: Castellón
description: the cheapest place we're I find the insurance, they charge you $35. First floor of the building,  in the second floor there are several ones but more expensive

name: Cabañas de Estefany
description: Excellent place to stop. You can park between de guest houses, there is wifi, electricity (only at night when they turn on the generator) fresh water and toilets for $5 the night or person. the beach is very nice and at the end of the road there are some boats if you want to take a tour. Playa estrella is walking distance don’t pay for a boat. Two restaurant near by.

name: Johnny & los Manolites
description: If you like shrimp this is the place just outside Aguadulce past the salt flats. A plate full of Jumbo Shrimp/Prawns will set you back about $10. This was well worth the diversion to sample this local delicacy

name: Public Market
description: It can be a cultural experience! Great prices..

name: Postnet - Copy/Scan Store
description: We scanned our documents here and paid 1$ total.

name: Terpel Travel Center
description: Terpel travel center/gas station and restaurant, they had free cold showers and use of a washer $1.50 and dryer cost $0.75  Fast free WiFi. They also have a small restaurant. The station is open 24 hours with a large parking lot, allows overnight parking at the back where the trucks are. There is also a grassy area behind the station where you could possibly pitch a tent.

name: Terpel Va&Ven
description: Truck stop with restaurant, laundry and shower. If you consume the shower is free.

name: Vet- pet Clinic
description:
Got a Health certificate for $15 negotiated with the Vet since I had done blood test and has bought medicine for my dog.
$20 blood test $25 all 5 vaccines

name: Reinsa
description: Good street to buy your motor oil

name: Terpel Gas Station
description: This is as far as you can drive if you have a big rig. We made it inside with our F-250 and Palomino pop up camper but it was very stressful as the streets are too narrow. We hit the corner of our camper with a cinder block roof.. Don't risk it. You can walk from here to the hanging bridge

name: Senafront
description: Bring Your pasaporte. Militar check point

name: Hojalateria Rafael
description: Welder shop. Right next to Bar Tarzan Cevicheria $60 bucks to make a bar to secure the camper for Roro

name: Baru visitor center
description: The center was closed on Monday, we just boondocked in the parking lot. There is water on tap in the front of the building, but the toilets were locked up. Altitude is 1,866 meters, a substantial cool-off at night.

name: Hospital Veterinario de Corozal
description: Friendly staff and vet. The vet spoke good English. Health Certificate 20$, blood test 20$, micro ship 25$ (but only registered in Panama, unfortunately not international). To get the health certificate no blood test is required, he's just checking your dog.

name: Keruasa Hotel Restaurant
description:
Keruasa is officially a restaurant and a cabanas rental, but they let us camp on their large property. It is not beachfront, but have an access to this relax beach. We were told that on weekend and holiday the place was busier, as people come from Chitre to hang out. Anyway, for us it was perfect, we were alone, the owner and his wife were super nice. We paid 15$ for our family of four in a small camper. 
We walk to the bar/restaurant/hang out place in the center of the pueblo and could buy fish from the fisherman.

name: Norton Lilly NYK
description: Once a month RoRo to Ecuador directly can be arranged here. Second floor office.

name: Volkswagen and Kawasaki dealer/workshop (official)
description: This is the Volkswagen workshop and dealership. They also double as a Kawasaki dealer and repair shop. I went there with my 1984 T3 (Vanagon) Westfalia to have rear wheel bearings charged and front wheel bearings adjusted. To make a long story short, it was a desaster. Don't come here unless you have a new vehicle. Bad service, lacking basic courtesy, they just don't care. Also, they didn’t have a certain tool (just a freakin spanner), so at some point they just said it can’t be done. Had to insist they buy their tool, which they did. Had to sleep infront of workshop (no security) because brakes were blocked and everyone left. In the end I have no idea whether they really did change one bearing as you are neither allowed in the workshop nor to talk to your mechanic. Car and parts were returned dirty and with scratches. The worst possible service experience. Labour costs 66 USD per hour. Avoid this place if you can.

name: Siriri
description: Dog friendly hostel in downtown, private rooms with own bathroom go for $40.00 with no extra charge for dog. Very spartan room, just a bed, not even a nail to hang a towel, but decent wifi and TV in rooms. Basic breakfast included.

name: Residencia de la Marina
description: Owned by Italian lady Marina, this is a hotel with just a few rooms on a back street of Boca Chica (well, this place only has back streets). Mind the low branches,we are 3.1 meters high and pruned some trees. Camping next to building underneath trees, use of shower and toilet in a room. US $ 20 per night, 2 persons and a van. US $ 2,50 per day per computer (!) for the use of internet (reasonably fast); not really a sympathetic gesture. There is an outdoor space underneath a roof for relaxing, including hammocks (though 1 is taken by the owner). Howler monkeys, geese, chickens and roosters. Marina brought some potable water in gallon bottles, tea one day and some handmade icecream the next. We took the lancha for US $ 1 per person to Boca Brava island, where we hiked on the muddy roads in search of Hotel Boca Brava (supposedly with hiking trails, restaurant, kayak rental), which we did not find. Better ask the lancha captain to take you there. Instead we hiked to the Seagull Cove Lodge to have lunch in the restaurant with a killer view (no camping allowed, we asked).To be honest; Boca Chica is not really an action-packed destination. But it's fine just to chill. We spend 2 nights. Boy, it can really rain cats and dogs here at night.

name: Pipas restaurant & camping
description:
Pipas Restaurant and camping facilities.  At the end of Farrallon Village. Beach area to spend the day with umbrellas, restaurant, karaoke with live band, shower and bathrooms. Travelers can stay overnight and use the facilities free of charge. We set up camping tent in the back area on the sand. It does not have a kitchen but it has an area with sink and support to place each his own. 
Not reachable by vehicles over 3 mtrs of hight. The lay 200mtrs will stop you, cables and branches

Zona de playa para pasar el día con sombrillas, restaurante, karaoke con banda en directo, ducha y baños. A los viajeros nos deja pernoctar y utilizar las instalaciones gratuitamente. Nosotros montamos tienda de acampar en la zona de atrás sobre la arena. No tiene cocina pero tiene un área con fregadero y soporte para colocar cada uno la suya.

name: Restaurante Montecarlos
description:
Green cabins around a central area. Bathrooms were not the nicest along with the showers. Beautiful beach. Happy to negotiate. $5 per person/night. 
Felt safe, but were told to put everything away after dark and when not around. Weekends busy, weekdays are very quiet. No guard at night. 
Restaurant on weekends.
-------------------------------------------
We were driving at night trying to find where to park, we went all the way to "La Guaira" pin on iOverlander, and it's not possible to get there. So we asked a police officer and he said to come this way. It's the parking lot of a restaurant/hotel. Super quiet (weekday). No one bothered us. No services. Right on the beach.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Checks from both directions. Asked for our TIP and passports. Asked what we had in the car and then where we were headed.

name: Hotel Santa Fe
description: We went here, because Hostal Qhia cannot accommodate vans. American owned motel outside Santa Fe. You can camp behind the motel in the grass (not level), in front of a palapa-style structure (more a covered terrace). Be aware that is can be muddy in the rainy season. It is quite close to the road, but there is not much traffic. When we were there, the motel was fully booked and in the restaurant there was a function. So the chef cooked some takeout to eat in the van for US$ 7 per plate, A shower, toilet combination is at the back of the building. With TP and clean. Slow Wifi did reach the van. Camping US$ 8 for van and 2 persons.

name: Hostal Amador Familiar
description:
Is a Hostel located in a quiet and safe neighborhood surrounded by the nature in the Balboa area especificaly in Akee street beside a small park. It has a big car parking space for travaler and spaces for camping. It has a common areas such a kitchen wish is well equipped. The hostel has 21 rooms (privates and dormitories) from $15.00 per night. It includes internet service, luggage storage, cable TV, and cheap laundry service. It is a really good place for groups. The hostel has a really good location with the main City  transportation bus terminal, the main mall, and the main domestic airport just at a distance of 10 minutes. The Panama Canal is located at a distance of 10 km from the hostel and the Casco Viejo just 12 minutes from the hostel. 

Double rooms are $30, no breakfast included due to Covid.

name: Lavanderia / Laundry (forgot name)
description: Chinese-run lavanderia. Finally a lavanderia able or willing to wash my stuff (10kg) at a reasonable price within three hours. Parking in front of shop.

name: Cabanas Potosi
description: Nice american couple that also rents rooms,  the campingspace is on the other side of the street. All speak very good english. We stayed for one night and payed 10$. The campground has some nice shaded areas with hammocks,  a barbeque area and also a shower and a WC. Very nice spot with very nice people. Also electricity was made possible with the help of Mario. Wifi is available at the reception area of the main building.

name: Mono Feliz
description: This is a nature reserve and also has cabanas and a campingspace for tents. You only have access with a 4x4 car (very slow and long drive through rough and muddy roads) or by foot. We camped with our car and a rooftop tent in the parking lot and had to walk a few minutes to get to the shower and the WC. For one night we paied 12$. There is no power supply and no Wi-Fi. You are kind of directly on the beach but the current is very strong depending on the tide you can go for a swim or rather not.

name: Ministerio Salud
description:
***See below for updated informationa  

Here you can get yellow fever certificates. If travelling from south america you will need to show the yellow book containing the yellow fever vaccination at the border or at the airport. Otherwise access to Costa Rica i

name: Toll road - Panapass only
description:
See two hacks below—
This is the fastest way to get to Colon (less than an hour). However it is a toll road, only accesible with a Panapass, a toll pass. You cannot buy them here (no idea if and where you could) and you cannot pay cash. So we turned around and had to take the "normal road" through downtown Panama City. It took us 3,5 hours in afternoon traffic.

name: Tropigas Refill Plant
description: Refilled our 20lb tank for Usd 15,50. Open 7am  to 4pm monday to saturday

name: Portobello Public Parking Lot
description: Free public parking lot in Portobello. Secure and safe during day and night.

name: Tropigas
description: They fill in 10 minutes my 17 lbs gas tank. Very friendly and willing to help.

name: Riverside
description:
A space perfect for a small or medium van/camper (mine is an adapted 1500 Dodge Ram Pickup) just beside a very nice little river. Everything in town is private and has to be paid at the entrance.
This is the best spot we found for free parking inside the town. The police came and said it was OK. Fairly secure. Street not shown in Google Maps, but it is in OpenStreet maps.
----
Espacio perfecto para vehiculos pequeños o medianos (el mío es una camioneta pickup Dodge adaptada). 
Fue el mehor lugar que encontré para estacionar gratis junto a un río, ya que todo en el pueblo esta privatizado y hay q pagar. La policia vino y dijo que todo estaba bien. Suficientemente seguro de día y noche. La calle no aparece en Google Maps, pero sí en los de OpenStreet Maps.

name: Ferry Baltija
description: Ferry to Bocas Del Toro. Motorcycle is 10$ for one way. Van $55. Operates every day. From what I understand, there are two ferries and only two departure times, 6am and 11am. Passengers cost nothing, pets welcome. Large box trucks and semi's were on the ferry, very high clearance. there is a little shop with a small offering of drinks and food on the ferry.

name: Sona Bomberos
description: Friendly Bomberos, a bit away from the main road. Let us camp indoors, use kitchen and showers. We're cycle tourers. Not sure of their policy on overland trucks.

name: Park entrance fee and passport check
description:
20USD per person. 3$ for motorcycle, 5$ for a car. CAUTION: the road to the beach has very steep. Not recommended for large vehicles that struggle with incline or decline. 

entrance opens at 7AM. unsure when it closes. 

not much at the beach other than a port. you can park there and take water taxis to the island.

name: Motorcycle Shipping Alternative
description:
This a small ship port in which motorcyclists can negotiate their way onto a boat bound for Colombia. There is not always a boat going there each day, so you might have to come back a few days. Each trip can vary on price, duration, and destination, but it can reduce shipping or sailing cost in half. There is immigration and ADUANA officials at the port, therefore you don't need to go anywhere for it. 

My voyage was $500 for a three day trip to Capurgana, Colombia. There I needed to take a small boat for cheap to Turbo, the closest road. On the 3 day ride I am covered for 3 meals a day, a "bed", and stopping throughout the San Blas islands. Similar to sailing but much cheaper and rugged. My cheapest offer was $1200 for a traditional sail boat and I would have to wait 3 weeks. 

Ride safe!

name: auto repuesto
description:
The cheapest spare parts store we could find. Next is international where we find Korean spare parts tb at good price 

la tienda de repuestos más barata que encontramos. Al lado está internacional donde encontramos recambios coreanos tb a buen precio

name: FEDPA seguros
description:
We renew for a month more insurance quickly for $ 25. They have changed direction, now they are in the street Belarmino Urrida behind the parking lots of the Makro Store 

Renovamos por un mes más el seguro de forma rápida por 25$. Han cambiado de dirección, ahora están en la calle Belarmino Urrida detrás de los estacionamientos del Makro Store

UPDATE: it's 25$ every month

name: DIAN
description:
Office of the DIAN. We came to renew the permit of the car. Fast and easy. L-V 8: 00-16: 00h. Phone: 9761214 

Oficina de la DIAN.  Vinimos a renovar el permiso del coche. Fácil y rápido. L-V 8:00-16:00h. Teléfono: 9761214

name: Roots Hostel
description: Really nice little hostel in a beautiful landscape. Had a dormroom for only $10. Place is run by volunteers, that are very kind.

name: Playa Las Lajas
description:
At the end of the track on the left 100 m before Nelly's next to the straw huts without any service, a little resto next door but quiet quiet weekdays we requested permission to resto for one night, these shelters are under the responsibility of the community 

Au bout de la piste à gauche 100 m avant Nelly's à côté des paillottes sans aucun service, un petit Resto à côté mais cher tranquille en semaine nous avons demandé l'autorisation au Resto pour une nuit, ces abris sont sous la responsabilité de la communautz

name: Ocu Faire Field
description: We find a gâté open, meet the guard and as' him to stay over night , without problèm, we stay Where we want, many kiosque for the fair avenue néerlandais thé Laguna , very quiet drink inn water power are available, 2 minutes from dowtown, small dowtown, wifi is possible With cell phone only on internet por to dos a Panaméen application

name: Parita Front Gaz Station Main Road
description: On the main road Other side gaz station  a grassy place we ask people , no service and it's free 100 m to Dario Lopez's casa Maskinongé artesania

name: Los Pozos de Caldera
description: These are the hot springs of Caldera. When coming from Caldera signs mark the hot springs. Coming from the other direction is a much longer 4x4 mountain road in poor condition. The access road to the springs is a bumpy high-clearance dirt road,  not well maintained. After the bridge is a little parking space and you have to walk about 300m (way is signed). There are only some spots around the big river which really carry warm to hot water, but the main pool is about 40C. Admission is 3$/person.

name: Canon Macho de Monte
description: This Canyon is right next to the street. You already see a bit of the canyon when passing the bridge. You can either park directly besides the road or bit more up the street by a little cement building. To visit the actual canyon you just have to pass the gate directly after the bridge and walk a few meters and make your way down. If you are not sure, also the workers around there can point out the canyon to you.

name: lavanderia
description: lavandería cheap and fast $1 to wash and $1.50 to dry

name: Free Zone Pass Location
description: if you want to enter the free zone, second largest duty free in the world, you need to bring your passport to the pass building. it costs 1USD for the day.

name: Sabanitas Devant Le Juge De Nuit
description:
Unable to reach Terpel on the highway on police advice, the only flat and safe place along the main road, noisy traffic, the police and the judge were there until 3 am, firemen Have not accepted, 

Ne pouvant accéder à Terpel sur l'autoroute sur conseil de la police, le seul endroit plat et en sécurité le long de la route principale, circulation bruyante, la police et le juge etaient la jusqu'à 3 h du matin, les pompiers n'ont pas accepté , fautes de grives on mange les merles

name: AAPEC
description: This is a turtle conservatory right next to the road. We just passed by here and heard that it could be possible to camp here. But we did not ask about it. We also heard that they should have facilities like showers,  toilets,  communal area and a kitchen,  but as already said we did not take a look ourselves.

name: Hotel Heliconia
description: You can stay in their parking lot in low season. The owner very friendly opened a room for us so we could use the bathroom with hot showers. Its possible to get electricity for your car to the parking lot and there is slow WiFi over the property. You can cook if you bring all of your own stuff. They have a botanical garden at the back and the owners are really nice and helpful. We paid 20$ per night for two people in a car with rooftoptent. Please check beforehand with them via email tanagertourism@gmail.com (they answer super quick) or via phone +507 66760220 or +507 63702857 (ask for Loes or Kees).

name: Lavamatic express
description: Very good, clean laundromat right across the street from the Best Western Plus in Panama City. It has drop off service and self service. Friendly staff, fast, reliable machines. They have soap and softener.

name: aduana
description: Aduana for motorcycle on stahlratte. Enter through the cargo terminal entrance to the north.

name: Lago Bayano, Darien
description: These are the correct coordinates for the campground of Bayano Adventure. The place for parking and Camping is down by the lake. Look for sombody around near the entrance. In nobody there you can contact Antonio 507 6674 1135 (WhatsApp). Payed 15 $ for our truck. You can rent kajaks or they arrange boat trips to near caves. Very quiet and chilled spot.

name: Abrook Mall
description:
Parking unpaved, you can install without asking, other trucks are parked, opposite the cinema entrance in the direction of the university no amenities except those of the shopping center WC 25 WI FI in the center Wigo, this Place is interesting because very close to the Aduana DIJ has 5 minutes by car, it allows to be in front of the offices for the opening Aduana Inspection DIJ 5 minutes by road


Parking non revêtu , on s'installe sans demander , d'autres camions sont garés, face à l'entrée côté Cinema en direction de l'université aucune commodités sauf celles du centre commercial WC payant 25 cas WI FI dàns le centre Wigo, ce lieu est intéressant car tres pres delAduana DIJ a 5 minutes en voiture, cela permet d'être devant les bureaux pour l'ouverture This place is good for people who must go the day after to the Aduana Inspection  DIJ 5 minutes by road

name: Gamboa Le Long Du Canal
description:
All the people we met told us that we could park where we wanted. At a parking lot we can see the cargo ships. 'there is a small grocery store in the village. Secure corner next to the police station and it is free. go to the fire station, 200 m, to stock up on water, free.  Near police station on the canal side, quiet.
the train passes by a few times but did not bother us.  good place.
in the church on the opposite of the road, the pastor offered for us to use the shower!

name: Delicias Del Mar
description: Nice restaurant - food is good. Place to set up your tent. Weekends get irritatingly busy but weekdays so calm. $5 per night per person, wc and showers and potable water on site. Even Internet and electricity from restaurant. Parking is secure with cctv and locked gates.

name: manzanillo wallenius wilhelmsen office
description: office wallenius wilhelmsen for pick up bill of lading draft. 1.floor,office B8

name: Panama to Cartagena via the San Blas
description:
If you plan to sail from Panama to Colombia (or the other way) I highly recommend to cruze with captain Paul on the Ave Maria. The best and maybe only option if you want to avoid a party boat. Paul is very and professional and his girlfriend a perfect cooker! Both are very friendly. A very relaxing trip with delicious food.
avemariasailing@gmail.com
svavemaria.wordpress.com

name: Nat Green Camping
description:
Nice place, owned by a very welcoming and friendly naturalist. Camping $ 5 per person. Cold shower and electricity.
---
piste en face des Cabinas  Portosi. Bel endroit tenu par un naturaliste très accueillant et sympathique. camping 5$ par personne. douche froide et électricité. 
____
Edit in december/2023: the campground is now called Nat Green, and the owner charges $5 per person per night for overlanders

name: Kaikai vehicle insurance
description:
insurance for vehicle close to the entrance of the zona libre.
25 dollares a month for our van.

name: Motorcycles tech - Touratech Panamá
ReneCafe
description: Nice restraurant with friendly staff. Had a delicious menu for 10 dollars, dessert included. It was big enough but you can have a bigger one for 25 dollars. I recommend it!

name: Panama Canal Locks Miraflores
description:
Update 08/23: 18$ per person. 
—
$20 foreign adults to go to the observation deck, watch a video and get a tour of the place. Fast wifi inside, if you need to wait for a boat to pass by.

If you want to save some money ask for a free ticket to go to the restaurant on 2nd floor.

name: Bomberos parking
description:
Across from the Fire Station (Bomberos)there is parkingplace, very secure. 
This is a gated, level, grassy parking lot. We paid $5 for overnight. There is running water and a pit toilet (rough). Things are a little insecure in Boquete right now (according to locals) so this felt best. Also allowed dog to roam free.
Very quite in the night.

name: Luna's Castle Hostel
description: Great hostel, excellent vibe, best in Panama IMO. Free secure motorbike and car/SUV parking down the street.

name: Free Secure moto/car parking
description: No space for rigs, but perfect for motorcycles and small overland vehicles. Free, guarded by armed police. Parked my bike for 2 weeks, though signs only allow 24 hours. Guards were friendly and chill, though one asked for a bribe when I asked about parking for 2 weeks.

name: La Jungla Experience
description:
Hostel and Private Accommodations in Alto Boquete, Chiriqui, Panama
Home away from home in Boquete, Panama

name: FEDPA seguros
description:
Branch of FEDPA. quick and easy. We hired auto insurance for a month.


sucursal de FEDPA.  rápido y fácil. contratamos el seguro del auto por un mes.

name: Las Olas
description:
Hotel with facilities that have passandia. In low season they are 8 $ per person and you can make use of the pool, sauna, tennis court, restaurant and facilities. They let us park in the parking lot and sleep there. Very calm


Hotel con instalaciones que tienen pasandia. En temporada baja son 8$ por persona y puedes hacer uso de la piscina, sauna,  cancha de tenis, restaurante e instalaciones.  Nos dejaron aparcar en el estacionamiento y dormir allí.  Muy tranquilo

name: Hostal Libertad
description:
Hostel very close to David perfect for making the stopover with Costa Rica. It is a house with patio where you can park. Very quiet and the owners, an Italian and his wife from Dominican Republic very attentive and friendly. Double room with hot shower and internet 20 $. They have tb family rooms and with air conditioning (not the price)


hostal muy cerca de David perfecto para hacer la escala con Costa Rica. Es una casa con patio donde se puede aparcar. muy tranquilo y los dueños, un italiano y su mujer de república Dominicana muy atentos y amables. Habitación doble con ducha caliente e internet 20$. tienen tb habitaciones familiares y con aire acondicionado (no se el precio)

name: el parador cabañas de boquete
description:
This gazebo is advertised from this gazebo, but it was not worth it. Does not look gap and the site is nothing special


viene anunciado desde boquete este mirador, pero no nos mereció la pena. no se ve boquete y el sitio no tiene nada de especial

name: Taller Neil
description:
We were recommended this workshop and it was a success. Arranges all types of vehicles and motorcycles. The whole team is family friendly, super friendly and passionate about 4x4 and motorcycle expeditions. They helped us with everything we needed. We even attended on Saturday. Super recommended and at a good price. The owner's name is Neil and his phone number is 50766918836.


Nos recomendaron este taller y fue un acierto. Arregla todo tipo de vehiculos y motos. Todo el equipo es familiar, super amable y apasionados por expediciones 4x4 y motos. Nos ayudaron con todo lo que necesitábamos. Hasta nos atendieron en sabado. Super recomendables y a buen precio. El dueño se llama Neil y su teléfono es +50766918836.

name: Cerro Azul
description: Free, wild camping spot near Changres National Park. Flat gravel spot with great views of the park and valley. Can get windy and a little cold at night. You need high clearance and perhaps 4x4 to come up here, for the last 30-40 meters up a rutted hill.

name: Miami Mike's hostel
description: This is a small budget hostel ($11 for a dorm bed) in the town of Chitre. The owner is very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Bicycles can be stored on the rooftop and there is probably road parking but not sure about the security. Good kitchen to prepare your own meals.

name: Visa extention for boat arrivals
description: where you can extend your 72hour visa that you might get if you arrive by boat from the Pacific. We talked to different people and some seem to get the full visa, but we did not. The building is called the Albrook Office Center.  Enter between the fruit stall and the Makita tool shop.  Go to the third floor where you will find the migration department for the Pacific sector.  We paid $10 for a extra 2 weeks.  you can get 3 months for $100

name: Familia Romero garden
description: This is a house of friends living in La Chorrera. They have a pretty big space for parking. It is a very quiet and safe neighbourhood. Ask for Javier (speaks English and French). He and his family are very nice. They charge but something like 5 usd pp. There is public transportation nearby. A good place to chill if you don't want to be in Panama City. Oh and there's very good wifi! :)

name: Porto Lindo
description: on the waterfront for free

name: Pass  Electrcidad Solar
description: they now eveyting about solar 12 or 24 volt

name: Suzuki motorcycle shop
description: This is where you can get parts and service. Not much English spoken. Waiting to see if fuel pump or filter has gone bad.

name: Seguros Fedpa S.A.
description: You could buy your insurance for 25usd for 1 month

name: Hostel andros
description:
Hostel clean wifi bathrooms private cheap restaurant under the hostel


Hostel clean wifi baños privado barato restaurante a bajo del hostal

name: Beachside
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Locals reported it is not safe to camp in this location. Please use caution.

We stayed 5 meters from the water, very quiet. There is a sandy road before the blue gate on the right hand side. Sand next to the grass is very solid. Beach is not great but if you look for something close to town that's a good place.

name: Boquete Brewery
description:
Brewery with food truck, microbrews and covered outside seating.  Pints are 4.50 but happy hour is $1 off 1-5 daily.  Pitchers, normally $12, are $2 off during happy hour so commit to a beer and let the good times roll. Opens at 4pm.

*U.S. rock ballads guaranteed.

name: Sugar & Spice Bakery
description:
Amazing bakery. Good breakfast and lunch options as well.
Update: closed on Wednesday, all other days 8am to 6pm

name: Police checkpoint
description: Quick police check. Remember, always wear shoes while driving ;)

name: Pilotos truck stop - Overnight Truck stop with gas station
description: Huge and relatively quiet (rare for a gas station!)

name: sea shore
description: free parking where you can stay overnight for 1 night only. At 10 mn from the DTJ vehicle inspection. A bit noisy bit not far from the Seafood market. There is a small place for kids to play and a place for practising sports, all free and by the sea.

name: Parking on gras opposite MC Diving Coiba
description: FREE!! We stayed overnight on the opposite of MC Diving Coiba, right next to the Santa Catalina Hostel. There is a gras area in front of an empty house where you can park. FREE!!

name: Public Parking lot Playa Venao
description:
FREE!! We stayed overnight right at the beach at the parking of the Hotel Playa Venao & Resort, Bar & Restaurant. There also is a shower that you can use if you drink or eat something at the bar. It's in front of the surf and volleyball.
It's a great place to stay! 
They might charge $20/day for parking during high season (mid December-March).
