Important: there only is one Mini Mart here with very high prices (1L water $3) So I'd recommend to stock up before you go here!

name: entrance before Sherman
description: they checked the vehicle and asked questions.

name: Restaurant Tom
description: Poor signage.  Restaurant is upstairs in the back with tables overlooking the water.  Local spot with daily plate specials, seafood and beers.  We had the stewed chicken plate w/beverage for $5. closed weekends.

name: Captain Caribe
description: Very nice place with really good burgers. Cool folks hanging around here. Would highly recomend to go there! And it is quite cheap

name: Water taxi to Bocas
description: This is one of the passenger water taxis To Bocas town. There are a few options and you will be surrounded by guys trying to get you on their taxi. We kept our ticket and showed when buying the return ticket because we agreed on the price upfront and they had written the price for the return on the back of our tickets.

name: Auto Centro
description: Nice, modern car center and store with a wifi lounge and AC. They sell tires, oil, filters, etc etc. you buy or bring the oil and then pay $10 for oil change. Tire rotation was about $6.

name: Don Quijote Restaurant
description:
A great spanish restaurant. Run by a very charming couple from the south of spain.
Amazing REAL spanish food. To a good price. 
They also let you stay for free if you have meal with them.
Great WiFi and service

name: Los Ladrillos (Rock Climbing)
description: Free wall to climb. Also just cool to see if you're not into rock climbing.

name: Epifanio camp
description: Very nice play to stay. You can park your car on their garage with eletricity, water and internet. For free. House yellow in front of china store.

name: Public beach
description: Free parking near the dark beach with a little breeze. No shade. Some basic beach restaurants which close rather early, so it's quiet. Maybe different at weekends.

name: El Machico Hostel Boquete
description:
New Hostel that opened in December of 2016.  It's a great place surrounded by amazing nature with fantastic hosts!

E-mail us at elmachicoboquete@gmail.com if you have any questions!

name: Playa Guánico
description:
Several camping options right in front the ocean. Clean and very calm because this place is hardly developed. 1 surf hostel and 1 basic restaurant/bar. No WiFi, no market. One can drive either side on the beach. If you are driving around the restaurant (on the beach) you will find a sandy road which runs very soon between the sea and a river. Nice, windy but no shade. If you cross the river and walk from there around the hill you will find a secluded little beach where turtles are hatching. At least in December. Ask someone from here.
No idea where one will get if driving to the other side of the beach.

name: Playa La Ermita
description: Parking area right on the beach, on the right as you get to the beach, next to a couple of small seafood restaurants. Safe for camping, and kept reasonably clean,  but not recommended on the weekends or public holidays - too busy, loud music.  The restaurant serves a decent, cheap  seafood and will give you the keys for the restroom and also fill water

name: Playa  Escondito
description: The beach is wonderful and you are alone here. Maybe you can stay for the night with a small vehicle under the trees where the ground is plane. No facilities only beach!

name: Playa El Toro
description: Kind of flat near the bridge, maybe possible to park a small car on the other side of it under the trees but then you might get parked in. Super quiet. The beach is full with rocks so be carefully while swimming. BUT it is incredibly full of plastic trash from the sea all along this nice wild beach. Very nice breeze when we were there, no surfer's beach.

name: National Park Sarigua - Desert Section
description:
Hiking through desert areas, some nice red and dark spotted sections. We walked around 6 km . Entrance is 5 US pp . Camping 3 US pp, where ever one likes.
Toilets are at the park entrance. Water as well, portable???
2019 NOTE : free camping at the entrance and free entrance but because of reforestation, you can only sleep at the entrance. 
2022: Still free camping and you can go to the salt marsh for camping again (or at the entrance if you want toilets)

name: Half way on Punta Chame
description: Several large flat pull outs facing the Pacific. A bit of a beach, more at low tide. The lagoon is directly opposite but due to the VERY strong wind no insects at all. Beautiful sunset and very quiet. Kite surfer might be seen.

name: David behind the mall great Residencial area
description:
end of a double way. grassy area next to a residential area. nice neighbourhood.

Warning: on Feb 25-2017, police officers told us not to camp here as we would be harmed if we did. Not sure if true or not, and not trying to freak people out, but take how you may.

name: Parque National Metropolitano
description: Entrance: 4 US. In total 6 km easy hiking. Portable water, also to fill up a camper and shower BUT no overnight parking. Opens from 6 am - 5 pm. Very friendly staff.

name: Old parking lots next to the Smithsonian Rescue and Conservation Project
description: Flat and quiet. No one bothers if one parks here. Lots of trees around. We slept here to hike the Pipeline Road the next morning. To enter Gamboa one has to cross a bridge which is restricted to 10 tons.

name: Esclusa de Agua Clara
description: The old Gatun Locks are closed for Tourists. The new attraction are the Agua Clara Locks. 15 US$ per person!

name: Hostal Acuarela
description:
Nice comfortable hostel that offers doorm beds for $15 w/ basic breakfast  (toast and coffee) and also private room options for bigger parties between $40 and $60 which includes private bathroom and complete breakfast (coffee, eggs, ham, toast, juice, fruit).

Wifi is free but can go out at times. May not be suitable for large vehicles. Perfect for motorcycle.

Your hosts also have a basic bfast, lunch, and dinner menu which is very affordable and delicious. Also available is a fridge w/ beer, soda, water, juice, and some other random items available for purchase.

Kitchen is available for guest use, as well as a small area in fridge to store your perishables.

Area is fairly quiet and not much to do, just relax and enjoy the beach.  3 basic supermarkets available within walking distance. 2 restaurants available but are pricie at $20 and above.

Back patio offers hammocks and beds to lounge

name: Electrisa
description:
Electricity shop with lots of variety and very good quality. We found cables that we had not found in the last 5 months


Tienda de electricidad con mucha variedad y muy buena calidad. Encontramos cables que no habíamos encontrado en los últimos 5 meses

name: Alumicentro Panamá
description:
Sale of aluminum. Here we find aluminum tubes for camping tent


venta de aluminio. aquí encontramos tubos de aluminio para la tienda de acampar

name: Autoaire Super frio
description:
Air conditioning repair shop in David. Phone 7759915/7751632


taller de de reparación de aire acondicionado en David. Telefono 7759915/7751632

name: Fedpa
description: This the place where to get car insurance in Panama city

name: Panapass
description: Here you can get the panapass for free (if your car is from Panama, if not forget it). after you need to charge it, at super 99 and other spots.

name: Bus station to Miraflores locks
description: In Albrook, this is the right place to catch the bus to go to Miraflores lock. No any sign to recognire destination!...

name: Los Tesoros de mi Casa
description:
This is the right place for entrance of this hostel. 
Localisation on Mapsme is wrong and it is hard to find the hostel because nothing is written outside, no name, nothing...it is just a small building (2 floors) and the hostel in first floor is in fact a sharing apartment. 
Basic but cheap (24€ for a double, without Booking...) and great location in front of "screw" building in the heart of business district. 
People friendly and helpful.

name: Evergreen offices
description:
To take back your car from Cartagena. Here you can get BILL OF LADING. 
Have to pay 40$ cash.

name: La Casa Amarilla
description:
A nice and cosy hotel with possibility to have a "cabaña" if small budget : 35$ for a double with fan and shared bathroom. 
On Monday (after w. e.) the owner offered us a double room with AC and all comfort for 55$. 
We preferred the "cabaña" and have a good diner in the restaurant. 
Open from November to May.

name: Playa Hermosa
description:
Near Boca Chica, a very nice beach to camp. 
During the day a few people and after 6:00 pm every body leaves : the whole beach for us. 
A little bit steep and rough for 10 meters to access to the beach but we've seen cars (no 4x4) riding in the beach. 
Free, no water, no toilet.

name: Taller Jorge 4x4
description: Jorge es especialista en 4x4, transmisiones, motores diesel y nafteros. Muy buena gente y conocedor de carros. Precios justos. No importa que falla tengas es el lugar correcto. Se puede pasar la noche en su parking. Recomendado.

name: Volcan police station
description: Big grass lot on side of police station and post office. Asked at front desk and they said park anywhere. Two block walk to Main Street(Highway) through town with shops, gas and grocery stores.

name: San Francisco Iglesia Veraguas
description: Parked on square outside the second oldest church in Panama per the guide at the church. Quiet town - supermarket a block away. 200 meters from Balneario El Salto. Free.

name: La Ville de Los Santos Cementerio
description: Quiet flat spot in front of gates of cemetery and stadium. 3 blocks from historic Iglesia San Atanasio (which is under serious renovation and is closed) and central historic area. Able to use free InternetParaTodos network.

name: Mirador Santa Fe NP
description: Wild Camp with beautiful view. Quiet. The paved road goes to El Guabal. Indigenas told us, its not possible to drive further. From Guabal the road was under construction and looked quite muddy :-)

name: Biomuseo
description:
The Bio Museum is an enjoyable place in itself and not too too expensive at USD$18.00 (bring your student card if you have one and it's $11). 

They also have wifi which is great because if you're camping on the causeway you can just walk by and nab it. There's also water fountains and bathrooms on the ground floor that you can access during opening hours without a ticket.

name: SOLARTEC
description: Sells solar panels. Owned by very nice and friendly people. There are quite few selections of solar panels. We needed to buy it because our second battery broken down.

name: Hotel Aramo
description:
55$ a room with 2 dual beds, breakfast, air conditioned and warm swimming pool. Secure parking . Very quiet.

We paid 48USD for two people with parking and breakfast.

The restaurant is good.

name: Bom Bom
description: Part of "Island Plantation" but open to public. Small beach bar on the sand. $2.25 beers. EXCELLENT wood oven pizza ($11 margherita). Great lounge chairs & chairs with cushions. Sun & shade.

name: Skully's
description: Water refill 0,50$ for 1gallon ( it says 25c for a gallon but you get about 2L)

name: John Car Wash
description: We had our rig washed for $10 and asked about parking overnight when we were told we couldn't stay at police station and Umberto said of course.  There is a bathroom that's open while carwash is open.  There's a nail salon here too?!.  Free! There are shops and restaurants nearby including a Delta gas station across the road.

name: Lavanderia Suprema
description:
1.50-3$ per big machine. Payed 12$ for 3 machines + drying. Very friendly. Parking infront. 
8am-8pm

name: Photocopy
description: Here you can make some photocopies 10c each is on the super 99

name: Close to the río
description: Very quiet place, the other place had a very dirty road so we couldn't go with our big rig. Local friendly people comes to have a bath. The rio is beautiful but it's better to swim here before there is caïman !!! You can Fish. Really great time. FREE

name: Rio chorcha
description: Close to the road, in the side of the river, shadow, We stop there for the meal, We didn't stop for the night. Possible to go swimming, the water is clear and you can fish also. Not very visible from the road but a little noisy.

name: local market
description: This is the center market. Tourist goods and produce

name: Lost and Found
description: Isolated hostel in the forest offering dorms, private rooms and a lot of tours and activities. Around $14 per night or four nights for the price of three. Very busy bar in the evenings! A single room is costing me $57/ night. No coffee maker, but told there was.

name: Surfari B&B
description: Small hotel 1.5 blocks from water taxi in Bocas Town.  Well run, clean, AC, fast Wi-Fi, nice breakfast included.  Paid $51 a night thru Booking.com for a big room with private bath.  Also has communal kitchen and nice rooftop terrace. Lots f restaurants nearby.  Manager can help with tours and recommendations.

name: Cecilia's parking
description: Fenced yard on side of lady's house with locked gate.  she charged us $5 per 25 hours.  Our rig was too big for the $3 place.  If she's not there, go down the street to strip mall where you will see some buses.  She works washing them.

name: Relax, you are shipping your car. General Info
description:
I would just really quickly like to make everyone feel better who is worrying about the shipping thing. We did RoRo with WWL yesterday without an agent. I was very worried about that day because the process and involved difficulty is put into a worse light than needed (in my opinion at least), so I would like to make a positive statement about it for once: IT IS NOT THAT BAD! Just like a big border day. You go to 3-4 different offices, then get your car inspected and off you go. Of course it is a little stressful, but if you have been ok with the borders, you will be ok here. Even more than ok, because people were much more helpful (locals and officials) than at many borders. Also to note: Fewer people than at borders and no pushy helpers. Just follow the steps 1-4 on iOverlander and you will be fine. We started at 8 o´clock at the office of the Shipping company (nicest office, but unfriendliest people of the day) and were done with it all by 1:30 pm.

And if you need a wall to be put in behind your drivers compartment for roro: Procars in Panama City do it (on ioverlander) at around 50$.

Agent: Not needed in my opinion with all the info available online etc.

Police Inspection (Things I did not know): You can turn up at that parkinglot very early to draw a number if you want. Some people got Number 9 at 6 am (??!), but we got number 14 at 7:30 am and did not have to wait long to have the car inspected, so I think it is not worth it getting there THAT early. One thing which did take much longer than expected (and was a problem for others because they had an appointment with their agent or something) was picking up the Papers at 2. We waited for over an hour, so have that time accounted for.

Road from Panama City to Colon (also very diff. to find info): Panapass is only for the coredor norte, not for the road to Colon. If you get out of the city without the Coredor norte (no problem really), then you will get to a "cuota" road to colon at some point. Here you pay 2,50$ cash and off you ride. We started driving at 6:30 on a weekday from the Yacht Club and got to the Terminal in Colon at 8:15.
Maybe this helps someone to relax about it all. Have a great day!

name: Luna Llena
description: Chilled out hostel with beautiful decorations, positive vibe and nice kitchen to cook (hard to find in Portobelo). Just a few minutes walk from the church,  ask for Nelson. Dormitory for $10.

name: El Cimarron Portobelo
description: Truly local experience, much different from other tourist agencies. Nelson, the local rasta, offers a lot of interesting and original things to do in Portobelo, we went by boat to camp on Playa Huerta and by cayuco to do a jungle hike to a secret beach with top class snorkeling. You can also learn how to make your own coconut oil or to cook coconut rice with octopus. Also great source of information if you are looking for a place to stay.

name: Pedro Miguel locks
description: Here you can see big boats crossing locks by the canal. It's only a parking area but it's FREE if you don't want to pay at the Miraflores viewpoint. Very close to the canal.

name: Evergreen - Bill of landing
description:
We shipped our van in a container from Cartagena to Colon.  

Here at the Evergreen Building on level 10 you can get the Bill of Landing (BL) for $40 before going to Colon to get your container.

We shipped with Enlace Caribe from Cartagena.  Before going to Evergreen contact them to make sure they have authorised the container to be released.  They didn't for us and we had to wait 2 hours for them to contact Evergreen to allow us permission to get the Bill of Landing (BL).

name: Auto Centro (ServiCentro)
description: We were able to get an alignment for our tall heavy rig and we bought new 5 AT LT 285/70R tires.  Gotta have patience here. Took more than six hours for it all!

name: San Carlos Beach Inn
description: Wonderful place with very nice patio in the roof-with a barbecue and hammock. Prices starts from 35 for double. Nice climate, very clean, hot water, AC. One of the cheapest in that area. 6 min walking from the beach. Near you have restaurant and market.

name: Terpel Va&Ven
description: Free truck stop, very clean bathroom and showers, wifi, paid laundry ($0.75 for wash, same to dry). Suggest parking around back for a slightly quieter night.

name: Terpel
description: Standard Terpel Va&Ven - free truck stop, wifi, clean bathrooms.

name: Texaco dirt parking lot
description:
Asked the attendant if we could park overnight in the large dirt parking lot behind the petrol station, and he said of course! 
It was breezy with plenty of trees for shade, a little noise from the road, but he said the bathroom would be open all night (no running water though, so you need to take a bucket of water from next to the fuel pump so you can flush). 
No other facilities, free (you might want to tip him so they're happy for others to camp here in the future though).

name: Terpel Va&Ven truckstop
description: Noisier and more basic than most Va&Vens, but still allows free overnight parking, 24hr toilets, and free wifi (have to request password). No showers or laundry though.

name: parking behind the policestation
description: we first camped at the docks of the canal. but the police came at night and we had to leave because it's private and very unsafe! Here at the parkinglot you can camp and the neighbourhood is very friendly. we could even use the bathroom in one of the houses.

name: CanalBank
description:
If you want to open a bank account in Panama, this is the best one as the ladies working here speaks english and are super helping ! I have done five banks on this street — all but Canalbank had a very mediocre service. 

The requirement to open a bank account with Canal Bank is-
1) passport
2) second id
3) a bill with your bank account
4) two letters of reference from two  banks in your home country
5) a proof of a job in Panama

name: Hotel Latino
description: Simple, clean double rooms for $41,80. Good, affordable restaurant. Good internet. Small swimming pool.

name: hotal miami
description:
Quiet hostel, practical and safe buenr located, good excuses and ambles the owners. 

tranqilo hostal, práctico y seguro buenr ubicado, buenas perdonas y ambles los dueños.

name: Hostal Agua Vida
description: Beautiful property with lots of grass area which they dont allow you to use for van camping. Still new but not overlander friendly. Much of the property is uneven. So hard to find a proper spot to park. The guy was stoned the time we arrived & he put us in what they call parking behind the main house (uneven also). He quoted 10 usd per night for 2 people.  They have rooms for 30 usd. He would not let us camp in front of the house that was the only place that was flat.They said they have WIFI but we never managed to connect. Actually, he had to buy some data as they dont have proper landline but a router with limited data.Not recommended & definitely not overlander friendly. Maybe they will get improved in the future.

name: Hostal Llano Lindo
description:
A clean place run by a friendly señor who speaks some English. 12USD per person with breakfast included. He lowered the price for us to 10USD pp after some bargaining. 
There is a fully equipped kitchen available for using. The village is just a kilometer away and has lots of supermarkets for grocery shopping.
We could park motorcycles inside a patio behind locked gates for the night. For small cars he has 3 parking places under the roof. In general the place is a bit away from the main road and seems very calm. 
Wifi works well. 
The weather temperature in this region is much more pleasant than along the Panamericana because of the altitude ;)

name: Casa Blanca
description:
It is actually a bed and breakfast but they have such a nice spot right on the bay of Portobello it's great for a stay over when shipping or just to chill for a few days. 
They charge 5us person for camping. They are waiting for wifi but have a hotspot to use
Beers and food are not expensive and close to town. 
Contact them for space. 507 67809898
Email speakez.panama@gmail.com
Try and book a spot before hand as they have limited spots.

name: Gualaca, Chiriqui
description:
Private residence of Regina, a German, who rents a room in his house very comfortable. Per night / week She offers toures also. 6790-7177 

private residence of Regina, una Alemana, que alquila un cuarto en su casa bien comodo. por noche / semana
Ella ofrece toures tambien. 6790-7177

name: Hojaldres
description: Name changed. Menu looks great, but only has what is in the warming pans available. Cheap. Fast. Easy. Good juices.

name: Don Quijote
description:
This restaurant has got a nice camping area on the upper floor, indoor, no problems with rain.
For about 6$ a night.
You can also get all the camping equipment rented (tent + mattress). In this case it's all 8$ a night.
There's a basic kitchen avaialable

name: El pirate
description:
Nice restaurant, breakfast around 5$, happy hour from 5-7pm cocktails for 2,75$ beer for 1$.
Plate between 10 (pollo asado) and 18$ (pescado entero especial)

name: Free Spirit - Bastimentos Island - Bocas del Toro
description: Small B&B with 1 or 2 places to put your tent

name: cordillera refugio mamao
description:
magic place for camping with a cabin. Nice climate, panoramic view and a safe place to spend sometime, very nice people on the neighborghood.
magico lugar de camping y cabañas con exelente clima y panorama, muy seguro  buenas y atentas personas

name: Beach Near Fort
description: Little protected beach. Not too bad, but Fort is better.

name: Beach
description: I'm not a beach person- butI don't want to leave. Lots of friendly locals saying hi. Great spot near the cliff. Blackish sand beach which is a great beginner break for surfers. Free. Great bakery and coffee shop in town across from the store. Next door is a surf camp with tents, but I prefer my rooftent ;) I've heard the locals keep an eye out for troublemakers and aren't afraid to invite them to leave.

name: Road Beside River
description: Hidden gem further up from parking lot. Lots of camping spots. Local secret. Requires 4x4.

name: Playa La Barqueta
description: Huge empty national park. No one here. Nice dark sand beach. Infinite possibilities. Must be comfortable driving on soft  sand. 4x4 a must.

name: Roadside
description: Flat area at end of paved road. Nice view.

name: Butterfly Haven
description: Its $'7 dollar per person and the Tour is about 30 minutes minimum. You can see a lot of different butterflies and learn a lot about their lifecycle.

name: Procare Service's 4x4 top of the mechanic for almost anything!
description: Here you can order several parts. Expensive, we pay around three time the euopean price but very efficient. We had our shocks within 4days.

name: Water pump free water
description: Water smells like chlorine,very clear. Safe to wash your colored clothes. From the public service pump. There are 3 pumps in this area, the first one's faucet is broken. This is the second one. Always boil your drinking water!!

name: Grass close to blue and white building
description: Since you cannot park on the beachside from march to november (turtle season), you can negociate to park on the grass on the west side of the road. One of the locals speaks english, very nice family man mid twenties. Lives on the hill behind.

name: End of car/truck road
description:
Unless you have a serious 4x4, you dont get there by car. Atv bridge only. Rent a quad @ flying pirates, or cycle/walk

You can camp there also very quiet !!

name: Clinic very close to the hospital
description: Requested to park at the hospital, the guard got me here on his bike. Gave him 5$. Between the hospital and some police station at the corner, feels safe for the night.

name: Ocean Hostal
description:
This place is amazing! We stayed here for a week because our car was at the machanic. 
The owner, called Leon is a really fun and helpful guy. He called for us the mechanic, has free bicycles to go to town, sells amazing cold drinks for 1$ and its right next to the beach! Also the price, compared to the other places is the best. You pay 5$  pp to stay here including, shower, toilet, huge kitchen with fridge and an 8 pit stove! There also is Wifi. 

Before we stayed here we paid 12$ pp at Oasis without any facilities...

name: Casa Loma Pedasi
description:
what a great find!  Couldn't find a place to camp....Drove upto this hotel n the owner let us hook up to electrical. $8pp a night. Swimming pool. Shower. toilet. clean tp!
restaurant serves breakfast $5 ea. outdoor kitchen. top of the line. can't say enough good things about it. minutes to local beach arenal.

name: Lavanderia
description: The Sun express lavanderia. Had our clothes done within the day. 20lbs for $17 very friendly.

name: La Estrello Del Pacifico Cabanas y Camping
description: Nice cabanas for $30 in the off season. Lots of space for camping but we wanted to stay indoors as it was raining cats and dogs. Nice place right by the beach.

name: Queso Chela
description: Cheese store, worth a stop, they sell mozzarella, ricotta, cheddar, bread and even natural quark! Try the Queso asadero, it's great!

name: panagas (Fill US Bottles)
description: filled our 20 lbs US propane bottles in no time. 10USD per bottle. this place does NOT have a lunch break, unlike tropigas across the road.

name: Cementary of Canal workers
description: Obviously the cementary of the French workers who died during the first attempt to build the Canal. We tripped over it, it's next to the street, sadly not very maintained.

name: Afro-Caribbean Museum
description: Well worth the dollar. Do not go to the address on their website. Easiest is to take the Metro to the Cinco de Mayo station. It is across the street.

name: Sevilla Aparthotel
description: As we had some time to kill while our vehicle ships RORO, we found this place that offers small apartments with full kitchen.  Checked it on Booking.com but decided to walk over and check it out first and manager offered us $55/night all in, which was cheaper.  They have continental breakfast, a pool, gym and cheapy laundry machines.  Decent location with shops and restaurants.

name: Playa la Angosta
description:
Restaurant next to the beach. Tons of palapas and parking. $15per vehicle to use it and camp. Bathrooms and showers available. additional $0.50 for shower though. 
Electricity is available only at the restaurant. Wifi at the restaurant
Great bay for swimming! Lots of locals during the day with music but owners close the gates at 6pm so the music shuts off.

name: Bomberos de Arraijan
description:
Fire station that greeted us kindly. We slept upstairs in a place that resembled the warehouse of the barracks. To get there, there is a ladder to climb, sensitive hearts to refrain. Just enough room to hold two people lying down. Not the big lux, but effective troubleshooting after a hard day of biking. Nearby: a Chinese restaurant and a supermarket that holds the essential. Municipal Internet open to all. Toilet and shower. 

Station de pompiers qui nous ont accueillis gentiment.  Nous avons dormi à l'étage dans un endroit qui s'apparente à l'entrepot de la caserne.  Pour y acceder, il y a une echelle à grimper, coeurs sensibles s'abstenir.  Juste assez de place pour tenir deux personnes couchées.  Pas le gros lux, mais dépannage efficace après une dure journée de vélo.  À proximité: un restaurant chinois et un supermarché qui tient l'essentiel.  Internet municipal ouvert à tous. Toilettes et douche.

name: English speaking - AutoSpecialist
description:
If you need to repair or change anything on your car in Panama, make sure you do it here. Josh is a really friendly and honest American who knows everything about cars. He can tell you exactly what is wrong or help you finding parts you need. Also he understands the costs for an Overlander, so he will give you an honest price. 

Make sure you first contact him, because he has a small working place: +50769682295

name: Cancha de futbol
description:
Very quiet and safe place, opposite the police station, without facilities but ideal to rest !!!

Lugar muy tranquilo y seguro, enfrente esta la policia, sin servicios pero ideal para descansar!!!

name: Parque Principal
description:
We stopped for one night at a corner of the cemetery, but on the second night we were there the police recommended not to stay there as it was an unsafe place. The park is very quiet at night and the police are in front. Ideal place of passage to the north.

Paramos una noche en el punto del cementerio pero en la segunda noche que estuvimos la policía nos recomendó no quedarnos ahí ya que era un lugar inseguro. El parque es muy quieto por la noche y la policia esta enfrente. Lugar ideal de paso hacia el norte

name: Estacionamiento hotel
description:
We paid 3 dollars a night, super quiet, next to the river and close to the beach. We did not find any place more economical. It's all private !!!

Pagamos 3 dolares por noche, super tranquilo, al lado del rio y cerca de la playa. No encontramos ningún lugar mas económico. Es todo privado!!!

name: Parque Principal
description:
We slept at several spots in the city, but for safety  reasons the police recommended to sleep in the park. Super quiet at night and there is wifi until 11pm.

dormimos en varios puntos en la ciudad, la policia por seguridad nos recomendo dormir en el parque. Super tranquilo en la noche y hay wifi hasta las 23 horas.

name: Las Lajas Beach Resort
description:
14 rooms with restaurant and swimming pool 
Possibility of using the place during the day 9am-5pm. 
Likely best facilities in town

name: Seguros Fedpa S.A.
description:
Car Insurance for Panama
15us$ for 1 month
you need all passports from the driver and the carpaper
the lady in the small blue office make copies for free 
quick process
make it bevor enter to panama. Was closed in weekend!!!!!

name: Beautiful Cabaña
description:
We met Phil and Jacky in Boquete. After they told us that they have a beautiful house in alto Boquete we decided to go with them. 
If you want to treat yourself to a nice house/cabaña on your trip, make sure you do it here. It is a 5 min drive from town, and has everything: amazing warm shower, bedroom with a beautiful view, kitchen, oven, tv (netflix), hammock, sofa, fast wifi etc. And Phil and Jacky made our stay even better with good wine and nice talks!

name: Lavamatico, Laundry
description:
good and cheap laundryservice
1 loud wash 1,75 us$
1 loud dry 1,75 us$
selfwash not possible

name: Oreba Organic chocolate and cacao tour
description:
Organic Cacao plantation tour managed by Indigenas. Very good tour through the plantation including the whole process from opening the fruit to grinding the roasted beans. The tour includes a local lunch.
Tours are 2 times per day (10h and 13h) and costs 25 US$ per person (if you come here directly, tour from Almirante is 30$ including the transport).
Tours in Spanish, English, German, French, Portugese, Italian (with Jack as the Guide).
The location is a short walk up the hill from the road. If you call or ask around they will pick you up on the main road.

Its a good idea to call ahead (but not required): +50764115670 or +50767643145
Email: acodaacoreba1234@gmail.com
Website: oreba.bocasdeltoro.org

name: Rio Oeste Arriba
description:
Rio Oeste Arriba is the name of the Indigena village where you can do the Oreba cacao tour. This is a level parking bay next to the road where you can spend the night if you want to do the tour. 
Talk to the tour guide, they might ask a donation for the village (3$).
Be aware that it is quite humid here.
From this place there is also a concete walkway up the hill to the cacao cooperative building.
We did not ask about toilets.
You can bring your dog on the tour also.

name: Hotel El Bongo
description: New nice hotel, good to place wait for your sailing trip. They have diffrent rooms, most of them with nice ocean view. TV, good WIFI, fridge and microwave in the room. The restaurant Captain Jack from Portobello will soon move there. Bit expensive but friendly and helpful owner.

name: Dario Lopez Masks
description:
he is the most famost maskmaker in Panama
you can buy for little money masks
he shows you how to make the mask
its a small green house with white fence

name: Seahaven
description:
CLOSED ! 
$5 pp close to trails, restaurants down road. Saw monkeys and lots of birds. Internet near by no Movistar service.  Hotel hoping to be open by September 2017

name: La Casita de Farallon
description: small house with four double rooms on suite, kitchen only has a sink fridge and microwave, very clean and only an outside communal area but very nice. near to the beach. hosts live away from the bungalow but are very welcoming. they have links to nearby Pipas restaurant and the Coffee Shop. parking for a few bikes only in the garden. very clean breakfast was included. US$50 pn per room.

name: Seguros Internacionales
description: You can renew your vehicle insurance here for $15/mo. Fast service

name: Hostal Wunderbar
description:
nice hostal running by germans
close to puerto lindo harbour
good place when you plan to sail to colombia
laundry for 7$
rooms with ac 55$, with fan 45$ ( negotiable)
dogfriendly
small pool and nice big garten with a treehouse to watch birds
wifi $3 per device/day, no cell connection

name: cañon macho de monte
description: lugar tranquilo para pasar la noche a 100 metros de la entrada del cañón natural, acceso a agua cristalina

name: Hard Rock Hotel
description: acceso gratuito los lunes, martes, y miércoles al bar de la terraza en el piso 62. Free access at the pub on roof, monday, tuesday and wednesday, floor 62

name: parking ventas metetí
description: Free parking with several shops nearby, quiet location

name: entrada parque nacional omar torrijos
description: End of paved road with space for parking, Access to Waterfall The yayas (the yayas waterfall), entrance us 2 p / p. At 200 mts entrance to the National Park, start road 4 * 4.

name: cascadas las Yayas
description: Beautiful natural setting ... with three waterfalls and wells for swimming entry value for foreigners 2 dollars with access to bathrooms.

name: Catedral Santiago Apostol Natá De Los Caballeros
description: One of the oldest churches built by the Spaniards (correction- enslaved indigenous) on the Pacific coast. Beautiful square. Free WIFI

name: balneario el salto
description: Cute place to take a bath and cool off. It has two small waterfalls. Free open space.

name: salto las palmas
description: In the village of Las Palmas, 12 km from the Pan American, there is a little known Panamanian natural beauty. The arrival is very steep and winding but worth it.

name: Mirador El Nancito
description: Spectacular view of the exit of the river Santiago to the Pacific. With a shelter. Short 4 km deviated from the Pan American, via Nancito.

name: Plaza Bolívar
description: Space on the street with some spaces around the cathedral St. Joseph of David, and in front of a police station. Suitable only for overnight, there are no bathrooms ..

name: Balneario rio Guabo
description: Small river at the edge of the route, beautiful spa with crystal clear water.

name: Estacionamiento Plaza Changuinola
description: Open parking, with surveillance, restaurant and supermarket (with public bath)

name: Drive with caution
description: Heavily policed area. Do not speed. Both directions police every mile or two, and one major police check point.

name: Taca Tucan Hostel
description:
Taca Tucan is a cosy and welcoming hostel, close by the beach (80m), air-conditioned for your comfort. The 3 mixed Dorm rooms accommodate up to 4 people each (max. 5, ask for availability). All bunk beds are ready for a great sleep upon arrival with a clean sheet. Bring a lock for your locker.

Hot and cold showers available, air-condition during the night from 20-8h.
Enjoy the community kitchen including refrigerator and cooking facilities.

Taca Tucan is easy to get to by public transport and close to the beach. Enjoy the hammocks in the quiet garden and the life of the fisher village. The accommodation is popular with solo travelers, adventurers and friends. Ideal for backpackers who want to relax and unwind. Feel the warm sand under tired feet as you stroll along the shore and recharge in the sea.

The coexistence and respect of the other is very important here in the hostel. Everyone has something to give. Everyone has an experience or adventure to share.

name: Paunch
description: Where people park to surf. It's on the side of the road. We parked right next to the stones and stretched our awning out onto the small patch of sand before the reef. I asked a local who lives and surfed here if he thought anyone would care if we camped here. He said no one would care. So far no one has said anything. The traffic is mostly bikes, ATVs, and Taxis, due to all the pot holes they all go really slow. Very quiet at night. We got tacos up at the tacos place. There wifi almost stretches down here. If you had a booster maybe you could have wifi. Our Claro has 4G here.

name: Altos de Campana
description: Nice spot with an amazing view over the Bahia de Chame, less than one hour away from Panama City. It used to be open, but now there is a family living at the entrance that might charge you something to spend the night. We paid 10$ for two and a camper truck. Close to Cerro Cruz and Altos de Campana National Park.

name: Los Cajones de Chame
description: Rock labyrinth of river formed by erosion and weathering. Not only accesible to 4wd, steep slope. It's worth the drive.

name: Restaurante Brisas del Mar
description: It's the parking lot of a small restaurant right in front of the beach. The owner, Miss Flor, is a great host. She wouldn't charge us for spending the night in our camper as long as we consumed something from her restaurant (tuna steak with patacones 5$, beer 1$). Great views and very calmed place.

name: Cámping ANAM Reserva Forestal la Yeguada
description: Established campground with cold showers and one toilet next to the ANAM (Autoridad Nacional del Ambiente) office. There is no electricity but you can charge your devices in the ANAM office. Great point of departure for various waterfalls and hiking trails.

name: Seguros Sura
description: We were unable to extend our insurance policy so we bought an additional month of insurance here for $15.16.

name: Hidden area from the road
description: But further up the road from the trash quarry is another smaller quarry. I pushed my bike through the quarry and out the other side to find a few flat places to camp on the other side of it. You are kind of camping in Little Rock's but they have this moss stuff growing in it which makes it softer and won't damage your tent. Feels pretty comfortable provided you have some kind of sleeping pad . Hidden from the road

name: Shawalas
description:
Really great place on the lake. Approx. $5 per person per night. It's a bar and property- cheap
Cold beers. Buy beers, share food, support the place and you can negotiate the price maybe. Really great guy David owns the place. Really likes travelers. Possible to arrange a boat trip to the cave on the lake. lake is not great for swimming, but really beautiful. depending on the time of the year rivers nearby better. Monkeys nearby:) water, toilet, energy. possible to use the septic input to empty your tank but need to talk with owner. 
There is a supermarket close by. 
Use whatsapp +507-66252861 message a day before is best as sometimes he is away for full days. 

Update Feb/2018: Saw a monkey tied to a tree here. Stay only if you don't mind people keeping wildlife as pets.

name: Lookout point
description:
Grassy field next to the road with space to pitch your tent . Nice view.
River about 200m up the road if you need water

name: Hostal Palacios
description: It's a good place to stay and know Boquete and his people, very central and at hand all!!! $10 por night... The cheapest and good feo the area...

name: Camping along the river
description: Nice spot to camp next to the river. Pretty quite with a few people fishing in the evening . Space to camp and for vehicles . Water from the river. Good 3g Claro reception (didn't work for us, no data)

name: Wild camping
description: You can camp next to the road. No traffic at all. 100m ascent to the trailhead from here.

name: Parque Amistad - before entrance
description: Wild camp spot at entry of Parque La Amistad. Park is open from 8am - 3pm and we arrived later. Next to the river. Free. Within the park, you need to pay for camping

name: Parque Amistad - camping
description: You can camp at the ranger station. Nice place. There are also dorms. Well maintained. Several trails can be done without guide. Really worth it. Entrance 5usd pp and camping 6 usd pp

name: CRUISERHEADS.COM PANAMA / CH4x4
description:
Mechanical workshop and offroad accessories store. Skilled labor, guaranteed jobs at fair prices!!! 

Phone (+507)6690.4410 / 261.5172
IG: @cruiserheads.com_panama
FB: Cruiserheads.com Panama
E-Mail: cruiserheads.com@gmail.com

name: Summit NP
description: The guard allowed us to spend the night. Free. We will tip him as to find a secure place, not simple. The day after we visited the park. Nice spot to camp

name: Soberania Park Headquarter
description: You need to buy the entry tickets for the park here. Beautiful trails with many bird 🐦 life. We asked where to camp and they said we could camp before the headquarter. It is manned at night, not gated. Secure place

name: Boquete taller Alonso
description:
Honest mechanic. General repairs, oil change, brakes, mechanical steering 4x4
--
Mecánico honesto reparaciones en general cambio de aceite frenos dirección mecánica 4x4

name: Taller Ulises Bicycle Mechanic
description:
Good Bicycle mechanic in Santiago.  Has spare parts too. 

6987 7845

name: Ever Logistics, Inc.
description:
Calle 5ta., Ave. 5ta., France Field.
Zona Libre de Colón, República de Panamá.
Cell: (507) 65509961 / (507) 221-9093 
Cell: (507) 62133485
http://crossingpanama.blogspot.com

We used the services of Ever Logistics for handling all the paperwork, including car insurance, to get our cars out of the container (shipped from Colombia) and through customs. Mr. Gabriel Boris Jaramillo Vargas, his son Boris and his staff are extremely friendly, reliable, and efficient. They picked us up at the train station in Colón, prepared all the documents, took us to the Customs Office for signing the necessary papers, drove us to a food court for lunch where we waited while the container was fumigated and transported to a container yard. By 4 p.m., all we had to do is drive our cars out of the container – easy and no sweat. For this "all inclusive" service we paid USD 600 for the two cars including 1 month car insurance. If you are shipping the car in the opposite direction, from Panama to Colombia, Ever Logistics works closely together with Enlace Caribe in Cartagena who offer the same kind of friendly and efficient service. We can highly recommend both companies.

name: Near Fortuna Dam
description: A fairly level parking area in front of the (locked) gate of a hydroelectric control station, not visible from the road, but traffic noise is loud (trucks shifting gear), quiet at night. Nice view of the lake and the dam (ignore the power line). The tower is illuminated at night but unmanned. Two workers arrived in the morning; a bit later their boss turned up, checked on them with binoculars, took a pic of my car and left again. Nobody seemed to mind my staying there. To reach the place, take the gravel ramp in the middle of the bend (which has a lay-by) that leads down to the lake.

name: Tio Tom's Hostel
description:
We left the van on the mainland (good idea) and went to Bocas main island, but were distinctly unimpressed - busy, expensive, hot, not dog friendly. 

However the island of Bastimento was the opposite. Chilled out places over the water, great restaurants at decent prices, and incredible beaches (walk to the free Wizard Beach - why pay $15 each for red frog?).

There's several nice hostels (Jaguar, Bubbas) but we can definitely recommend Tio Tom's, particularly if u can get the private room right at the waters edge ($25 in this low season). Dog friendly too.

name: Seguros FEDPA S.A.
description:
*Possible to get SOAT online*

Here you'll find Seguros FEDPA to buy a car Insurance. It will cost 25 USD per month and you need the following documents: Passport, Drivers License, Vehicle Document and DIAN. Open from Mo.-Fr. 7:45am till 4:30pm and Sa. 8:00am till 12:00md.

name: Fortuna lake visitor center
description: A facility beside the dam with bathrooms and parking. I parked my rig beside a tall bodega to be a little bit hidden from the road. There is a security guard and he said it's fine to park

name: Playa Bonita Westin
description:
Really nice resort with a very large secured open parking lot. 
They are not going to let anyone camp here ( we knew that already, being regular Westin Hotel guests), but if you need a large parking for your extra large rig and are willing to spend $ on a room and an amazing stay at a really great hotel this is your spot. 
We parked our 16 meters long rig in the parking and took a room.

name: Terpel, Va&Ven
description:
All amenities, super quiet and safe. shower. Wifi. laundry
--
con todas las conodidades, super tranquilo y seguro. ducha. wifi. laundry.

name: Parking de Damaris
description:
Park our van in the parkin Lot of the beach in Damaris place. Our Friends put out a tent in the beach and then move it closer to us because of the wind and the rain. Very Nice and helpfull lady owner (Damaris) Showers and clean bathrooms available. And best of all: in the beach. It Is near where the boats come back from fishing so if you are lucky you can get a really good and big fresh fish (we paid 5$ for 2). 
 They also Rent private little houses. 
  Very recomendable. Quiet and peacefull. 
  We didnt ask for electricity for our van because we didnt need it. But you can ask for it maybe with other price. 
  very much better price than the chinise and better privacy.
  internet para todos access. (free wifi) from Scholl Next door

name: Camping Resort and Aquatic Park
description: Driving to Colon from Panama City we saw this place on the left. I do not have any other info but three different signs said "Camping resort & Aquatic park" written in English. Looked like a decent place. I assume by the name it allows camping. Phone number +5072162016 or see the pictures, I found them on fb.

name: Ocean bluff view
description:
Overnight Prohibited camping is illegal here. 

So upfront, we are not sure what this place is, public or private. We were taking here by google maps when we were trying to get to the beach spot marked near here. We spent one night and we're not bothered. With all that out of the way, this spot is AWESOME! It's a grassy knoll on a bluff overlooking this ocean surrounded by trees. The breeze reaches up here and at night it was nice and cool. The spot is flat and access was easy. We just followed the road and didn't cross any gates or see any private land signs.

name: Las Hamacas
description: Nice new cabinas $75 a night decent safe parking for motos but not gated

name: Casa Ramirez
description: Really nice family runs a great hotel. Parking in the front is secure. The owner Oscar would love more overlanders, and has great parking for medium rigs (no bigger than standard truck campers). You have access to the pool, communal areas, large kitchen, and bathrooms.  After we shipped our truck, we got a private room, which was very nice. Breakfast included.

name: Hotel Playa Reina Mariato
description: Oceanside hotel with range of prices and rooms. We had a nice oceanside room, we negotiated 3 nights for $110. The manager Tony said he would let overlanders camp in the parking lot for $20 a vehicle. Beautiful location that is supposed to have good surfing. WiFi is pretty slow.

name: Side of the road
description: We made it past the first bad spot in the road but couldn’t go any further. This is just a wide spot in the road between 2 fields. You can camp anywhere along this road but this spot was special as we saw 2 quetzales in the morning! Look in the trees across the field on the left (as you face uphill). Quiet peaceful night.

name: Republica Pachamama
description: Nice place in the Jungle. We stayed here 2 nights before going to the Carti port. We payed $7 per person for place under the roof where we slept on our mattresses. Nice view for jungle and from here you can walk to the waterfall and swim. For $10 per person you can sleep in one of small houses or upstairs in one of the simple cabin with bed. No Wifi here. Shower is really cold. We didn't eat here but they serve vegetarian food which didn't look good. And they cook everything on cheap aluminum. We had electricity and kitchen for use. On Saturday volunteers whom works here were loud until 3 am so we couldn't sleep.

name: Llantas J&J
description: Garage where we change 4 News tires (llantas) for our mothorome : 90 usd each

name: Playa Morrillo 2
description:
A spot on the sand shaded by palms. Couldn't get to other Playa Morillo spot because of super moon high tide (river flooded the road a bit too high for our air intake). 

Take a right at the intersection just before the main road crosses to river (very close to the beach). The sandy road ends into this palm tree grove. 

Someone did come by to harvest the coconuts about mid day. We asked if it was okay to be there, and he said it wasn't a problem.

name: Cerro Jefe
description:
Fincas privadas pero gente muy amable permite acampar. En época de lluvia ☔ algunas vías pueden ser difíciles de transitar pero hasta este lugar no hay problema la vía es
mantenida pero requiere 4x4. Clima fresco tranquilidad es absoluta. Buen río y pozas para baño en cortas caminatas. Preguntar por Melo... 
---
Private farms but very friendly people allow camping. In rainy season ☔ some roads can be difficult to travel but until this place there is no problem the way is
maintained but requires 4x4. Fresh climate tranquility is absolute. Good river and swimming pools in short walks. Ask about Melo ...

name: Hotel Residencial Lleras
description: Hotel rooms to fully kitted our apartments for $45-120. They allowed two dogs but we had to get the $120 apartment (which they gave us for $80). After a long border crossing and being turned down by multiple hotels for the dogs— we gave in. Our “apartment” was very spacious, full kitchen, and beds for 10 people!! If you need a place to lay low with TV/WiFi or are traveling in a larger group, this place is great. VERY secure parking, some smaller cargo trucks fit in the gated area, so some larger rigs would fit as well, non-walled parking available for very big rigs and there’s a lovely overnight guard. It’s a couple blocks from a great grocery store, and definitely hit up the food truck on property... Le France de Panama run by an awesome French-Panamanian guy with tons of tips for traveling the country!

name: Volkswagen
description: official Volkswagen garage. Repuesto. Nice staff.

name: Coffee Shop (+camping option)
description: small snack place but was the only place open at 6pm in late Dec (except the hotel down the road who offered dinner for $25 a head) quick good food.. paninis hot dogs etc.  asked if we could camp but 20usd so we decided to go wild! they have a couple of cabanas too. has wifi

name: International Seguros
description: You can buy more insurance for your car here.

name: Casa Areka Hostel
description: We stayed here while stand by the arrival of our car in Colón. Good atmosphere, staff very nice, kitchen, pool, shine, good Internet. there is a supermarket at 200m. Includes simple breakfest. We pay US $ 10 / female and US $ 12 / man in dorm mixed with 8 beds. In front is posible parking (no Big rigs)

name: Hospedaje Mi Terruno
description: Hostel, but really more of a cheap motel, in Santiago. We paid $20 for a private room & bathroom (they don’t have dorm rooms). Nothing fancy and not the cleanest but cheap and WiFi (depending where you’re sitting). We did get the cheapest option so maybe the more expensive rooms are a bit nicer. We’re biking and needed somewhere for the night and got directed here. Reception is open 24hrs. See photos for price list and more pictures !

name: Water Refil Station - Hospital
description: $ 0,25 / 2 litros. We stayed in Skully's but the machine was out service.

name: Hotel Casa Miller
description: great place to stay while you're sorting shipping/ seeing Panama city.  close to DIJ and cusco Viejo.  new clean hotel, comfy beds, a/c, tv etc.  secure parking.  (our 4runner with a roof tent couldn't quite squeeze into the garage but parking opposite and the guards have an eye on it 24/7) the hotel owner, Victor, also owns the casino and assured us no-one would mess with the car! after initial nerves I was happy it was safe.  there's no denying the area is dodgy, but we felt fine walking around during the day and for 35 bucks a night on booking.com it far outrated more expensive places our friends stayed. staff are really lovely, especially William..  probably even nicer if we had a proper understanding of the stream of Spanish we were greeted with every time we stepped outside! also did some of our copying for free.  can negotiate rates if staying longer and they do take credit cards.

name: Huza Capital
description: Parking here where you can leave your car if you want to leave the country without your car. you can get a Paper for the customs.

name: lavanderia
description: place for a Lavanderia. 1 per load, 1 for dryer. very simple but clean.

name: Las Porrocas Backpacker (+camping)
description:
Two other hostels in town recommended this place because we wanted camping so once you get to Pedasí you can ask around and I’m sure you’ll be directed here!

Coolest hostel/restaurant run by a sweet guy named Ose (nickname, not sure the spelling). He let us set up our tent in the garden area but there is a dorm with room for 6 or 8 people... not quite sure. Also showers, bathroom, WiFi, fresh water. The owner is young and super friendly and even if you don’t need somewhere to stay you should check it out and have a beer or some fresh seafood! Also not sure how much it is but we gave him $20 for two beers and for camping and he said it was too much (but we gave it to him anyways because he’s the best!)

name: Hostal
description: Roomy, fast wifi, friendly owner and staff, comfortable places to lounge, also a bouldering wall, basic real fast included (toast, jam, peanut butter, fruit, juices, etc.). More expensive than other places. 18$ for a dorm, she gave me $16 as a cyclist. Space for motos and a small rig but seems street parking is available so a larger rig would be fine parked outside in a calm neighborhood without much foot traffic.

name: Picnic Area
description: A picnic area with a few benches and roofs off the side of the road. I didn’t stay here, just cycled by but it seems like a decent option on a late night especially if it’s raining you have the covered area. You’ll have car noise through the night likely.

name: Open Lot Pine Needle Soft Camp
description: This open lot is in a real cool location as far as view, cleanliness, openness can go. You also get a view of Los Altos. It’s covered in pine needles so if you use your tent it’ll be soft padding. If I had kids I’d bring them here to just chill out for a day or two. A local said it was fine to camp here. If your staying longer than a day maybe just run it by the nearest house. Free.

name: Rainforest Park at start of Pipeline Road
description:
Cannot park at this GPS location.  Can park anywhere where there are NO navigational markers.  Just take the next road to the right.  Just before the gate.  Small roadside spot is only place before the discovery center.  There is no park with 2wd spots.  The big signs are navigational markers. 

The Pipeline Road (Camino del Oleoducto) is a 4WD road that leads through the rain forest and by a Discovery Center. Where it starts, there is sort of a park with many 2WD accessible spots to overnight. There are some big signs for the canal around, other than that it's a beautiful area where you can see many birds (e.g. Tucans) and also monkeys. Some bird watch tours come out here in the morning. You can hike around some of the paths if you want. It's all free - only if you want to visit the Discovery center you need to pay. No ammenities though.

name: Oficina ATTT
description: Here you can pay your speed ticket  if you dont warnt to risk troubles at Police inspection before Shopping your vehicle

name: hotel Plaza changuinola
description:
Sweet little hotel

You can just see the front building from the road but there's a larger gated area behind it.  They have grass, playground, nice pool., free laundry room. Rooms are simple and clean  we paid $50 for 4 people but he quoted me $37 for one person 

Highly recommended previously or post birder stop

name: Panama Camping RV park
description:
No solo camping here, only for RVs, Asked to camp and they said NO

Very new and nice looking place with full hookups, wifi, showers, gated, small Cafe.  It's a pretty nice setup but they wanted $25/night for my family of 4.  If you need a secure and full-service RV Park this place would do well.  Turn just after the gas station  

Prices August 18 for two:
Full hookup: $20 
No hookup or breakfast $12

name: Hoegh Autoliners
description:
Hoegh Autoliners - Collection of Bill of Lading. 6th floor open until 5:00

No Longer accepting cash. 
ACH (Wire Transfer)
Cashier's Check
Deposit at Citi downtown
ePago at some retailers

name: Copa airlines (and cargo)
description:
copa cargo was very slow to respond to emails regarding my pet and the entire process was maddeningly expensive and complicated. 

i finally just came to the copa airlines corporate office and the reservations counter person was a bit more helpful in pressing the copa cargo rep for what i needed. 

you could also book flights from here.

name: Beach side kite surf spot
description: Really calm area, people around are really friendly. There is trash a bit everywhere but it is ok if you are here to kite surf! Best spot so far! The kitesurf guesthouse people are nice too! You can buy fish or camarones at the family just beside where you can park your car, they filled up our water for free too. Really windy, its a kitesurf spot! 😉

name: Linton Bay Marina
description:
nice big flat area outside the marina. peaceful night. 
guard said we could park-up overnight but had to leave at 6am before his boss arrived for work next day. we didn't use any facilities there, but two young Polish backpackers who we gave a lift to, pitched their tents and used the bathrooms. Free.

name: Main Square
description: Perfect place to sleep one night in front of the church. Very kind people. We didnt stayed because we wanted to reach the sea.

name: Lavenderia Special Clean
description: Landry service drop off. $1.50 for washing and $1.50 for drying plus tax.

name: Cerro Azul 2
description:
This is the spot where you can actually drive up to. 
You'll have an amazing view of the City at night, and you can cool down a bit at night. There is a fire ring, you'll need to bring wood. Very quiet and very windy. Too windy for our rooftop tent, so we slept in the car, which was fine because it's so nice and cool up here :) Very much recommended if the city is getting on your nerves with the heat, traffic and noise. Good Claro reception.

name: free spot
description:
I stayed one night here, it looks like a flat grass parking lot. It's "over" the main road, quiet during the night. Clean.
When you arrive from El Valle, turn on the left just before the curve / red house and follow the narrow offroad lane (only 20m) to reach this place. Be careful with a car, 5m of bad offroad.

name: Hostal Kala
description: hostel. Very friendly and some English spoken. $20 for double room.

name: Country Inn and Suites Panama City
description: There are two hotels of this chain in town. I ended up here somehow misled instead of at the one on the canal which obviously has a nicer surrounding. Aminities include coin laundry, pool, very fast internet (downloaded all maps for south america) , clean rooms , prices vary so check booking.com and all the others for best rate, should not be more than 75 USD including breakfast, large secured parking also for big rigs. Almost same distance to the DJI customs inspection from both sites

name: Hotel Sarita
description: 18dls the private room bathroom inside, clean and comfy. WiFi, bad tv, and a Fan

name: Hostal Doraz
description: Well located hostel, in front of police station. Clean room with private bathroom and tv for 20$. Good wifi and we can use the kitchen.

name: Marciela’s House
description: Marciela has ample parking for small and large rigs. We parked here for 3 nights while we took a water taxi to get to Bocas del Toro. She is a very sweet local lady who is excited about having more overlanders park there. Two other overlander friends parked there during the same week and everyone had a good experience. The parking is gated and when we arrived back everything was fine. We have a tall truck camper and we’re charged $8/day while a smaller van was charged $5/day. The price might be negotiable. Excellent choice for parking to visits Bocas!

name: Soursop Hostel
description: $5 USD per person. In the beautiful highlands of Chiriqui.  We have friendly staff and the hostel is surrounded by fruit rees, vegetables, and medicinal plants!

name: Soursop Hostel
description: $5 USD per person to camp, $10 pp for dorm room. In the beautiful highlands of Chiriqui.  Friendly staff and surrounded by fruit rees, vegetables, and medicinal plants!

name: Grass at square
description: Grass parking at the square. Free and safe, the bomberos right next to it. Also free wifi

name: Lavanderia New Star
description:
Do it yourself laundry. 1.25 per load. 
Fast and clean. They have a little waiting area and a TV with Spanish movies.

name: Citibank (to pay Seaboard)
description:
Here you can pay Seaboard if shipping Colombia-Panama. Easy process. We paid in cash.
Mon-Fri 8:30-3:30
Sat 8:30-12:30

name: Playa Estrella
description:
This is the playa Estrella which is so beautiful. 
You can observe a lot of starfish really close but it's forbidden to touch them. 
There are some restaurant. It's pretty crowded but big so you can easily find a place alone !

name: Episcopal campamento
description: Really lovely place, actually a camp for church children. We could camp for free and use the facilities (good cold showers and really clean toilets). However, we guess donations are always welcome. Really quiet night. Not sure whether they allow campers always, but you should give it a try! They also have dorm-like beds and a kitchen. Owner Oscar speaks perfectly English.

name: Casa 33
description:
Hostel with pod style beds. I think this is the cheapest option in town (not to mention Casa Nativa - but this place is 1000x better).

We paid 22,50 USD for a double pod style bed (yes they exist!). They have a fully equipped kitchen, common areas, laundry for 5 usd (lavado and secado) and parking for maybe 2 medium cars/vans. The place is calm and family style. Much better then the classic backpackers hostels.
Location is good!

name: Loco Coco Loco Hostel
description:
Nice and chilled place in a very good location. Close to everything really but far from the noise of the main road. No A/C during the day, so it s quite hot inside and in the dorms. Aside from this staff is really helpful and super friendly. Breakfast is great with a good variety of fruits, pancakes with maple sirup and good coffee.
Price is one of the lowest in town ($11 in big dorm room) and there's secured parking for motorcycles.

name: Leiza's Parking
description:
Safe parking lot 50 meters from water taxis to Bocas. The lot is very secure and the owner has 5 Rottweilers that stand guard at night. Leiza checked us in with a smile and was very helpful. $3 per day fee. There were at least 25 other cars in the lot and they suggest emailing ahead for a reservation in busy season.  
cristobaljarquitecto@yahoo.com

name: KINTE
description: KINTE is a Bond, where you can leave your vehicle if you want to leave the country without your vehicle. It is in Panama City, but very, very expensive, if you leave the vehicle for some weeks (or months)! The best solution is a about 20-30 minutes out of the city on the road to Colon, in Chilibre. There is a huge bond/storage place from the company "TRANSBAL". Cost US$ 1.50 per day for a MAN Motorhome! See further details (trasnport to/from Chilibre, etc.) in iOverlander in Chilibre.

name: TRANSBAL
description:
The best option for storage of your vehicle,  if you want to leave the country without your vehicle!! US $ 1.50 per day for a MAN truck, plus 1% insurance with a low value. It is a safe, professional and very economic storage place. They handle luxury cars such as Ferraris, Lambos, etc. as well. 

Afterc the storage you have to go to 2 other places in Panama City in order to leave the country. If you do not have a good transport, contact Lorenzo Gordon. He is a excellent taxi driver and speaks fluently english. lorenzogordon1905@gmail.com/ Tel. +507 6716-1851. He drives you wherever you want, cost per hour is US$ 15.-- within Panama City, Chilibre-Panama about US$20.--. You can do all 3 places in about half a day.

       From the bond at Transbal in Chilibre you get all papers. Then you go to Transbal in Panama City (Edificio Siglo XXI, office at ground level, coordinates 8.9958 -79.534081); they prepare the papers for the aduana/custom.
     Then Aduana Central in Panama City (coordinates 8.973909 -79.547051), there you ask for the counter "control vehicular". They put a stamp in your passport that you are allowed to leave the country without the vehicle.

When you come back, you do the same thing reverse, but first you will have to buy a new insurance (US$ 25.-- for a MAN truck for 30 days; for example at "Seguros Fedpa SA" in Panama City, coordinates 8.978285 -79.528618). The custom/aduana gives you the new TIP only with a valid insurance! After the insurance you go to the custom/"aduana central, control vehicular" (new TIP, no costs; and they put a stamp in your passport that you are not allowed to leave the country without the vehicle). Then go to Transbal in Panama City. There you pay the bond and they give you the paper in order to get your vehicle at the bond at Transbal in Chilibre. These 3 places in Panama City you can do within half a day. Lorenzo drives you there and waits for you. Transbal in Chilibre closes at 17.00 o'clock. Driving time about 30 minutes, depending of the traffic

name: Parking colégio international
description: parking just in front of the international highschool. light in the street and a guard call the police to signal our presence. very safe and quiet. just before the shipping. better than the parking next to the police station very dirty.

name: Hostel Mamallena
description: is a great hostel in Bocas del Toro . with WiFi , A/C , and can parking 2 bikes .is 18 usd with Breakfast .

name: Hostal Amador Familiar
description:
The hostel is near the DIJ, so perfect for the shipping actitities.
The parkinglot can hold 2-3 vans; our 21 ft rig fits but I woudn‘t go for a bigger one. 15 $ per Camper with shower, bathroom and wifi, $10 extra for shoreline.

The price was 15 dollars and 10 dollars for electricity. We were parked with cars. The beautiful garden with kitchen and also the access to the toilet and shower was locked at 5 p.m. with a chain and lock. In the morning we had to ask to open it. The woman at the reception is very unfriendly and reacts quite aggressively. So from 5 p.m. you have to ring the bell and so you go through the reception to the toilet, etc. So not at all camper friendly. And also quite loud because it is right on the street for those who are sensitive to noise.

name: Pensión Costa Rica
description: Basic, clean and convenient. $20 for a room with a double bed and fan.  Our bicycles fitted in the room, and there’s a secured area out front which could take motorbikes.  24 hour supermarket opposite, restaurants all around.  A block and a half from the central plaza.

name: Hostal La Aduana, señora Oladis
description:
Simple hostel where you can cook. Shared bathroom, rooms for two people at U $ D 20 with fan and U $ D 30 with air conditioning. It is located in front of the plaza del Town. The owner lives above the hostel, to find her you have to climb all the stairs, The hostel has no sign or bell, it is above the pharmacy. 

The owner is quiet, you can have the kitchen and have a good time. There are not many rules to fulfill. The toilet is not exhaustive but everything is kept tidy. It has no parking but you could leave the car outside because it seems a quiet area and from the balcony you can see it.

name: Spacious pull off right on the beach
description: We have been all over the island and it is slim-picking. This is a nice quiet area along a dirt road heading away from Bocas del Drago. It is tree covered so solar is absolutely minimal shade is great and a breeze today.  The road only goes a bit further before forking to two private gated roads. The beach is only 10 meters and no one within sight. An expat couple who live up the road drove by and suggested it was a great spot to camp. Bonus we heard and saw a troop of 12-15 howler monkeys hanging out just a bit further high on the trees above the hill towards the private properties and they were photogenic! 1-2 bars of Claro a bit spotty. Soft sand entrance for 50 meters no problem for our T3 Vanagon with tires slightly aired down.

name: Dentist - Clinica Arango Orillac
description: Dentists recommended to me by expats who have lived here over 20 yrs. The dentists speak English well, but the receptionist doesn't, so you need to first make the appointment in Spanish. Good treatment (& I needed a lot of stuff doing!!).  Prices were reasonable & standards are high. Parking is easy around here & shops nearby.

name: Grassy area
description: We slept under the shade of a tree in this little park. Everyone in town was very kínd and welcoming.  No cell or Movil  internet service.

name: Centro Medico Paitilla
description: A huge modern clinic/hospital with specialists of all kinds. Good for treatments or routine check-ups (mamograms etc.). If you can't find what you need here, there's another medical centre next door in the Royal Center (it's all behind the Hard Rock Hotel).

name: Riba Smith and Novey
description:
Good out of town Riba Smith shopping - great for treats and good quality produce, cheeses, breads etc. Easy parking & far easier to get to than the Riba Smiths in town. Also a big Novey hardware/homeware store.
Tap in the car-park is good for filling water tank.

name: waterfalls hike
description: Not far (approx 2km from the road to fall  No.3) but it's steep and muddy in places, even in the dry season. Nice waterfalls but nothing unique here. No wildlife that we saw. $7 is probably too much. Can swim in falls 2 & 3, but of course VERY cold water! For photos, the sun shines on the falls and causes nice rainbows in the afternoon.

name: Villa Coco
description: Nice chilling place! Gorgeous people. Near Santa Catalina Beach. Great pool.

name: Parque National Omar Torrijos
description:
This is the Ranger Station to the Park. The entrance is 5Usd/Person but when we took out our wallet, the Ranger said it is for free at the moment. No idea why or for how long...
From here there is a very rough 4x4 track to the summit El Calvario. From there you can see both oceans when the sky is clear. Really nice short hike (around 35min one way uphill).

Some advice to get here: Shortly after the Las Yayas waterfalls (on iOverlander) the gravel road starts. From here it is about 3km to the station. The road is a very rough and steep 4x4 track with several washouts. The rangers told us, that when it is raining, even they can't drive there anymore. For us the problem were very low hanging big branches. Thats why we needed to turn around and hike up. The road is basically only doable in standard SUVs...
If you make it up there, there is a relatively even parking lot about 400m behind the rangers station. We did not ask, but I am pretty sure you can overnight there, since there are also cabins you can rent... 
Really nice spot and great view!
Since we were not able to drive up, we parked at the waterfall and walked up. Takes about 4h return with some time at the summit...

name: Artesan Market
description:
This is the artesan market from the Lonely Planet. It is a little difficult to find, since it is not on Googlemaps...
They are selling different handmade crafts from local and indigene artists. We found the prices to be cheap and you support the local artists. It seems to be kind of a government project...

name: Va&Ven / Terpel Gas Station
description: Very good place to sleep overnight, secure, fairly good food at Va&Ven, 24h service, showers, clean toilets and it’s for free. Much better than a lot of paid campsites to sleep overnight.

name: Border Check Point with Military
description: Checked our TIP and Passports. Quick and easy

name: Veronica Franco
description:
Very quiet campsite with amazing view over the sea. There are all types of facilities one should need.
Shower, water, wifi, restaurant,... Eddie and Veronica are very friendly. ( they also offer horseriding, diving, kayaking,...)
Price are 10$ each for person in camping and there are cabañas (cabins) too
Eddie can help cycling guys to climb the hill with his car.
7kms from Portobelo

name: Part 2 - DIJ Vehicle Inspection to Ship Vehicle
description:
This is the location for picking up your papers after you complete the inspection. Bypass the line outside and go through the double doors.

Process probably takes one to three hours, mostly waiting. So bring a book!

name: postnet, photocopie , copy
description: great place for photocopie , copy , create sticker or other service postal (DHL, fedex, UPS)

name: Street parking near DIJ
description: Very quiet, feels safe given near the DIJ, quiet area. Guard at the entrance said it's safe, and proposed us to move closer to the entrance if a space becomes available later, so that he can keep an eye on us.

name: Tropigas
description:
Local tropigas delivery can be found here.  They collect bottles and ferry across to the filling station north of the Bocas ferry port.  Turn around is usually 2-3 days depending on what day you drop it.  Cost was a $10 more than when we filled at a tropigas location on the mainland ($25 v. $15) but it sure beat the ferry price and drive to the middle of nowhere to do it ourselves.  

Recommend calling first to ensure the workers are there.  The boss is at 6584-2287 and if he doesn't answer a worker of his can be reached at 6389-0762.

name: J & H Garden Cabins
description:
Beautiful and quiet cabins in Carenero Island. Only 3 private cabins with private porch and with common big garden; palm trees, bananos, orchids...and the best; the sound of the birds.
Cabins are brand new; fast wifi, hot shower, big bed and kitchenette.  Owner; Robert & Eli speak perfect Spanish and English.                              In this tiny island there are 3 beaches within 15 min walk.      
Clear caribbean water and almost no tourist.                                                   From Carenero to Colon is 1$ /person taxiboat. 3$/person to Bastimento. For us it was a great option to explore the surrondings and have a quiet and private acomodation.                                                                               2 restaurants by the sea, big enough supermarket and surffing school in the island.
Low season 65$ High season up to 95$. But you can talk to them to arrange the price.  Phone: +507  66160200 

3$ per night secure parking at Almirento

name: Casa Mona Lisa
description: Nice Hostel at the dead end of Calle 55 Este in Panama City. Dormprices between 12-15$ depending on the amount of beds...like usual. privat mini room for 22$. Breakfast included. Street parking possible. No camping, not for rigs. Do not drive down this street with a big rig!! Kitchen and chilling area are nice. A/C in room.

name: Loving Hut vegan restaurant
description: Nice place for vegans (mock meat). Place looks clean and reasonable price.

name: Bomberos
description: Quiet place with playground for kids and free wifi.

name: la fábrica
description: we refill our weather tank.  really good bar, very good beer. if you drink 2 1/2 liters of beer in one drink, you eat free.I do it.

name: Santos boat repair
description:
We had a great experience with Santos who help us to fix our back bumper and repair the exterior of our motorhome.
He was very helpful. He probably can help with shower. 
He usually repairs boats.
Not for mechanic

Contact WhatsApp : +50766919423

We stay at night near the site and it's very quiet and safe with family around.

name: Playa Chiquita
description: Hang a right after the baseball field and follow the road to the beach.  Beautiful beach but sadly covered in plastic debris... not from locals (there is maybe a single person who lives full time on the north end of the beach).  Still a mellow place to camp for a night and the reef has the potential for a good surf break in the right conditions.

name: Ludwig car mechanic and general
description: Ludwig is an English and Spanish speaking mechanic, a little bit German. He repairs many brands, Toyota, Mitsubishi and so on. He is very helpful and friendly. We recommend this mechanic.

name: Nancito Archaeological Museum
