description: Small opening on the side of a dirt road. Leveled for a car or two. We came up here after checking the wild camping spot further down. You are on the “ridge” of the hills and the view is very nice in both directions. Super quite at night with no one passing by. The road up is unpaved and a bit steep, no need for 4wd right now.

name: Casa swell
description: Awesome place! Recently built. Nice pool, chill area, shared kitchen, safe parking. Not for big rigs. Owned by Jay and Eva, a friendly couple from Canada and Argentina. Speak french, english and spanish. Surf spot near by, surfboards available. Contact them before showing up, must be announced at gated entrance to be allowed through. Whatsapp +507 6204-7877

name: Aduana (New Location)
description:
insurance place same brand as border is walkable distance and has copy place next door. 
This is the new and only aduana campus to get your TIP documents.

name: parking of El Chorro
description: there is a small gravel parking lot or a slightly larger dirt/grass parking lot for overnight camping.  no electricity/water but quiet enough for the city.  a few dogs and hens/roosters.

name: public parking 2
description:
like the other parking, with toilets. more quiet. 
No WiFi.

Comme l'autre stationnement mais plus calme. avec des toilettes et eau potable. sans WiFi.

name: Isla Perro Chico
description: Dry camping on the island with our own tent for 10$pp, couldn’t negotiate better. Saltish shower, toilet and coffee included.

name: Like a migrant
description: We camped under the pagoda of the park right in town for 2 nights. Safe and quite. Spot was suggested by military, which patrol over night as well. Locals are in general friendly, but we felt they tend to think you are a migrant. Panaderia on the corner has amazing bread, nice people working and wifi. Good food in town for 4-6$ a plate.

name: La Concha Rosada
description: Private accommodation with parking spot for 1 camper. Nice American family with 2 equally nice dogs and a bird. Electricity available with toilet and shower.

name: Veggie restaurant
description: AMAZING small place, run by a charming woman that makes everything herself!! It’s like she’s inviting you to eat in her backyard but the food is sooooooo good and affordable compared to everywhere else on the island!! Everything’s vegetarian and she also has a small gift shop!!

name: Very dangerous hike!
description:
Here you can hike up to the picachos near Ola. Beautiful. But also a very dangerous hike. Very steep track (around 70°). Very narrow track with steep drops on both sides. Zero safety features. Very slippery, some loose stones. Basically you are rock climbing some of the parts. Had to do a lot of the route on hand and foot or when going down shuffling on our butts. There are no warnings at the start of the trail. If you do decide to do this hike/climb, please consider the following:
-wear really good hiking shoes with profile.
-do not bring young children or pets (unless your pet is a mountain goat)
- the sharp grass which grows on both side off the track gets up to 1.30m high and can irritate your skin, so cover arms and legs.
- you need about twice the strength going down then you need going up
- do not do this when wet!
We had to pay $2,- pp, not sure if this was the entrance fee or for parking our car. Cash only.
When we made it back down we told the owner the hike is dangerous, she just said yes! smiling.... We stayed in the area several days and locals also told us the hike is dangerous and should have safety features....

name: peaceful wildcamp
description: found this place next to a dirt road (4*4 required) on our way to Ola. (not the main road). Grassy field with some shade. very quiet and peaceful. Maybe 3 people a day came by, all waved friendly. No cellphone reception with +móvil, but when we walked up the little hill, just enough reception for whatsapp etc. Just across the road is the entrance to Vision Verde, where you are welcome to visit if the gate is open. No trash. Big rigs friendly if you can manage the dirt road. Safe, camped here for 3 nights. Ola is only 5km away with a few shops.

name: Residential Coya
description:
Located in David , Panama. it's a lovely, large residential home/ hotel. There are several guest bedrooms with one bed or two. It has air conditioning, Indoor, secure parking on a quiet street with security cameras. It's super clean, with beautifully finished wood and tiles. A breakfast and good coffee is provided. The owners were friendly, kind and helpful.  pura.29@hotmail.com; WhatsApp+64040647; Telephone 507.774.7105;
facebook Hospedaje Coya or booking.com Residential Coya

name: The Londoner
description: English pub and restaurant with a huge selection of British grub, ales, lagers and ciders. We had two different curries. Excellent when you’re missing an ‚indian‘. Piers, the owner, is very hospitable and although we didn’t sleep here with our camper, said he would welcome overlanders to park in his spacious parking lot for the night, where they could have access to water and use the bathrooms. It wasn’t the cheapest restaurant with a pint of cider costing $7 and a chicken tika Masala costing $20, but a treat in the middle of the capital, especially if you’re wanting a little taste of home.

name: Casa Blanca
description: Really good restaurant owned by two young panamenians. They are really nice and the food is great. They turn into bar at night.

name: Natural camping la Yeguada
description:
Found this place on google since the others on IOv turned out not that nice at the period we were there (october). Don’t judge the place by the look of it from main street, the entrance is 200 m from the actual campgroud.

We have a high roof sprinter and it was sketcht to make it to the camp place (tight gates and low branches). A big rig would not be able to pass.

Very beautiful place, well kept, beautiful view of mountain, with clean showers and bathroom. 
They have a cover area with piknik table and high platform. 

There is a river down below where it is possible to go. Our kids enjoyed the place as we did.

No electricity, little Tigo coverage ( 1-2 bars of 4G) .

Nice owners.

5$ pp

name: Camel Service car
description: All size of tire and good  service for your car. Oil filter, all kind of oil and lubricants

name: Casa de las Baterías SOLAR
description: This is the place to visit if you need parts or help for off grid solar systems, electrical camper systems. Victron parts can be found here. Ask for Orlando. He gave me permission to share the contact info.

name: Beachside, guard, free
description: Good spot on the side of the road right beside the beach. You’re across the street from a 24 guard for an apartment building. If you befriend the guard with a chat/tip/meal, he may let you use the outdoor shower just inside the gate and the lobby washrooms. Some nice shady palms on the beach, we had some nice beach BBQs. Quiet even on weekends, only a few people around. The water here has lots of rocks and is full of debris from the river in rainy season, you can sit in the pools at low tide. Don’t swim at high tide. If you walk all the way to the left side of the river (10ish minutes), the water is clean!

name: Gas Station 24 hrs
description:
To 1.8 km from McDonald's We came here because They didn't let us overnight there so We drove here, station gas 24 hrs. We ask if we could be sleep and he said it's ok and safe. 
A lot of noisy for the way but it's safe. 
——
Estábamos en el mcdonald's y a las 11 p.m. vino el guardia a decirnos que no podíamos pasar la noche ahí, conducimos 1.8 km y venimos a preguntar a la estación de gas si podíamos pasar la noche aquí, el encargado nos dijo que si y que es seguro, trabajan las 24 hrs. 
No nos quedaban muchas opciones así que nos quedamos aquí. 
Hay mucho ruido de la carretera.

name: Front Hostel casa los monstruos
description: Our friend stay in the hostel and we parking outside. We overnight in our van without problem. The street is crowded during the day and night, after 11:pm is quiet and we felt safe. There are hotels and hostels around is the zone, near here there are restaurants and small grocery.

name: Centro Industrial
description:
This place is incredible! It is an industrial supply store and has everything from hand tools, power tools, welding equipment, nuts & bolts, electrical supplies, plumbing supplies and much much more. I’ve been in many stores in Canada and the US and this is by far the best one yet! The prices are very comparable to US pricing and the selection on name brand supplies is incredible. If your looking for something in the way of supplies they will probably have it. Heck I even saw a 3” open end box end wrench. 
Parking may be tricky for larger units, but if you park at Overland Embassy it’s a 5 minute walk. 
Happy shopping…

name: Indian groceries King’s Food
description: Indian Food!!!! All the sauces and pastes and any other hard to find ingredients to make Indian food! We bought a bunch of dry sauce packs for future travels! Parking in front with no height limit.

name: Airbnb Habitacion en Potrerillos Arriba
description: We found this place on Airbnb, its a beautiful place in a calm and idyllic location with a big garden and fully equipped shared kitchen, washingmachine and dryer!They have big clean cheap rooms with hot shower and the owners are amazing and helpful with everything!They have enough place to park, even under roof and are happy to receive Overlanders!Perfect place, can really recomand it to everyone!

name: Los Picachos de Ola
description:
view point, scenic views, steep and sleepy short trail (30min up)
2$/p entrance via private property

name: Vehicle Insurance for Panama - CASH ONLY!
description:
Go behind the immigration building to the Exit side and find the small office behind the taxi rank and pastelaria (see image)
Motorcycle: $25USD for 1 month (minimum)

Good aircon

name: Enter/Exit Panama - Paso Canoas
description:
Enter Panama: 
1. Drive over to Panama side (big official building in middle of road)
2. Park up under the covered area in the left lane.  
3. Go to other side of building to purchase insurance (see insurance pin) Car/Motorcycle $25USD x 1 month [minimum] cash only!
4. Go back to the customs building and get stamped in and fingerprints taken (first office on the left as you pulled in)
5. Go to Aduana office (directly opposite in the same building) provide: passport, licence and registration copies. Receive TIP paper
6. Get inspector to check over vehicle(either wandering around or in the middle office of the building). Fill out customs form 
7. Pay either $6 or $5 at Fumigation window to left of sprayer, receive proof of quarantine paper. Drive through sprayer and into Panama
Welcome to Panama

*pop back to pastelería by the insurance office for a cheap treat.

name: Casa Mahana
description:
A hotel with a restaurant. You can sleep in your motorhome on the parking. Very quiet night.
Paid 10$/night.

name: Buffalo wings factory
description: This is a gem, recommended by Overland Embassy, has GREAT FOOD and Overlander friendly. Owner is a motorcycle guy with a lot of connections in the region. As for Beto and all doors will be open. This place is safe for overnight camping and next to a firefighter station

name: Lavandería y Tintorería Suavecito's Clean
description: only spot in town open on Sunday. they didn't weigh the bag - 4,90 for a huge load washed and folded.

name: Hotel Plaza Paitilla Inn
description: Excellent hotel in medium price range with outdoor parking for any kind of rig. Secure neighbourhood, great views of bay.

name: Puerto de Paris
description: Beautiful and quiet place right on the banks of river Santa Maria. Only a few fishermen around, level and shady. Swimmung not recommended - crocodiles (said a fisherman)

name: El Puerto de La Enea
description: Small access to the beach, turn right before the restaurant  Room for a few cars and campers, big rigs might have problems. Very quiet, nice village people.

name: Playa El Rincon
description: Beautiful place a bit north of Pedasí. Take the exit Mariabe and follow the sign "Playa El Rincon" Might be crowded on weekends, almost no one when we were here on a Tuesday. Off and on cell reception +Movil

name: Clean & Coffee. Panama City
description: Laundromat washers and dryers. while you wait you can sit in the lounge, enjoy a coffee and use the Wifi (fast). They have three washers and 3 dryers. clean and in good shape. You can park in front of the store they have 6 parking spaces. Washing cost 2$ for one machine and 2$ for dryer. Speak English and they have washing detergent. This place was a heaven-sent!  Cold wash only.

name: Kokuyé gate locked
description: Here is a gate that is locked and a sign with privat property of Kokujé under construction. You can't get to the beach spot anymore.

name: Riverside across Posada Media Luna
description: Right across the entrance to Posada Media Luna, beautiful spot on the river.

name: Kokuye Este
description:
This is a dream come true. When you get to the Kokuye gate lock, that gate blocks the road only to the construction site Kokuye. Right next to the gate goes smaller road to the right, you take that. 

Then I recommend to have aerial printed. mapy.cz, maps.me, google.maps are all blind and wont help you. If you do not have aerial, on first forking take right, on the second take left (the smaller one, we first took the right one and then a real hell begun).

The road is super tough. We drive customized LC 70 series 2020 year, lifted, heavy tyres, all lockers on, and in some parts we were scared as hell. Even in dry season there are parts with slippery parts and once the car wont make it you will start sliding backwards. Everywhere is the red jungle mud. Heavy rain came during the ride for only like 10minutes and we had to stay overnight and continue next day, the car would not make the hill. When you get almost to the beach, there is a gate "access restricted", but it was open and it is said you can ask for keys and they let you. We do not know. There is no connection so you better bring a satellite phone.

You will get to the absolute end of these road section on Panama coast, white beach, beatiful sea, palm all around, shade, perfect spot. Nothing around, bring enough so you can even wait if weather gets bad and the road is not passable.

name: Great beach spot next to village
description: perfect spot, no need for description, flat beach, windy, little store close by.

name: Gamboa next to field
description: Absolutely ok spot to stay for 1 night, right next to the bus loop, quite, dark, bonus is the water facet and showers and also table.

name: Top car wash
description: absolute master class, friendly guy, lets you operate the pressure water, completely washed our big rig for 15 dollars. Guy loves overlanding and travelling. Highly recomended. Top!

name: Beachfront at the end of the road
description: A drive through the town of Pixvae leads you to the end of the road where you'll find this free campsite. Completely wild camping. No bathrooms, water, electricity or wifi. Great place to unwind and unplug and enjoy the sound of the ocean. You park on the beachfront. There are not a lot of provisions in the town and very few restaurants. The locals are very kind and welcoming. There's a dive shop nearby and this area is supposed to be the best diving in all of Panama. Within a 25 minute boat ride you'll enter the Coiba National Park that is home to large whale sharks and tons of big marine life. The town is one road, practically on the beach. There are hostels around and the road to the town is currently being paved. Eventually it will be a smooth drive, albeit really steep and windy. 4WD is necessary if you want to leave the town to help you get up the steep terrain, it may not be as much of an issue once the road is paved bit eight now, low gear is a must.

name: Cascada kiki
description: Beautiful property that has the only access to the waterfall here, which claims to be the largest waterfall in Panama. Charges $8 per person per night and you have use of a toilet. He has plans to develop better access to the waterfall, right now it's a somewhat difficult to access. The way up is a bit harder as you have to do a little bit of bouldering. Heraculeo and his family are very kind and like to talk. They do not speak english and the town is completely indigenous. There is no running water so if you come, make sure you bring enough provisions. There are tables under a palapa and it gets busy with locals on the weekend. There are little mini super's on the way, but make sure you're stocked up. It's a long drive up probably the worst maintained road in all of Panama. The property is gated and locked at night. It's cool and windy, which is nice when you're tired of being hot. In the morning his grandkids are out and greet you from afar when they see you out and about. Heraculeo says that right now the only people who know about this place are the locals, he's only seen maybe a handful of foreigners. We were the only ones there and the only ones at the waterfall.

name: Delta
description: They have a water tap, diesel, petrol and pressure air.

name: Madden Connection to Colón Highway
description:
If you want to drive to Colón you can enter the „Autopista Panamá Colón“ here. There are no barriers at this entry point, every car can enter the highway. About halfway on the way to Colón there is a toll station where you can pay the road toll, $2.30 cash only. 
If coming from Colòn you should leave the Autopista here as all further barriers are unmanned and require the the Panapass.

name: Terpel Gas Station
description:
24hrs open gas station! 

We were heading to the other Terpel few meters ahead that is on Ioverlander but since the reviews wasn’t that good and also not recent, we saw this one, that might be new and stoped here!

 There was only us to overnight here but the guy who was working said we could spent the night with no problems! 

They have clean bathrooms and a big groceries store just beside!

It’s was quiet and we felt safe, nothing special but a place to rest for one night!

name: Potable water
description: Potable water at the Delta gas station. Good service. Clean toilet

name: CliniVet
description:
After spend at least an hour going to different veterinarians here in David and not finding anyone who would be able to do the papers to cross to Costa Rica!
We finally found this amazing veterinarian, Dr. Fatima, she can speak English, Spanish and a perfect Portuguese! 
It was $20 for the healthy certificate! 
Very good attention, and a clinic with good structure!

name: Noe and Amas
description:
fully equipped apartment for couples, singles or groups.
free unlimited wi-FI .
includes fully equipped kitchen.
free indoor parking.
completely private.
pet friendly.

name: River Spot - Under the Bridge
description: Big large area for parking in front of the river. We overnight here before crossing to Costa Rica. Was Sunday and during the day the locals came to fresh up themselves on the river, but all night we were alone. Safe, silent, fresh and with nice view. To access the spot you have to cross the bridge and 200 meters later turn the left and then go back under the bridge.

name: Xtra Market
description:
Good market before/after crossing a border with Costa Rica. 
If you are coming this way to visit Panamá you must know that after this place, you just will find a big market in David city and also a lot of chinese markets in a road, but it is more expensive.

name: Next to palms and little cliff
description: nice place for one or two rigs .... right next to the road. A little cliff with great views (sunrises) good phone 4g. To go for a swim you need to walk maybe 50m .

name: near the river
description: Easy access, near the river for swimming shadow, stay 2 days, cool

name: Santa Fe
description: Good free Wi-Fi on main plaza etc...

name: wifi per todos
description: All is in the title: free Wi-Fi for everybody

name: near river
description: Grassy, shadow, large aéra to swim and sleep, close to the village

name: MCDO wifi
description:
Wifi by MCDO.......

Easy access and good wifi

name: Twins Spot
description: We spent 2 nights at the edge of this road. Perfect quiet place at 5 minutes from the center

name: Texaco El Espino-18
description:
Shower
toilet bathrooms 
water 
Fuel
supermarket
10pm close

name: Tire and Mechanic shop Dhillon
description:
Full shop including body/paint if needed. We stopped here to get a tire leak fixed. If you have ATV's Dirtbikes or any off-road vehicles, this is where you get them fixed in Boquete. It's not technically a 4x4 shop, but if they can get the parts you need, they can fix your vehicle. 

It looks like a parking lot with 3 or 4 different shops, who do different vehicle maintenance from big rigs to passenger vehicles and off-road toys. Just tell them what the issue is and someone will tell you which shop to go to.

name: Delta Station
description: Super night in the calm at the back of the gas station. Very nice staff who allowed us to refill our water tank.

name: A cop show me this incredible place
description: All is in the title. Thanks to this very friendly and helpful guy, nice place close to the water. Some locals fishing, shadow, a New  one here.

name: Country Hills las lachas
description: we asked friendly at the reception if its possible to spend 1 night at the parkingarea with our campervan, they charged us nothing for the parking, just 7usd pp for the great pool, that was ok for us. at the pool they have toilets and a warm shower, we had dinner in the Restaurant - ceviche is very good, rib eye steak for 10 usd is ok, we can recommend this place totally and we definetly would come back.

name: La Rana Dorada Cerveceria
description: Craft beer in the heart of Panama city in one of the oldest buildings. Good vibe, many kinds of beer for everyone to find their favorite. They also have a range of other drinks and food.

name: Twins spot
description: Large parking lot facing the sea. The city is not very accessible to land with a 23 feet vr. Quiet night. Free

name: internet wifi
description: Internet para to-dos strong for free on the main place

name: Fonda El Cholo
description: we wanted to go to the end of the road, so here we are. :) here is not really much to see so we decided to have breakfast in this Restaurant. service was good and breakfast was great for 3,50usd per person.

name: water tap in the park, potable
description: free water tap at the park where is the write el valle, far from road, potable, confirmed with locals

name: Restaurant La Tica
description: Just after you pass the police check point is this small restaurant. Fantastic home cooked food and very generous portions. We ate the chicken it was so tasty and tender. Filled up two very hungry cyclists

name: Hotel las Palmas
description: Just into Panama, next to gas station. Set back from the road, so pretty quiet. Large room. Clean. Tepid shower. Great wifi. Paid $28 for the night. Really big grounds so may let rigs park up. Worth asking. We put our cycles in the room, no issues.

name: Levi Metal
description: Custom auto shop repair, specializing in 4wd vehicles. They did some aluminum welding for me on my van ladder. Tony did a great job.

name: wifi paratodos free
description: As title says gratis wifi............... Enjoy

name: Wild camp cerro iguana
description: Little pull out on the right when going up the hill to Cerro Iguana. You do need 4x4 if you want to come up here. Super rocky steep road. From here you climb up the Cerro Iguana for sunset or sunrise. It’s a steep 20min walk. Some pedestrian passing at night/ early morning but very quiet.

name: Whale tail beach
description: Nice beach pullout, big enough for two vans. The beach is a mix of sand and pebbles. No cell reception and no amenities but it’s not far from town. A few surfers came by but the break was too close to the beach. Not the best spot for swimming.

name: El Salado
description:
Parking next to a playground and a big sign that says “El Salado”. 
We parked for a night with our 24ft RV. No issues, we didn’t see anyone we could ask if we could stay but no one bothered us.

name: Bocas House Parking
description:
Small commercial parking next to the watertaxis to Isla Colon. Closed after 7:00 PM and surprisingly quiet at night. 
Perfect to visit the islands.
We paid in total 10 $, for parking one day, night fee and WiFi (2 persons).

name: Waterplant Los Ladrillos
description: We spoke to a employee there and the water from the tap at the parking outside is potable! And it is okay to use it!

name: Good Spot
description:
On one side of Fort Santiago - Portobelo
 Down to the shore of the sea, with some trees and good shade.  all kinds of car
 It was only one night, without problems, 70 meters from the highway

A un lado del fuerte Santiago - Portobelo 
Con bajada a la orilla Del Mar , con algunos árboles y buena sombra . Todo tipo de carro 
Fue solo una noche , sin problemas , a 70 mts de la carretera.

name: Restaurante Los Rizos
description:
Alba owns the Los Rizos Restaurant that she works EVERY DAY, breakfast-lunch and dinner.
 Place has a great and cool shade inside the premises, ideal parking space for a couple of nights.
 It offers a shower, dishwasher and WC $0.50.
 Also if you eat on the spot they can give you the WIFI password.

Alba es dueña del Restaurante Los Rizos que atiende TODOS LOS DÍAS , desayuno - almuerzo y cena .
Lugar cuenta una gran y fresca sombra dentro del local, espacio para parqueo ideal para una par de noches. 
Ofrece ducha , lavaplatos y WC $0,50.
También si comes en el lugar puede entregarte la contraseña del WIFI.

name: Lagunas de Volcán
description:
Beautiful and quiet spot close to the small lake at the lagoon. Grassy spot and plenty of space. Only a few locals during day, nobody at night. Felt safe.

During dry season 2WD and high clearance is OK. When it comes to rain, way might be muddy and slippery. 

You can cross the small airport 2 km ahead of the location even if a sign indicates, that this is private property.

name: football field
description:
Perfect spot to put a tent (we are by bike), just ask Marco the neighbors (house in the corner), he will tell you that it's totally fine, and he is very nice person. One girl came in the evening for training, but even if there is a football match, there is plenty of space to set up your tent. There is running water (I think potable, better re-ask before drinking it) and electricity.
Be careful we set up the tent under the big trees, and we saw 20 tarantulas getting out of their hole on the ground. (there are not venomous). We moved the tent 20 metres away from the football and all good. :)
Slept like baby, very safe.

For overlander: I even think that you can ask Marco if you can park in the football field, he would be ok if you ask him with a big smile. Just say you need the running water too :)

name: Good Car wash
description:
Great car wash with enough space for a 3m high van. for shipping
We paid $10 to have the inside and outside of the van clean which we though was pretty decent.
Open on sundays, great before going to DJI or colon

name: Causeway parking
description: Similar to the other parking spots on the causeway, only a toilet, no other amenities. Weekends can be noisy but the weekdays are good. No issues with police yet. Great views on both sides. You can watch the ships come and good. Lots of restaurants nearby, and a couple museums.

name: Bajo grande casa de la senhora Eredia
description: You can rent a cabana para 2 personas. Basic and simple. Kitchen/ table with 2 chairs/ bathrooms with toilets and shower. No heating. And a double bed. You can advice 1-2 days before with WhatsApp senora Eredia +(507) 83630833. Spanish spoken and very little English. nice place to see quetzal, colibris and birds Her brother is also very kind and welcom. Possible to put tent and to park your RV here or your car. Asking 60 dollars per night….

name: Need 4x4
description: Need 4x4 to go to sendero Los quetzales!! We went until this place with our RV 26Ft /7,5 m. 3,15 high. No possible to go further without 4x4 and car very high can be a problem with the trees

name: Playground
description:
Large parking lot next to a children's park. Quiet night. Access ok for any vehicle. Big rings ok. Average telephone network. Water available at the playground but I don't know if it's drinkable (purification station next door)

Grand stationnement à côté d’un parc pour enfants. Nuit calme. Accès ok pour tout véhicule. Big rings ok. Réseau téléphonique moyen. Eau disponible au playground mais je ne sais pas si elle est potable (station d’épuration à côté)

name: Casa de jose
description: Very friendly people. The owner José is from Panama City. He built this house since pandémie. Very nice place near by somes trails

name: Punta Bejuco
description: Beautiful private beach with cabanas and restaurant. Paid $10 for two people to camp overnight. Showers (buckets) cost $1 and bathrooms $.50. Lots of monkeys, small gentle waves, you can walk to an island at low tide. Owners Victor and Elsa don’t speak English but their son Carlos does, very kind and accommodating family. No electricity or wifi and weak Móvil signal. We made it without 4x4 but last 5 km very rough and could be challenging in rainy season. Lobster was $10 and good. Restaurant is closed during rainy season.

name: José Camping Kiki Waterfall
description: It's a campplace in front of the house of José. He got portable water for you. we paid 5 USD for one night. very friendly people. felt comortable and Versandkosten safe. Also space for bigger Camper. He is also the guide for the tour to the Kiki Waterfall. The last 10km are gravel road and sometimes it goes up steep. No high clearence required but we recomend 4x4 AWD.

name: Pozas thermales
description:
Thermal pools. We do not recommend them. The is not hot, is not clean and the price is expensive for what it is ($8 per adult and $5 per child). The mud bath indicated on the guides is actually a tiny tiny mask. In short, to flee!

Piscines thermales. Nous ne les recommandons pas. Les n’est pas chaude, n’est pas propre et le prix cher pour ce que c’est (8$ par adulte et 5$ par enfant). Le bain de boue indiqué sur les guides est en fait un tout petit masque minuscule. Bref a fuir!

name: Tesoro Escondido Eco Lodge and Cabins
description:
This is a beautiful space away from the hustle and dust of Bocas town. It’s mostly upscale Cabanas ($70+/night) but they do have a few budget rooms of $40/night which for this island are quite reasonably priced. The setting is absolutely beautiful, it’s a multi-story treehouse lodge on a cliff overlooking the ocean. Very close to the start of Playa Bluff, and with its own little cove where I was able to swim in little tide pools despite the waves being a bit high. 

The restaurant served breakfast & dinner, no lunch, and is staffed by young “volunteers”. I personally felt like the dinners were very overpriced (around $13.00), but the breakfast was good ($5.50 includes drinks/coffee). There is also a really good hostel style kitchen, so it would be better to bring your own food and cook here. In general the young volunteer staff was kind of the downside, they were a bit unorganized and unhelpful during my stay. 

The Wi-Fi works well in the main lodge/restaurant but does not extend to the cabins. I was able to park my motorcycle right at the base of the lodge in a safe spot off to the side. There is only parking for about 3 cars (one spot up top, two down at the base of the driveway) so I don’t feel like this place is 4wheel overlander friendly, but you could probably squeeze several motos in here depending on size. Fun fact, I’m pretty sure Itchy Boots stayed here too!

The highlight besides the beautiful location, sound of the ocean at night, and peaceful atmosphere, is that there is a tame injured Toucan that lives near the lodge, and comes to visit in the mornings. He was super sweet and you are able to see him very upclose, which is amazing. There are also howler monkeys & hummingbirds around.

name: Panama Kite Center
description:
Panama Kite Center is a kiteboarding school in Front of the lagoon. 

The owner, Florian, is German and welcomes overlanders to stay on the grounds. 

They have glamping and studios in remodeled shipping containers. They have a great restaurant and fast wifi. 

They are open from October to May.

name: Photocopier and printer
description: A good place if you want to check off your copies for the shipping before you arrive in Panama City. Very friendly and passionate owner are handling three printers at the same time. Highly recommend! Easy parking in front of the store or you can find even more space a little bit further (see pictures).

name: Jumiti spot
description: Nice and leveled place to park during the night and the day. Close to the center. Quiet at night.

name: Auto mart
description:
Auto parts store. Possible to find parts for RV Ford 2002

Magasin de pièces automobiles. Possible de trouver des pièces  pour RV Ford 2002

name: Cerro iguana trail
description: Beautiful hiking on the ridges. 10km and 500 meters of positive elevation gain. Quite technical trail. Magnificent view. Free. Little frequented. Itinerary available on all trail

name: Playa De Los Olivos
description:
Great sandy Beach small waves but good for swimming. Has a fonda run by a great couple, the food was excellent and great a price.  Toilet available as well as cold showers and running water. A few dogs here so probably pet friendly.  Phone service tigo and Claro good at the beach and sometimes in the parking.
You can walk for hours on the beach.  Lots of parking space.  Space for tents but di not ask if permitted.   Some families on Sunday, during the week quiet with very few people.

name: Lavanderia y lavamatico Margarita
description:
Pressing and Laundry automatic and dry.
0,75 B /Laundry  and 0,25 B / 6 Minutes dryer

name: 11 shop
description:
There is a water spigot just on the right of a store.
We ask the employee and it was ok to fill our tank

name: Agartha Hostel and camping
description: You're able to camp on the front lawn next to the tents that are part of the hostel. having your own tent is at a reduced rate. The owners are extremely hospitable and friendly.

name: Camping Familia Tuñon
description:
The beautiful and small campsite is owned by a lovely old lady, surrounded only by houses of the family, it's safe and nice. It is located directly at the lake, you can swim in the morning and you are supposedly allowed to fish, which may be served as dinner if you ask!
The campsite is open all year, but you should call first. Be aware that the owners only speak spanish! A stay varies from 10 to 12 Dollars/Night/Person, Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner is available if you ask.
The shower and toilet are very basic, but exist.
Don't know about WIFI, but I think there is none.
The daughter Isabel owns a small shuttleboat which will get you over the lake.

- Tents Only (otherwise ask)
- 10-12 Dollars
- Call first
- Only Spanish
- Basic Shower/Toilet
- Food if asked
- Boatshuttle available

name: Jams’ House
description:
Family house with a large perimeter area where you can camp quietly, comfortably and safely. It has a strategic location where it is easy to visit places like the Panama Canal, Panama City or Portobello (Colón). 
Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner is available if you ask.

tel. +507 69906925  Whatsapp  (text me before you arrive).

name: Overland Embassy
description:
Official Campground by The Overland Embassy in Panama City

This space is open 24/7 and it's available to ALL TRAVELERS. You can use these facilities to safely camp in the middle of Panama City, prepare your vehicle before / after shipping, connect with fellow travelers and enjoy good times with us!

WiFi, Showers, Restrooms, Space for Big Rigs and Pet Friendly.

Open 24/7 - Daily and Monthly Options - Storage Available

name: Ray Lawkin's place
description: Ray Lawkin owns this house and offers secure parking and rooms to moto travellers. Room is air-conditioned with bathroom. Ray and his son are super friendly. I paid $25 for a night plus $10 for parking my moto (2 calendar days). There is space next to the house that might fit a van or 4x4. Call before you come to check availability: +50768332116. Good place to overnight if you are waiting for the ferry to Bocas del Toro.

name: Museo Parque Archeológico EL CAÑO
description:
This is the entrance to the archeological site El Caño.
It’s about 3-4 km off the highway. On the the way to here, I just saw one sign for the site. So just follow the road until you are here.

name: Water Faucet at Texaco Gas Station
description: There is a water faucet in the back of the parking lot of the gas station. you can park there chillymilly. Good pressure

name: Diana's Place
description:
A friendly little guesthouse run by Diana adjacent to her house. It is a simple double bedroom + bathroom with a nice terrace out front with hammocks and a table. She was happy for us to use her kitchen. 

She is preparing to open fully later this year (2023) and is doing some finishing touches right now. 

$20 per night for 2 people - great value. She also did a load of washing for us and let us use her WiFi. Very smiley & friendly lady. We were referred to her by the fonda/restaurant 500m along the road.

She keeps 2 parrots who are also very chatty and entertaining!

Just turn up or message her on +507-6283-9525 in advance. Its the house with the white double gate opposite the bus stop.

name: La Estrella Country Club
description:
An extremely large swimming pool .  Serves drinks and food on weekends.  During the week we were by ourselves.
Large grassy area, any size rig.  Also good for tents.  They have water, bathrooms, outdoor showers. Free Wi-Fi.
Very friendly owners, Jennifer and Augustin.
Location minutes from groceries, restaurants, stores.
charged us for the pool and we stayed free for the night.

name: Ferry Scam
description:
Be vigilant.  There are scammers at the port who will tell you a lot of lies.  You do not pay in the line or for the line (reservation).  Only pay when you about to board to the people who have a reciept to give.  
They got us this time....

name: Canal Inn
description:
Great place to escape the heat, private room with AC $45. Pet friendly, parking in front for any size rig. Swimming pool! Very secure! Across from the Maritime University of Panama, 24 hr security!
Super friendly staff!
Stayed here 5 nights
Franz: +507 6612 7168

name: cajero
description: An ATM on the outside of the bank, 6.50 transaction fee for foreign banks. Big blue sign by the street

name: Queseria Dn Arcielo
description: Nice small gift shop on the side of the road with liters of milk, yogurt, cheese and other sweets. Bathrooms. Free Wi-Fi and air conditioning!

name: Santa Rosa de Lima Church
description: No parking space so probably only for bikers. Concrete covered area next to church with tap water that sometimes works and a pit toilet. We camped here when it started pouring rain, but didn’t find anyone to ask, so don’t know if it’s okay. No one bothered us. Very quiet night.

name: Water faucet in the park
description: Water faucet in the central plaza, next to the municipal building. We asked locals and it is potable.

name: Parking of the hike
description:
You can sleep here after you do the hike to Los Picachos Ola. Not big rig friendly (we almost didn’t drive through the gate as we are very wide (2m3). 
It’s 2$ per person to hike and 5$ for the van to sleep (no toilet or shower)
4G +Movil
FYI: we couldn’t reach the summit as one of us has height fears. The end is like climbing on an edge..

name: el espacio la cueva
description:
this is an amazing little training gym for rock climbing. two owners, amazing people, o e owner was a professional dancer and she wants to have classes here if she finds people interested. they sell drinks and you can see the hours on Google maps!
there are more photos on google maps. safe area

name: Ruta 71 Cerveza
description: Craft Beer - Really Good!!!! One beer they make themselves, and a selection of other Panamanian craft beers. Best beer since we left the states. Good food too! Owner Benjamin is a Panamanian who lived in the states for 15 years, speaks great English, and is a serious beer enthusiast.

name: Photocopies - Distribuidora Manley
description: 25 cents a copy at this place. Handwritten sign on door. Must have a paper copy to hand them, can't take electronic files. Great if you are staying in Casco Viejo before shipping.

name: Catalina’s Hideaway
description: Nice place to stay in cabins on the water. It costs approximately $50 per person per night with all amenities and air conditioning.

name: Selina
description: Selina is a hostel developed by a young group that now have hostels all over the world. There are two that I know of in Panama, one here in Pedasi and the other in Boquete.

name: Receta Michilá
description: Very nice restaurant in Bocas. Not cheap, but not that expensive. Great menu. Prices: 13-19 USD. The pulpo and the Cucú are just excellent.

name: San Blas Islands best Sailboat recommendation
description:
we spent 4 days and nights on the sailing boat at the San blas Islands with the couple Fabiana (Argentinia) and Danilo (Brasilia). If you are in Panama, you shouldnt miss the San Blas Islands and a Sailboat Trip with them! it was beautiful and just amazing.  its so nice to talk to them, the Campers have almost the same "life" and "problems" like the Sailers :) just on the roadside of life.
highly recommend and worth every penny. Instagram: @anemoi.sailing
Her Phonenumber; +507 6427-6881

name: MECHANIC - MOVILIZE
description:
Taller Movilize is ready to help and support fellow travelers. 

We offer mechanic diagnostics, repairs and upgrades for your vehicle. Spare parts, filters, oils, tires, batteries, etc. 

Specialist on Japanese, European and American Cars/Trucks/Motorcycles

Big rig friendly, Wi-Fi, toilets, waiting room with TV/Netflix/YouTube and A/C

name: Fedpa Los Pueblos
description: insurance, walkable from the aduana to extend TIP. copy place next door. the traffic was bad so I parked as soon as I pulled into the plaza in front of supermarket. then left car there. total took 30 min for renewal and insurance and walking to both.

name: Lavamatico Yumitzi
description:
Clean Laundry Lady speeks perfekt englisch .
Wasching $1.00
Dryer          $0.75

name: Santa Isabel Central Park
description: Town square parking, accepts any size rig, flat, safe, plenty of night lights, nearby phone, grocery, and general stores.  Lots of dining options.  Away from busy and noisy Pan Am highway.  Police OKed our overnight stay.

name: Delta station
description: This Delta gas station has signs for bathrooms, showers and a laundromat. It is  lean. paved and has a good amount of space for rigs of all sizes and may be acceptable for short term camping upon request addressed to the attendants.

name: Quiet Neighborhood Street Parking
description: Quiet side street very close to town with plenty of room to pull off the road. Easy walking to shops.

name: Parking On Wide Street
description: Free street parking between cemetery and school.  Very little vehicle traffic.  Stores and village water plant nearby.  Short walk to swinging bride.

name: Village Water Plant
description: Free drinking water, roadside hose provided for filling your tank or gugs.

name: Road side
description: It’s an excellent option to stay the night and leave the motorhome for doing the trekking to Volcán Baru. The road to come here is asphalt. Next to this point, there is another option in the national park entrance, but the road it’s horrible. So, our recommendation is stay here.

name: Voyager Int’l Hostel Panama La VIlla de Los Santos
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

The hostel is a cozy colonial house conveniently located in the center of the town of La Villa de Los Santos, Los Santos Province, Panama. We offer shared accommodation with shared bathrooms, ideal for budget travelers and groups. Common living room and kitchen. Free parking, WIFI, sheets and towels. Breakfast is offered at an additional cost.

name: río altos de pacora
description:
beautiful place on the bank of the river flat and clean
------
lugar hermoso a la orilla del río plano y limpio

name: Casa Comunal Los Algarrobos
description:
Casa Comunal in a small town. They allowed us to sleep (tent) big roof, toilet and water tap (not sure if it's potable, provably yes like all Panama). we are two bike travellers. Wifi from the restaurant next to it, polemesa01
@mamamiradondeestoy

name: Xtra Supermarket water tap
description:
There’s a water tap at the supermarket Xtra.
This is on the parking. Clear water !

name: IWanna Green
description:
Cool little spot for camping or to have a nice room with good facilities. The owners are super-friendly and let you stay in their garden. They grow their own veggies etc. There is a small but very nice swimming pool. 
Rooms are clean. They serve tasty food and cocktails.
We paid $35 for a double room with breakfast included. Little gem. Whatsapp 6601-4112

name: Malí Communal 'Rancho'
description:
(Bicycle touring)

Asked 4+ locals for permission to camp here and they all said it was permitted and safe. It is a large concrete-covered area just along the highway. 

I was given permission to use the outdoor sink partway up the drive way towards the school building (immediately north of the covered area).

10-15 local children were very interested in what I was doing, and watched me set up camp, cook, and eat. Obviously there are highway noises.

No bathroom, so I left early in the morning to find a place.

name: - Brisas del Mirador- Apartamentos Independientes Panama - Full Naturaleza
description:
We have accommodation totally independent apartments with capacity for 5 people where you will find:

- Main room: 1 double bed
- Second room: 1 cabin (lower part double bed - upper part single bed)
-Hall
-Dining room
-Bathroom
-Kitchen with utensils
-Fridge
Value per night
2 Person                       $25
Additional person    $10

-If you prefer, you can park and stay inside your own RV with entitlement to a shower and toilet 
Value per night
2 Person                            $ 12
Additional person          $ 5

-WIDE PARKING for any type of  VEHICLES -MOTORHOMES,-CARAVANS - MOTORCYCLES
-Sanitation discharge station... Please note this service is provided if you have booked a minimum of 3 nights with us

-Cozy place - Tranquility to carry out your telework - Good breeze - Good shade - Cool nights
-Located on a hill with a very good view, 400 meters from a main avenue called Transísmica that leads from Panama City to the Free Zone of the Port of Colón, and at the same distance in time from both the Atlantic and Pacific seas.

- Family atmosphere
-Spacious, quiet spaces, full of nature where you can enjoy with your pets

We provide the following services:
-We can support you with round trip to and from the airport.
- Car rental at a very good price.
- Guide so you can get to know Panama City and Panama.
-We carry out the process of sending your vehicles, whether motorhome, car or motorcycle from Panama - Colombia...... Colombia - Panama
- Transportation service from or to the airports or customs while you send or pick up your vehicle

-Please write me if you require more information my cell number 507 67453387 - Andres Vasquez



Disponemos de apartamentos de alojamiento totalmente independientes con capacidad para 5 personas donde encontrarás:

- Habitación principal: 1 cama doble
- Segunda habitación: 1 camarote (parte inferior cama doble - parte superior cama individual)
-Sala
-Comedor
-Baño
-Cocina con menaje
-Refrigerador
Valor por noche
2 Personas                     $ 25
Persona  adicional     $ 10

-Si lo prefiere, puede estacionar y quedarse dentro de su propia casa rodante con derecho a ducha e inodoro 
Valor por noche
2  Personas                 $ 12 
Persona adicional     $ 5

-AMPLIO PARQUEADERO para cualquier tipo de VEHÍCULOS -AUTOCARAVANAS,-CARAVANAS - MOTOS

-Estación de descarga de saneamiento... Tenga en cuenta que este servicio se brinda si ha reservado un mínimo de 3 noches con nosotros

-Lugar acogedor - Tranquilidad para realizar tu teletrabajo - Buena brisa - Buena sombra - Noches frescas
-Ubicado en una loma con muy buena vista, a 400 metros de una avenida principal llamada Transísmica que conduce desde la Ciudad de Panamá a la Zona Franca del Puerto de Colón, y a la misma distancia en el tiempo tanto del mar Atlántico como del Pacífico.

- Ambiente familiar
-Espacios amplios, tranquilos, llenos de naturaleza donde podrás disfrutar con tus mascotas

Proveemos los siguientes servicios:
-Podemos apoyarte con el viaje de ida y vuelta desde y hacia el aeropuerto.
- Alquiler de coches a muy buen precio.
- Guía para que puedas conocer la Ciudad de Panamá y Panamá.
-Realizamos el proceso de envío de sus vehículos, ya sea motorhome, carro o moto desde Panamá - Colombia...... Colombia - Panamá
- Servicio de transporte desde o hacia los aeropuertos o aduanas mientras envías o recoges tu vehículo

-Por favor escribeme si requires mas informacion mi número de celular 507 67453387   -  Andres Vasquez

name: Ngäbe Lodge & Camping
description:
Huge place, right on the long beah. Clean and well-kept garden area. Five outdoor showers, clean toilets. Some of the shady palapas are still under construction. Roy, the owner speaks fluent German but unfortunately is working abroad most of the year. But he has a caretaker who can be reached by cell phone (+507 61667727) and who opens and closes the campsite. We felt very comfortable and stayed four nights. Next door is a small hotel with a restaurant and bar where we had a delicious meal. This campsite is highly recommended! 
The Café and Lodges are still under construction.
10,00 $ per night.

name: Skybar with nice view
description: Skybar, Happy Hour wednesday, thursday, friday. Nice view, they also have a pool and a shower.

name: Terpel
description: Large terpel gas station with gasoline and diesel.

name: Pototos
description:
Restaurant with "comida del dia". Simple but tasty and very affordable: $4.25. Fast service because the food is already cooked.

Near it there is also a car wash with the same name.

name: El Sabrosito
description: Affordable Panamanian restaurant. Lunch is around $4-7 per person. Parking right in front.

name: Police Check Point
description: Police Checkpoint on the road to Mariato and Morrillo Beach. The exact spot might differ a bit. Police officer asked for the drivers license and date of entry to Panama.

name: Hostel Buena Esperanza
description:
Mrs Mercedez is very well received! very friendly and attentive. 5 bedrooms, serves meals and also has a communal kitchen. Mrs. Mercedez gives you a very good welcome! very kind and helpful. 5 rooms, serves food and also has a community kitchen.
Mrs Mercedez welcomes you very well! very friendly and helpful. 5 rooms, serves meals and also has a communal kitchen.
Sra Mercedez recebe muito bem! muito simpática e atenciosa. 5 quartos, serve refeição e, também tem cozinha comunitária. ¡Sra Mercedez les da la bienvenida muy bien!  muy amable y servicial.  5 habitaciones, sirve comidas y también tiene una cocina comunitaria.
Sra Mercedez welcomes you very well!  very friendly and helpful.  5 rooms, serves meals and also has a communal kitchen.

name: police station
description:
Need a place to sleep between Fortuna and Boquete.  very pleasant temperature, but a little noisy due to the traffic of trucks.  I felt very safe
Necesita un lugar para dormir entre Fortuna y Boquete.  Temperatura muy agradable, aunque un poco ruidosa por el tráfico de camiones.  me sentí muy seguro...

name: Caldera
description:
Beautiful space, free, with water and free WiFi, very quiet. Nice landscape, very clean.
---
Hermoso espacio,  libre, con agua y WiFi libre, muy tranquilo. Lindo paisaje, muy limpio.

name: Toll booth
description:
Toll booth when driving to/from Colon. You can pay in cash. For a regular vehicle it is $2.30.

I am adding this so that you know you can drive on this section and pay cash.

You need to enter/exit at the other marker on iOverlander.

name: GREAT MECHANICH "eco service and carwash "
description:
Alejandro from overland embassy recommended us this place. The owner is Heyken  and a sweet old lady from the U.S . 
The mechanich is Claudio, one of the most friendly, helpful and honest mechanich we have met!! 
We were in anton valley with an oil leak in our VW T4, so we came here and Claudio cleaned the engine, found where the leak came from, went to buy the part that we needed and fixed it. He is a mechanic engineer, very knowledgeable, he loves to meet and help travelers!! And we could not be more grateful!! 
+507 66578947 Mon-Fri 8 - 17hs.

name: Laundry at Terpel
description: One washer and one dryer at the Terpel gas station. They are inside towards the toilets.

name: las Lagunas del Volcan
description:
beautiful place, lots of birds, after 1 km from the entrance I only sweep 4x4s.

___________________________

lindo local, muitos passaros, após 1 km da portaria só varro 4x4.

name: La Casa Doña Cata Hostal
description: Nice affordable place to stay. In the city center, mix with locals and backpackers. In the weekend there is a bit if street noise from the bar, mainly in the evening not during the night. If you want avoid that ask for a room/dorm that is not on the street. No parking available, street parking. I parked my bicycle in the closed garden with a roof. Dorm from 13,5 dollars, privates available.

name: Hostal Casa las Lajas
description:
Decent modern place budget friendly hostel/hotel, just 2km from the  Carretera Panamericana. They have private rooms and a dorm. Showers with warm water, well equipped kitchen. Breakfast is included. Room has ventilators.

I paid 17 dollars for a private room with Booking.com Genius discount. Normal price on booking was 19 dollars and 15 for a dorm. All prices for 1 person, I guess. I was the only guest. 

My bicycle could stay on the terrace or in the locked kitchen, I used the last option. But both options felt safe.

It’s behind the gym with the same name, there is enough parking availability next to the hostel or the gym.

My advice contact them in advance or call them. There is no reception. Otherwise you might have to wait. 

http://hostalcasalaslajas.com/

name: Streetparking in the center
description: Gravel next to the road, enough room for all sizes of rigs to park here. Next to the church and across the national bank. Close to the park, restaurants, clubs and bars. No shade and noisy during the day. At night quiet. Good spot for sleeping in the van after going out. Felt safe as there is a guard working at the national bank.

name: Centro recreativo y turistico el mojao
description:
Simple hotel room with air conditioning. I paid 30 dollars for one person, they said 40 dollars on the phone which is probably the price for couples.

I was planning to camp before going to Puerto Carti. But the rain made me look for an hotel. It’s 7km past the turn to Puerto Carti en El Llano, if you’re coming from Panama. 

There was WiFi but I had to sit outside to use it. Lots of parking place outside. I dis put my bicycle in the room.

The onside restaurant was closed (off season). But there are others on walking distance.

name: Lavanderia Lavamatico
description: Perfect place ! Friendly owner and very clean. 5$ to clean and dry one basket (pretty big). Done in 2h. If you want to move she can put the clothes in the dryer for you.

name: Auto Servicio EJ
description: Fixed my Lexus LX470 / Toyota Landcruiser here. Pier runs this shop. He’s got an LC100. He’s Venezuelan and speaks fluent English. Very professional. Not expensive. Highly recommended. Pier Bonazzi WhatsApp +507 6088 5506

name: Llantería Jackson
description:
Very friendly treatment, good tires
Correct work
---------
Trato muy amable buenas llantas
Trabajo correcto

name: Delta Gas Station
description: I was in front of a supermarket in the evening (traveling by bicycle and was sheltering from the rain) when a man who works at this gas station came up to me and said I can sleep at this gas station. I got here and another staff welcomed me and took me behind the building where there was a small space with a roof. A good place if you are on a bicycle.

name: Bodhi hostel
description:
Really nice hostel, chill vibes, pool and breakfast included.
They also take volunteers!

name: Calipso iHostal
description: Really nice hostel. got a private room with ac and private bath shower and one double bed and two bunks for 25 bucks. Right in the middle of town.

name: Joe's Layover Hostel Boquete
description:
Joes Layover Hostel, Boquete

Welcome to Joes Layover Hostel, your haven for RV travelers in the picturesque town of Boquete, Panama. Nestled amidst the stunning landscapes of the Chiriquí Highlands, this hostel offers a welcoming retreat for those exploring Panama's natural beauty by road.

Conveniently situated with easy access to Boquete's charming town center and its surrounding attractions, Joes Layover Hostel provides a convenient stopover for RV travelers passing through or looking to immerse themselves in the wonders of Boquete.

At Joes Layover Hostel, RV enthusiasts will find spacious and well-equipped facilities designed to accommodate their needs. Ample parking space is available for RVs of all sizes, with easy maneuverability and convenient hook-up options for water and electricity.

The hostel's amenities cater to the comfort and convenience of RV travelers, with clean and modern restroom facilities, laundry services, and a cozy common area where guests can relax and exchange travel tales. Friendly staff are always on hand to offer assistance and local insights, ensuring a memorable and stress-free stay for all guests.

Boquete's breathtaking natural attractions, including hiking trails, hot springs, and coffee plantations, are just a short drive away from Joes Layover Hostel, making it the perfect home base for RV explorations in the region.

Whether you're embarking on a cross-country adventure or simply seeking a tranquil retreat amidst Panama's stunning landscapes, Joes Layover Hostel welcomes RV travelers with open arms, promising a memorable and enjoyable experience in Boquete.

name: Scullys House
description:
Nice and funky hostel/hotel right on the beach with a Pool, Bar, different food stalls, kitchen, fridge, little convenience store, good wifi, hammocks....
Dorm bed without AC 10 USD
Dorm bed with AC 15 USD.
The dorms are nicely done, not just bunk beds, but more of a treehouse kind of vibe with beds in different corners and levels of the room all connected with stairs. Really well thought out rooms, also a lot of big lockers (fit all our motorbike luggage) and each dorm has an attached bathroom with hot and cold showers.

We could park our motorcycles in the Workshop and would have even been alowed to use the Workshop if needed, just talk to the owner, he's a great guy, super friendly.

There's also a few event throughout the week (beer pong tournament, pool (billard) tournament, drink specials and so on. Also a free welcome shot. But still not a loud or rowdy place at night, simply stricking a great balance for us.

Great Value place, highly recommended.

name: Multiservicio Santa Fe - Lavamatico y Copias
description: Great same day laundry service! Wash $0.75, Dry $1.25, Detergent $0.50. Clothes cleaned and folded and Alvaro the owner had some great recommendations for spots to visit near town.

name: euroschop
description:
mechanical repairs with the possibility of accommodation
reparaciónes mecánicas con posibilidad de alojamiento

 +50764184469 WHATSAPP ,SIGNAL, TELEGRAM

name: Fire Brigade
description:
Fire Department
Many friendly and helpful people.
Drinking water from the tap outside the building

Corpo de Bombeiros 
Muitos simpáticos e solícitos.
Água potável na torneira do lado de fora do prédio

name: Centro histórico
description:
Public parking in the historic center, very safe, with police patrols frequently. They didn't charge us anything.

estacionamento público no centro histórico, muito seguro, com ronda policial frequentemente. para nós não cobraram nada.

name: Policia
description:
They are used to receive bicycle tourers but nobody ever put a pin here.
Camped in their garden under roof. WC, shower inside. Power outlets under roof where we slept. Friendly staff. 
Small grocery store in front, next to church and centro de salud.
Next to policia there's a restaurant, we ate eggs, rice and beans.
Safe and free.

name: Nomada Republic Container Hotel
description: This is a good alternative to the Overland Embassy‘s Campground. Very cheap, 38 USD per night per room including breakfast and wifi. Huge parking area, even suitable for repairs on your vehicle. Great and quiet location.

name: Estacionamento no parque
Fonda Recreo
description:
This place is a restaurant -bar with large roof.
We (2 cyclers) asked for camping here: absolutely no problem. WC, power outlets, chairs, tables. Very friendly staff. Showered with bucket.

name: Jbike
description:
Jbike is a bicycle shop and repair, owned by Jethur, a 29y old super friendly guy who's passion is the bicycle mechanic.
I came with a quiet difficult problem in my dynamo hub and he fixed it. He doesn't simply replace stuff, he really checks the mechanics by passion. He also checked my gears and my rear hub. Replaced some stuff.
He checked the bicycle of my gf and fixed some stuff.
20$ in total for the work (we stayed a whole day in his shop from 10am to 5pm) and 20$ for some bearings.
I do recommend.


We eventually ate with him and camped next to his store.

His IG: @jethur13
His phone : 0050764337051

name: Jbike building
description:
This place is linked to another pin I made of bicycle mechanics of Jbike.

Jethur, of Jbike repaired my bicycle, offered me a shower at his shop and then we camped in the hallway, it was allowed by Jorge (the boss of the building). Both guys are SUPER friendly. Even if you don't need anything of the shop, I'm sure they will let you use the shower and camping.
WC downstairs at restaurant 24H (and in Jethur's shop).
Power outlets in hallway.
Free Wi-Fi at Jethur's shop.
Btw, Jethur is an AMAZING mechanic, check my other pin.
Jethur: @jethur13
00 507 6433-7051
Jorge: 00 507 6393-6034

name: finca Pití
description:
Translation: Place to rest in nature near a waterfall. space 1--2 campers

lugar para descansar en naturaleza cerca de cascada. espacio 1--2 campers

name: Bomberos
description:
Came here cycling (2 ppl).
Friendly staff that allowed us to pitch our tent under the roof. Access to WC but they close the door at night. So for n°1 in the garden, n°2 you have to ask they open the door.
Shower with bucket in the garden.
WiFi SAMER. I scanned a QR from the phone of the lady.
Chinese supermarket at 100m.
Made a fire in the garden to cook, there was already a fire pit.
Quiet noisy from the road and non stop light at night under the roof, but not in garden.
Overall ok. I would recommend it.

name: Cerro Ancón
description: Nice view on the City and on the Canal. There are also animals, we have seen some toucans, deers and agoutis. FREE.

name: Mercaco de Marisco
description: Fish market, nice to see and prices are good (fish, shrimp, octopus around 3$US a pound). Next to the market, it is possible to taste good ceviche.

name: Pacific lookout
description: Very nice lookout on the City. Enjoy the view by day, night or sunrise!

name: Hostal Camping la Y griega
description:
Beautiful hostel, full of plants that are literally creating a walls of this place, just 2 minutes walk from the beach.
They offer rooms and tents with comfortable mattresses for 10$, the best price on the island.
There is a fast WiFi, kitchen, shower ( everything you need, the owner Daniel is very nice too.
highly recommended

name: poachers end
description:
abandoned palapa - seems like from poachers idk- 4x4 on the whole area is a must- we tried to get on the end of the playa but couldn’t ignore the private property sign so this is it
solid lte, front row seats for the sunset and cool breeze at the shade of the palms (coconut is available)

name: Brisas del mar
description:
Id you don’t get the boat to Colombia—my case— and you have to slept in a cheap place this is your place. 
10$ per room. Most cheap on Obaldia. 
No internet. No hot water. No kitchen.
A bed with bathroom and shower… 
Basic… nice.
Owner Lucho.

name: PANADERIA LEYDIS
description:
Amazing place to share with local people… 
Wifi, good hojaldres and coffee!

name: bomberos water tap
description: left side of the building is a small red yellow shed with the tap inside - if the hood is locked ask the guys ofc inside

name: Eco Park - Via Boquete
description: We tried to find a place and it proved impossible in this area so we asked the guys next to the water plant in the maintained garden if it’s okay to camp here for a night and they said „yes“. Donations were not accepted.

name: Magic Mountain Lodge B&B
description: very beautiful new hotel with ample parking for vehicles, including owner let me park in his garage.  Owners are from Germany and breakfast was traditionally German breakfast with eggs,  fruits and toasts with cheese and jellies.  large swimming pool.  very fast wifi,  actual hot showers ,  cold a/c in rooms.  cost was just $45 including breakfast. highly recommended

name: Sendero La Laguna
description:
Here a nice trail through the rainforest is starting. It’s only 1,5km long - so take your time. If you are lucky you can see, sloths, monkeys etc. (We were not lucky, but friends of us saw two sloths and even more monkeys!)
And the best: It is for free!

name: CHEAP NEW CLOTHES "FASHION TEN"
description:
The name is Fashion Ten, there are other locations in the city. 
Here you can find very cheap new clothes for women, kids and a little section for men. 
For example I bought a blue jean $4, a sweater $4,  there's also swimwear and a lot of clothes for this hot weather and you can try them on. No mountain gear.

name: BEST MECHANIC IN PANAMA
description:
TALLER SERVIMOVIL. 
The owner is Juan, he is from Uruguay, really good person and mechanic, very knowledgeable. He helped us a lot working on our VW T4. He let us sleep in the garage. He went to buy parts for us and worked very quickly. They also do body and paint works. For anything you have to fix, come here no doubt. 
Whatsapp: +507 6530 2080
~
El dueño es Juan, uruguayo, excelente persona y mecanico de toda la vida. Nos ayudó muchisimo arreglando nuestra VW T4. Nos permitió dormir en el taller. Fue a comprar repuestos por nosotros y trabajó super rapido. Tambien hacen chapa y pintura. Cualquier arreglo que tengas que hacer veni aca sin dudarlo. Whatsapp: +507 6530 2080

name: Free cold showers at sportfield
description: 2 ,open air’ showers next to a sportfield. Showered a few times here. Nice pressure and clean water . Enjoy

name: On the street
description:
We stayed on the side street, which we thought was better than the exact spot marked here. We spent 1 night. There were no problems, no one passed by, only in the morning some people came to get water from a water spout next to this point. We don't know if the water is drinkable, because we don't need to get it. 4G signal from móvil, no one showed up at the construction site, even though it was Tuesday. No other facilities around. Totally silent.
____

We stayed on the side street, which we thought was better than the exact spot marked here. We spent 1 night. There were no problems, no one passed by, only in the morning some people came to get water from a water spout next to this point. We don't know if the water is drinkable, because we don't need to get it. 4G signal from +móvil, no one showed up at the construction site, even though it was Tuesday. No other facilities around. Quiet.

name: cyber cafe chame
description:
Computers to use by the hour, copies, super friendly

Computadoras a usar p/hora, copias, muy agradable

name: Mechanics With A Mission
description:
Marco runs a clean tidy shop and inspires confidence with his calm thoughtful demeanor. He speaks fluent English and only takes on jobs he knows he can do. We had a torn up oil plug which they removed very cleanly with some great difficulty.  Their lift has a capacity of 5500 kilos and they handled our 21. Ft/6.4m Promaster with a height of 2.8m/9ft. 
There is plenty of room to park, an air conditioned lounge and you can watch them work. He carries some parts for popular local vehicles.

name: Delta fuel station
description: this is a new fuel station we could sleep here before going to Costa Rica. also cheap place to refill or stock up your fuel before or after the expensive CR. has shower and toilet, very friendly stuff, 24/7 quiet, safe and for free.

name: Konsenda San Blas
description:
We camped here on bikes on our way to puerta carti. $5 pp for one night. Camped in an open air structure with a floor and a roof. There’s also Cabañas for rent here. 
They offered us dinner for $7 pp
The owner was super responsive on WhatsApp

name: H2O Clean Lavanderia
description:
Laundry that is exceptionally clean inside.  It’s open 24/7. 
Wash $1.75 Dry $2.00 There are also larger machines available. It is in a small shopping center right off Pan American Hwy.

name: Bus station
description:
Large square right next to the bus station.  Fairly quiet at night.  The place was recommended to us by the police because it is not far from the police station.  Toilets available during the day at the bus station (0.35).  Free.  1.3 km from the small boat pier

Grande place juste à côté de la gare de bus. Assez calme la nuit. L'endroit nous a été conseillé par la Police car il n'est pas loin du commissariat. Toilettes disponibles la journée à la station de bus (0.35). Gratuit. A 1,3 Km de l'embarcadère des petits bateaux.

name: Insurance Panama
description: Insurance office in a container. 25 USD for one month insurance for Panama .

name: Kotowa bar free wifi
description: Free open wifi available. Speed is OK. Available from the parking in front of the bar

name: Transporte AF Truck Workshop
description: They have or can supply all parts of trucks (MAN, Mercedes, Scania, Volvo, Iveco). Very good service. Good prices and nice people. Feels almost German here ;-)

name: El Tablazo resto wifi
description:
This is the bar restaurant El Tablazo, near the marina.
Wi-Fi is quite good.

name: cascada chorrillito
description:
beautiful two leveled waterfall with pool in the middle/ top section 
the first level is easy accessible with any kind off vehicle but the second level is only for skilled rig: very steep and extremely rocky sharp turns through river bed then „high up like a rocket to the sky“ road with humps & dumps
(We took the road from San Jose- the locals call it „camino fatal“)
we had totally calm days, nobody bothered us, some horses & cows are roaming around 
The water is clear and not so deep
no signal no facilities no bugs (only lil scorpions at night but they are minding their business)

name: How leaving Panama with a pet
description:
Tips for dog owners to do Panama - Cartagena:

 We are a French couple with a 16kg dog, and we are traveling the Pan-American Highway by car.

 Arriving in Panama City, we had to put the car in the container and find plane tickets for our dog.  We wanted to follow the rules and put our dog in a crate, and that crate would be in the hold of a plane.

 We therefore completed all the administrative procedures (see the Ioverlander red point "exit visa for dog", where I described the process to obtain a certificate of good health and an export permit from MIDA).

 We wanted to travel with the low-cost airline Wingo, but when we went to the airport counter, we were told that they did not take dogs in the hold on the plane.

 We inquired about Avianca, but it's complicated and there is necessarily an extra stopover and the flight lasts more than 5 hours.

 Finally, we contacted Copa Airlines.  But we had to deal with totally incompetent, mean people who didn't help us at all, on the contrary.  Only correspondence by e-mail is possible (it is not possible to reserve or obtain information for the dog at a counter or by telephone).
 But the Copa Cargo people take many hours to respond to our messages, and never clearly answer our questions.
 Basically, you had to fill out at least 10 forms and send them so that they could request authorization to put the dog on a very specific flight early in the morning between Monday and Thursday (you have to anticipate and make the request at least 1  week before to get the answer, otherwise impossible to book your own flight because there is the risk that there will be no more places!) And finally do a pre-check at the cargo area of ​​Tocumen airport the  day before departure...

 For a 16 kg dog and an 8 kg cage, we were asked $239!  Not to mention other unloading taxes, the cost of taxi/Uber, etc... not to mention the fact that we also had to pay handling fees on the Colombian side: $55 + $89...

 In short, after 3 days without progress and without clear answers, we abandoned this option with Copa.  We had heard of travelers who had passed off their dog (over 10 kg) as an emotional support dog.  Basically, the traveler needs his dog in the cabin with him to feel good and not be too stressed...
 We therefore followed this path to obtain an emotional support dog certificate from a psychologist (for humans).  Obviously, it's a business for them because in 10 minutes of consultation, they earn $100 in cash... but it remains a profitable investment because the Wingo company accepts emotional support dogs in the cabin for free!  All you need to do is produce the certificate.

 So I booked my ticket online, and I added the assistance dog (this can be done either when purchasing the ticket in the special options, or via a free whastapp chat).  We may be asked to take an option to reserve a seat with extra foot room ($33 extra) to put the dog down, but this is not safe.

 All you have to do is go to the baggage check-in counter on the day of the flight with the emotional support certificate and the dog's valid papers and you're good to go!

 For us, it was extremely complicated to buy our tickets because twice, I received an email automatically canceling my reservation on the grounds that the 2 bank cards that I had used (visa credit card then visa debit card)  were likely to have been used fraudulently, which was of course not the case.

 To summarize, I was almost forced to take a morally questionable, but almost necessary, path.  It cost us around $500 to do Panama - Cartagena, with 2 adults, 1 dog and obtaining the psychologist's paper.  Another French couple did the same thing as us on the same flight, and a German had done the same the week before.
 We are left with a very bad impression of Panama, too bad.

 Good luck for the next ones, because you will need some.  Don’t hesitate to give me feedback on our globtrailers insta 
------------------------

Conseils aux propriétaires de chien pour faire Panama - Carthagène: 

Nous sommes un couple de français avec un chien de 16Kg, et on parcourt en voiture la route Panaméricaine. 

Arrivés à Panama City, nous avons dû mettre la voiture dans le container et trouver des billets d'avion pour notre chien. Nous voulions respecter les règles et mettre notre chien dans une cage, et cette cage serait dans la soute d'un avion. 

On a donc fait toutes les démarches administratives (voir le point rouge Ioverlander "exit visa for dog", où j'ai décrit le processus pour obtenir un certificat de bonne santé et un permis d'exportation au MIDA). 

On voulait voyager avec ma compagnie lowcost Wingo, mais en allant au guichet de l'aéroport, on nous a dit qu'ils ne prenaient pas les chiens en soute dans l'avion. 

On s'est renseigné sur Avianca, mais c'est compliqué et il y a forcément une escale en plus et le vol dure plus de 5 heures. 

Enfin, on a pris contact avec Copa Airlines. Mais on a eu affaire à des gens totalement incompétents, méchants, qui ne nous ont pas du tout aidé, au contraire. Seuls les correspondances par e-mail sont possibles (pas possible de réserver ou d'avoir des informations pour le chien à un guichet ou par téléphone).
Mais les gens de Copa Cargo mettent de nombreuses heures à répondre à nos messages, et ne répondent jamais clairement à nos questions.
En gros, il fallait remplir au moins 10 formulaires, leur transmettre pour qu'ils demandent l'autorisation pour mettre le chien dans un vol bien précis tôt le matin entre le lundi et le jeudi (il faut anticiper et faire la demande au moins 1 semaine avant pour avoir la réponse, sinon impossible de réserver notre propre vol car il y a le risque qu'il n'y ait plus de place!) Et enfin faire un pré-check à la zone cargo de l'aéroport de Tocumen la veille du départ... 

Pour un chien de 16 Kg et une cage de 8 Kg, on nous demandait 239$! Sans parler d'autres taxes de déchargement, du coût du taxi / Uber, etc... sans parler du fait qu'il fallait aussi payer en plus des frais de manutention côté Colombie: 55$ + 89$... 

Bref, au bout de 3 jours sans avancées et sans réponses claires, on a abandonné cette option avec Copa. On avait entendu parler de voyageurs qui avaient fait passer leur chien (de plus de 10 Kg) pour un chien de support émotionnel. En gros, le voyageur a besoin de son chien en cabine avec lui pour se sentir bien et ne pas être trop stressé... 
On a donc suivi cette voie pour obtenir auprès d'un psychologue (pour humains) un certificat de chien de support émotionnel. Évidemment, c'est un business pour eux car en 10mn de consultation, ils gagnent 100$ en liquide... mais ça reste un investissement rentable car la compagnie Wingo accepte gratuitement les chiens de support émotionnel en cabine! Il suffit de produire le certificat. 

J'ai donc réservé sur internet mon billet, et j'ai ajouté le chien d'assistance (ça peut se faire soit lors de l'achat du billet dans les options spéciales, soit via un tchat whastapp gratuit). Il peut nous être demandé de prendre une option pour réserver un siège avec de l'espace supplémentaire pour les pieds (33 $ en plus) afin de coucher le chien, mais ce n'est pas sûr. 

Il suffit alors simplement de se présenter au guichet d'enregistrement des bagages le jour du vol avec le certificat de support émotionnel, les papiers en règle du chien et c'est bon!
